column3: Issue Title
column4: Issue Details

column3: Fixes an issue that was causing the per recipient notification sound ‚Ä¶
column4: ‚Ä¶to not be able to be set to "none" and "default" was functioning as none.  Fixes #7115   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Nexus 5X, Android 8.0.0  * Virtual Device Samsung S8, Android 7.1.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  FREEBIE ----------  ### Description  The original error was that users were not able to set "none" for the per recipient notification sound. Upon investigation I found that the app was setting the "default" uri to null which caused issues because the default uri on devices isn't null and is valid while none corresponds to a null uri. This makes sense too because the default sound plays noise therefore must have a uri that references the sound file on the device while the none setting doesn't play any noise and so can have a null uri.

column3: Remove race condition that prevents incoming calls from ringing
column4: ‚Ä¶hone and ringtone playing through speakerphone, fixes #6356, #6406   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Moto E, Android 5.1  * Moto G4, Android 7.0 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  There is a race condition between IncomingRinger turning the speakerphone on to play the ringtone and WebRtcCallActivity, which disables and unchecks the "speakerphone" button on the call screen during an incoming call. If your phone can create and display the dialog quickly enough for it to needlessly turn the speakerphone off before IncomingRinger turns the speakerphone on, you get a ringtone. If it takes your phone too long to wake up, create the lockscreen, and then bring up the dialog, then no ringtone (or a very brief ringtone) for you.  This patch removes the "unchecking" of the control buttons for speakerphone, bluetooth, videomute, and audiomute when there's an incoming call. They're still disabled, but they're left in the default states so no extra events get thrown to the listeners.  Sorry for the duplicate PR,  I hadn't authorized the CLA to sync to my github account on the first PR

column3: A better dark theme
column4: Yes, I want to commit this the official way, but I'm missing directions for this. I'd like to submit a -in my view- much better dark color theme, but it's not clear where it needs to go in the Signal code-tree. For now I would rather just submit the range of colors for it, so someone with clear access can add it as an extra optional theme.  - We all have 24 bit color screens on our Android systems. The current Signal themes, aside from them not offering a lot of visual appeal, are not even all that legible: White on light red, white text on tan brown, really? I can't imagine Moxie would have signed for that to be the main dark theme, or did he?  - Here's a theme I once created for Squirrelmail, which I still use a lot because of its simplicity, and because this theme is so easy on the eyes, with good contrast and reminiscing of being in nature, think dark forest, fireflies, [Twin Peaks](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJFCmrB4hr_mBMwzg3vGrsQ/videos). I would imagine the several mildly differing dark greens could function as the backgrounds for the message bubbles, and the yellow-green-ish color[8] should be perfect for the text on them. Lots better than what it is now. In fact, some in my surroundings have simply stopped using Signal because of its dark theme, while the same people are still using this dark theme on my webmail-servers; ``` $color[0]   = '#092003'; // TitleBar $color[1]   = '#DDFEAB'; // Quote in mail $color[2]   = '#FECF10'; // Warning/Error Messages $color[3]   = '#041001'; // Left Bar Background $color[4]   = '#030900'; // Normal Background $color[5]   = '#102903'; // Table Headers $color[6]   = '#C3CEAC'; // Text on left bar (user created folders/Purge etc.) $color[7]   = '#CEEFAC'; // Links (also email-addresses) $color[8]   = '#EFFEDE'; // Normal text $color[9]   = '#091902'; // Darker version of #0 $color[10]  = '#081800'; // Darker version of #9 $color[11]  = '#CCDDC0'; // Special Folders color $color[12]  = '#182907'; // Alternate color for message list $color[13]  = '#DEFDAF'; // Color for quoted text -- > 1 quote $color[14]  = '#BDEFA1'; // Color for quoted text -- >> 2 or more $color[15]  = '#163011'; // Unselectable folders $color[16]  = '#F0CD09'; // Highlight color ```  - Please be somewhat respectful of the chosen colors here, be aware that these selections and combinations are not slammed together in a couple of hours; It evolved into these exact color picks during the last 17(!) years of use on some webmail servers I still maintain, and it versioned into this from friends' and relatives' user input and my own taste and views etc.  - I know you're going to kill this as a non-Issue, for not following guidelines, but it *is* an issue. I don't want to work on signal code, I just want to add a GUI color theme. Here's me hoping someone will pick it up as such.

column3: Why no proxy support?
column4: Without any standard HTTP, SOCKS or obfuscator proxy implementation. So, how Signal could protect its users?

column3: Annoying notification "background connection enabled"
column4: With the websocket version there appears a notification saying "background connection enabled". It can't be dismissed. Please remove that notification, since I know that I am using websockets.

column3: when using video call only working rear facing camera ...not working front camera although both camera working in whatsapp and FB messenger..
column4: when using video call only working rear facing camera ...not working front camera although both camera working in whatsapp and FB messenger......even not showing switch option of front and rear facing camera...please help suggest       I have: - [ ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing.  ### Steps to reproduce - using hyphens as bullet points - list the steps - that reproduce the bug  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour)  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Manufacturer Model XVI **Android version:** 0.0.0 **Signal version:** 0.0.0  ### Link to debug log

column3: Add menu entry to disable battery optimization
column4: When using Signal without play services, if the battery optimization is not disabled when asked by the initial popup screen, it's not easy to find how to disable it.  I propose a new entry in the "Advanced" settings menu, visible only when play services are not available, that allows enabling/disabling the battery optimization.

column3: Foreground activities taking too much screen estate
column4: When using Signal without gapps and with a passphrase two foreground activities are shown in the notification area: one for the "Background connection", the other just says "Signal is unlocked", and it's needed to cache the passphrase I guess.  These are taking a lot of screen estate. I'd suggest to join them in a single foreground activity.

column3: Signal thinks my name is too long
column4: When trying to sign up signal complains when I use my full name in the profile.  My name is "Rafael √Åvila de Esp√≠ndola".  It works if I replace √Å with A or √≠ with i, so I guess it is counting bytes in a utf-8 encoding.

column3: [Feature Request] Don't allow saving or forwarding attachment
column4: When sending attachments I cannot be sure that they will stay private. E.g. when sending a photo of myself I don't want it to be forwarded to another person..

column3: Allow users to specify their own display name
column4: When joining a large group, where most of the users are not in any user's contacts list, it's very annoying to see messages coming from phone numbers. They are difficult to recognize, remember, and associate with a name. There should be a way for users to specify a name to be shown when in a conversation with an user that doesn't have the number in his/her contacts list. When the number is in the contact list, the contact list name has to be displayed.  This has to be optional.

column3: Updated import error message for File Not Found
column4: When importing the backup, FileNotFoundException toasts "Error importing backup!" (R.string.ImportFragment_error_importing_backup), but it should more specifically toast "No plaintext backup found!" (R.string.ImportFragment_no_plaintext_backup_found).   ### First time contributor checklist  - [ X] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [X ] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [ X] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [ ] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Device A, Android X.Y.Z  * Device B, Android Z.Y  * Virtual device W, Android Y.Y.Z - [X ] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [ X] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/)  ----------  ### Description When importing a backup file and the expected SignalPlaintextBackup.xml is not present in the predefined location, a generic error message is provided: "Error importing backup!". There is a more specific error message available "No plaintext backup found!". Code above catches the FileNotFoundException and uses the more specific and already provided/translated error message.

column3: Updated import error message for File Not Found
column4: When importing the backup file, FileNotFoundException toasts generically "Error importing backup!" (R.string.ImportFragment_error_importing_backup), but it should more specifically toast "No plaintext backup found!" (R.string.ImportFragment_no_plaintext_backup_found).   ### First time contributor checklist  - [X ] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [X ] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [X ] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [ X] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Emulator, Android 8.0, API 26  - [X ] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [X ] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/)  ----------  ### Description When importing a backup file and the expected SignalPlaintextBackup.xml is not present in the predefined location, a generic error message is provided: "Error importing backup!". There is a more specific error message available "No plaintext backup found!". Code above catches the FileNotFoundException and uses the more specific and already provided/translated error message.  A similar approach without creating a new error message that requires additional translation: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/pull/6978. Specifically commit: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/commit/ab3e92ec537e282e58d4b35aa7640c4a16817f03

column3: Wrong message/warning order on safety number change
column4: When I receive a message from a contact that just reinstalled the app, I get the "safety number changed" warning, as expected. Once I accept it the order of what I see in the conversation in wrong: first I see the message I just received with the new safety number, then the "Your safety number with xxx has changed". It should be the other way around, to respect the chronological order of things:  1. Show the warning: Your safety number with xxx has changed; 2. Show the message: The message sent with the new safety number.  Running Signal 3.31.1 from the Play Store.

column3: Startup crash since update to 4.9.0
column4: When I open the signal app it crash's instantly. And when I'm using my phone I get some time force close popups. But only since I've made the update today.  Device Bullhead Android linageos 7.1.2

column3: Calls, can't hear other side, they can hear me
column4: When having a call with another person via Signal they can hear me, but I can't hear them. We've tried it multiple times, over the span of a month and the issue is always the same. It doesn't matter who initiates the call either.   ### Steps to reproduce - Call or let someone else call you - talk  **Actual result:** The person on the other end can hear me perfectly fine but I don't hear anything. It's like they're completely muted (they say they're not)  **Device:** OnePlus One **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.5.3  https://gist.github.com/ada14fc110c4e41798d6ad6367f64365  This is one of the few ways I can talk to this person securely (we're thouhsands of miles apart) so I'd appreciate any help.

column3: Invalid contact "-1" in contact list when forwarding message
column4: When forwarding a message to another contract, the contract choser shows a "-1" at the bottom of the contract list, even though I have no such telephone number saved in my contracts.  When clicking on that entry and thus forwarding a message to that contact, sending fails. Also, the next time trying to forward a message, the "-1" is present __twice__ in the list, once because it is now part of the chat list (due to that unsent forwarded message), and once again at the very bottom of the list.

column3: [Feature Request] Additional Camera Button Options
column4: When clicking the camera button at the bottom can you have the option to use either video or camera, so you can either take photos or videos to send.  Thanks  ![untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16563034/30512889-fe9c8182-9af0-11e7-9702-d724c238f664.png)

column3: [Feature Request] Ability to delete safety numbers
column4: When another signal user has a temporary phone, or decides to delete signal, there is no option to purge keys for that user and return to Insecure SMS as default.   It would be great if there was a remove keys, or reset user function in the menu to clean their key from your device.

column3: Please provide an option to remove the inane "Inbox zeeeerrro" content
column4: When all messages have been read, a screen now appears that says "Inbox zeeerrro"[sic] followed by a picture from a children's book that looks like a shoe box with a face, and then the text "Zip, Zilch. ... You're all caught up!"   Why?  Perhaps it's there by mistake.  What might seem seems cute the first few times can grow stale fast.  Please provide a way to just see a short, simple indication that there are no new messages.    Perhaps "There are no new messages."  With the link for seeing archived messages.

column3: contact that no longer uses signal
column4: When a contact doesn't use signal anymore, we should have the option to move back to sms. Not having a read receipt for a month is a good indication... but settings would also work in the conversation.   I get that we don't really want to fix issues like this, but it's kind of a non-starter if you still haven't fixed the problem in a rational way.    https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6377  This isn't an error with the software, it's a design error.   The logs are in the issue tracker üòÉ

column3: Message bubble spacing eats lots of screen space
column4: Well, the title is self-describing. The vertical spacing between the bubbles is almost 1/3 as high as the bubble.  This means every 3 messages a portion of screen space that's worth 1 message is eaten. Please reduce the vertical spacing, it's really big.

column3: "Group updated." message still very confusing
column4: We've got some improvements with group-related messages, thanks for that.  Still from time to time I get "Group updated." message in the group conversation. It's very confusing: who updated what? The string name is `GroupUtil_group_updated`, called just two times in `GroupUtil.java`. It should be changed in something more precise, like: "UserX changed the group name from X to Y". (It's just an example, maybe group name changes are already precise, the point is that I don't know what triggers the "Group updated" message!)

column3: Improve search for non-contacts
column4: We recently made some improvements in Signal-iOS around searching for non-contacts by phone number.  I suggest we have parity on Android.  * https://github.com/WhisperSystems/SignalServiceKit/pull/130 * https://github.com/WhisperSystems/SignalServiceKit/pull/139  Let's say user has a US phone number like +12045002827.  They should be able to search for another US phone number like +17043264096 by entering any of:  * +17043264096 * 17043264096 * 7043264096   They should also be able to search for a non-US phone number like +441733530267 by entering any of:  * +441733530267 * 441733530267  IMO we should try prepending the calling code for the current user's phone number ___and___ the calling code that corresponds to the default region for the current device.  I'm not sure how this works on Android, but on iOS users specify their language and region preferences as a system setting.  So for a user living in the US (With a US phone number) but who is Scottish and like seeing dates and times, etc. formatted in UK way and thus uses the UK region, we should try both US and UK calling codes since they are likely to look up users in both places.

column3: Will there be option to edit or delete messages?
column4: We are wondering if there will be _edit_ or _delete_ option for messages for individual or group chat? Let's consider scenario where someone posted something private accidentally, what can be a solution for that, this is just on example which may be more related to the privacy of user.

column4: Today signal has asked me 6-7 times to restart in order to apply an update. It seems that nothing is happening, actually. I'm using the independent signal program on mac os high sierra.  Any ideas what's going on?

column3: [Feature Request] Add new contact to Signal only, not to Google contacts
column4: To improve security and privacy It'd be nice if it were possible to add a contact to Signal only. Now it is only possible to add contacts to Google contacts and have Signal sync them. This is far from private or secure!  I prefer to add my contacts to Signal only and keep them separate from Google contacts, or have the option to make the choice to either add a contact to Signal only, or to Google contacts. Can't imagine this to be a very hard thing to code.  Thanks Patrick

column3: [feature request] custom vibrations and tones
column4: this would be really nice since the default vibration is a bit loud

column3: [Feature request] Emoji Search
column4: This would be a harder one but if you could add a search box in the emoji keyboard so you can find emojis quicker that would be cool. A way to achieve this maybe is to add a feature to allow users to give tags to emojis and have that data sent to Signal and be evaluated and then and make those tags permanent with the emojis in a future update. This way the Signal community can tag the emojis and the Signal Devs can focus on other parts of the app.

column3: Feature Request: Add more conversation color options
column4: This one is simple. Currently we have 15 different conversation colors. This seems somewhat limited for a modern app. Anybody familiar with Textra's extensive color picker knows what I'm talking about.   ![textra](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11284950/24327278/f2dfdf36-1181-11e7-8df4-d478b22da514.png)  30 or more colors would be nice. A good way to determine a maximum number of colors is if they start becoming too indistinct from one another.   This is especially useful as Signal gains more users and our contact lists grow.

column3: FR: Integrated keyboard input (Google Keyboard spying?)
column4: This may sound (and even be) overly paranoid, but the most advanced encryption in the world is meaningless if using an input method like Google Keyboard, with system-wide microphone access and other permissions.  Tonight I had Signal open while watching a discussion on vegetarianism and magically I had a msg populated with "I would die I was sick of being hungry I was sick of beans and rice".  I DID NOT write this, or ever discuss this topic with the contact.  Perhaps it's just a random coincidence, but it sounds quite a bit like the endless reports alleging Facebook listening in and serving ads based on ambient audio. Regardless if it's a real security concern, it could be a potential one,.  A few ideas: 1) Have the option for Signal to use it's own built in keyboard, similar to those meant to circumvent keyloggers.  2) There are apps like Microphone Block and Camera Block for Android which disable the microphone and camera on a system wide basis.  Replicating this functionality in Signal for a "Get Smart: Super Paranoia Cone of Silence Mode" would be a great addition for those that trust Signal/OWS, but maybe not Google Keyboard/Android.  This still obviously isn't a 100% guarantee, but could help shift the balance  from ubiquitous surveillance to highly targeted surveillance (where it should be, and all we can realistically hope for)...

column3: [REQUEST] Pop Out Bubble Chats like FB Messenger
column4: This is not an issue but could not find the best place to post this.   Are there any plans to implement a feature like the Facebook Messenger where the conversations are easily accessible from any screen? I find it really useful to be able to have the bubbles on the side while I have another app open without the need to constantly switch between them to keep the conversation going.

column3: "Read Receipts" feature not clear
column4: This is an usability issue: the read receipts feature is not clear. What should I expect? A triple tick mark then the recipient read the message? A change in color in the tick marks? Or will the second tick mark appear only if the message has been read (so if I disable read receipts, I won't know if a message has been delivered)?  How can I tell if a contact disabled the read receipts, or if s/he actually didn't read my messages?

column3: Remove race condition between GUI and ringtone
column4: This fixes #6356, #6406  There is a race condition between IncomingRinger turning the speakerphone on to play the ringtone and WebRtcCallActivity, which disables and unchecks the "speakerphone" button on the call screen during an incoming call.  If your phone can create and display the dialog quickly enough for it to needlessly turn the speakerphone off before IncomingRinger turns the speakerphone on, you get a ringtone.  If it takes your phone too long to wake up, create the lockscreen, and then bring up the dialog, then no ringtone (or a very brief ringtone) for you.  This patch removes the "unchecking" of the control buttons for speakerphone, bluetooth, videomute, and audiomute when there's an incoming call.  They're still disabled, but they're left in the default states so no extra events get thrown to the listeners.   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Moto E, Android 5.1  * Moto G4, Android 7.0 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description   There is a race condition between IncomingRinger turning the speakerphone on to play the ringtone and WebRtcCallActivity, which disables and unchecks the "speakerphone" button on the call screen during an incoming call.  If your phone can create and display the dialog quickly enough for it to needlessly turn the speakerphone off before IncomingRinger turns the speakerphone on, you get a ringtone.  If it takes your phone too long to wake up, create the lockscreen, and then bring up the dialog, then no ringtone (or a very brief ringtone) for you.  This patch removes the "unchecking" of the control buttons for speakerphone, bluetooth, videomute, and audiomute when there's an incoming call.  They're still disabled, but they're left in the default states so no extra events get thrown to the listeners.

column3: Feature discussion: Blockchain verified conversations
column4: This discussion really applies to the entire Signal stack, but it had to put someplace. Also, I'm not entirely sure signal doesn't already have something like this.  Signal does a great job at client e2e encryption. People mostly seem excited about it's ability to prevent people from listening in on conversations. Aside from encryption GPG also gives us verification that the message originated from a specific individual. I'm curious, what is that verification was taken one step further?  What if a blockchain (of sorts) was kept for each conversation? This way, we enforce the order in which messages were sent and most importantly that message b came directly after message a. Deletion or insertion of messages after the fact would not be possible. Such an implementation would ensure a conversation remains the same between all parties involved and that no individual could inject or remove parts of conversations without the other parties involved noticing.  An example of something like this is how git handles commits. Each commit contains a hash of the current commit (and diff) and the hash of the previous commit. A simple program can then run against the commits to verify the repo is in good order.  In Signal's case, a central authority would be necessary. So the hash chain would probably need to exist on the server. The clients can sync against the hash chain and verify their local conversations match the server's.   Thoughts?

column3: Make plaintext export more compatible with SMS Backup and Restore
column4: This commit adds the contact name and the readable date (and time) to the plaintext export of every message. That's because that is how SMS Backup and Restore does it, so this commit makes Signal more compatible.  // FREEBIE   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Galaxy Express Prime, Android 6.0.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  This makes the plaintext export from Signal more compatible with the export from SMS Backup and Restore by adding a readable date (and time), as well as the contact name, to every message.

column3: Remove google api for websocket / website version.
column4: There is no possibility to share location without Google maps. Maybe this could be removed or disabled. So we have no google libraries in this relase....

column3: Feature Request: Disable Voice
column4: There is no apparent way to disable incoming voice calls or stop them from ringing.  (Big annoyance in the middle of the night.)  I would like the ability to refuse all voice calls if I so choose or at least mute the ringtone and make it vibrate only.

column3: Missing possibility to manually insert the SMS registration code
column4: There are situations where the device where Signal is installed can't directly receive SMS messages, but the users can receive the message on another device/service. Some devices do not have a sim card slot but the users owns another phone that can receive messages. Other users want to register with a phone number bought from a service like Twilio. In these cases it is difficult to register with the current procedure.  I propose this kind of solution: - After the 2 minutes SMS timeout, a screen is shown to the user, asking to manually enter the code receives via SMS. The screen also have a clear button that says "I didn't receive any sms", or something like that. - If the user taps on "I didn't receive the SMS", the current voice verification screen is shown.  The vast majority of the users will never see this screen. I think there are more users which can receive messages on a different device than users that try to register, expect to receive the message, but then something does not work.

column3: 4.10.x no Signal contacts in system Share dialog
column4: The system "share" dialog used to show signal contacts as options, saving the user from having to choose signal and then pick a contact.  After the upgrade to 4.10.x, this had not been possible. On my phone the share dialog now only shows WhatsApp contacts as options, no Signal contacts.  Moto G4 Play Android 7.0 Signal 4.10.9  To reproduce, attempt to share something from any app.  Can anyone else confirm this behaviour?

column3: Support for Librem 5 HW phones (no GPlay) with PureOS (deb), or compatibility with Matrix/riot protocol
column4: The privacy & security focused mobile HW has just been founded:  https://puri.sm/shop/librem-5/   As these projects share common ideology, it would be nice if Signal were natively ported to the PureOS platform on release day.   * ETA availability for customers on 1/2019 * `PureOS` (already available), based on Debian, definitely withOUT GPlay services  Alternative to a native port would be a compatibility with their intended IM: `Matrix` using `riot` protocol (i think the compatibility would be a better approach, but not sure if it's feasible?)

column3: Read Receipts Blue Color Ugly in Dark Theme
column4: The blue read receipts checkmarks clash with the dark theme. You have gray, gray, gray then blue. Gray and blue just don't match.  I suggest red instead, everyone knows red and gray/dark/black match. If you chose blue to match the color of signal, I understand, but then... it just doesn't work, it stands out with all the gray and feels weird.  Can the color change with the theme?  Does anyone agree with me?  To reduce comments, use the thumbs up to agree!

column3: Can't build with buildtools 25.0.0
column4: The 4.0.0 source won't build in Android Studio with BuildTools 25.0.0, because it won't download that older version for some reason. Increasing the version to 25.0.2 in build.gradle (line 192) solves this.

column3: Disable touch functionality while listening to a voice note through earpiece
column4: Thanks for improving the voice note feature. When raising the phone to the ear, voice notes are now played through the earpiece. Maybe it would be good now to also disable the touch functionality of the screen while one is listening to the voice note. Right now it can happen, that the ear is pressing buttons.  **Steps to reproduce:** - start playback of voice note - raise phone to ear - listen to the voice note through the earpiece  **expected result:** during the playback through the earpiece touch functionality of screen is disabled **actual result:** ear is accidentally pressing buttons on the touch screen

column3: Technical document/details missing for creating own server
column4: Technical document/details missing for creating own server, I am hobbiest and would like to explore own server rather than depending on others account so that I can fancy by making my own changes. couldnt see how we setup our own server.  one in below didnt help much: https://github.com/skal1ozz/RedPhoneServer/blob/master/TextSecure-Server_Installation.txt   Thanks, Arun.N

column3: Forwarded audio or video files and voice notes can't be played on Desktop and iPhone
column4: Summary: Forwarding a voice note changes its content type from 'audio/aac' to 'audio/*'  1. Send a voice note to Alice. 2. Forward that voice note to Bob. 3. Open Alice's thread on Desktop. 4. Open Bob's thread on Desktop  Expected result: Both threads contain playable audio messages.  Actual result: Only Alice's thread contains the playable audio message. Bob's thread contains an empty message.  Debugging on the desktop side reveals that the content type on the original was `"audio/aac"`, but on the forwarded message was `"audio/*"`. This applies both to the message forwarded to Bob's client, and the message synced to Alice's Desktop client under Bob's thread, both will get `"audio/*"` content types. I manually changed the content type on Desktop to `"audio/aac"` and was then able to play the message.

column3: warn about sms being converted to mms!
column4: sorry to (re)open this, but I did not find an open ticket where it does actually fit in!  My GF just lost some hundred Euros ‚Ç¨‚Ç¨‚Ç¨ because her SMS invitation to her friends to her birthday party got automatically converted to MMS. When the phone did not send the MMS she tried it again, resulting a big number of MMS. I guess due not being connected to the internet, the phone could not send the MMS. When she finally connected to the net, they flushed out and flooded her friends and now her phone bill, emptying her bank account. :disappointed:   She has free sms but MMS are horribly expensive.  normal users dont have a clue about anything technical and initially don't react to small tips, because they have never learned to pay dead serious attention to such. we live in a world where dangerous things are being marked by terrifying big blinking dangerous looking signs.  **so please, put in a warning, the users have to accept or cancel, stating that they know about the risk of high cost due to MMS sending. And even better, giving em the chance to send a SMS to multiple users at once, instead of converting the msg to MMS**  if signal is not safely usable by average users, it is not usable at all :cry: now people are uninstalling the dangerous signal app and dont want to every use it again, as it can break you... darn... all the talking about security and such, down the :toilet:   ps.: conversation feature is mostly not wanted at all, because most people dont want that all contacts get all the other numbers as well.

column3: Speech bubble color in conversation overview too dark
column4: Sorry for the nitpicking. I like the new icons, except for the one in the conversation overview. It is too dark and uses a color which nowhere else can be found. I think it would be better if it uses the same color as the string "Signal" next to it (so white) or the same color as the logo/icon. This would look "friendlier".  ![signal icon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17936066/24322277/5ded3c14-1160-11e7-87e1-414188e8f938.png)  I'm not interested in a discussion, so feel free to close this if you disagree.

column3: Receiving messages not meant for me while updating desktop version
column4: Sorry for not sticking to the proper bug report format, I'm a little scared and confused and wanted to get out a report as soon as possible. tl;dr: my desktop version of signal is not showing my conversations but those of a friend.   The details: I had Signal installed on my laptop (Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS) as a chromium app and on my phone, everything working fine. I wanted to install the new standalone Signal on my laptop. Here are steps I did as well as I remember. Sorry, I don't know how to try to reproduce this, so there may also be irrelevant steps listed.  1. I followed the Linux install instructions: 	$ curl -s https://updates.signal.org/desktop/apt/keys.asc | sudo apt-key add - 	$ echo "deb [arch=amd64] https://updates.signal.org/desktop/apt xenial main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/signal-xenial.list 	$ sudo apt update && sudo apt install signal-desktop  2. I tried to follow https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/115002502511-How-do-I-migrate-messages-to-the-new-Signal-Desktop-  3. I opened the old chromium signal app, there was a message saying it needed to be updated. Clicking on that message opened https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/signal-private-messenger/bikioccmkafdpakkkcpdbppfkghcmihk I was confused that there was no "update" button or similar. I tried several times, closing and opening both the chromium browser and the app, until at some point the "you need to update" message was gone and it apparently also was the current version: it included the " Migrate to standalone" menu item.   4. In this updated chromium app there were weird messages, which I then thought to just be old messages, but have now found out to be not messages between me (J) and my friends but between A and A's friends. So on the right hand side of each conversation there are messages which A has written, and on the left the messages of her friends. There is also a chat with my name, which contains the messages between us, hers on the right, mine on the left. The names of the contacts and contact photos are also A's. These are messages between March 2017 and June 2017 and also some few messages from the day before yesterday (2017-10-30)  5.  I clicked "Migrate to standalone", and imported the generated folder in the new signal app.  6. From the new desktop app I wrote "test" to a common friend (K). On his phone he received that message twice: at 11:55 in the chat with me, and at 12:03 in the chat with A.   7. Since K's reply only reached my phone but not my the desktop app, I wanted to reconnect the desktop app to the phone. To this end I deleted my laptop under "linked devices" in the menu of the signal app on the phone. Shortly after this I did receive Ks reply at my laptop.  8. I found out that the messages were not old messages of mine, but As messages (see description in step 4)   9. Shock, horror and confusion   Only possible hint for an explanation I have that in 2015 or so A gave me an old phone of hers (not the one I'm using right now!) and on that phone first she and later I both used signal. I don't know exactly what degree of "wiping the phone" we did in context of the transfer.  My phone: Device  : OnePlus A0001 (bacon) Android : 6.0.1 (2b5f277d1c, MHC19Q) Memory  : 73M (4.69% free, 512M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : cyanogen App     : Signal 4.11.5  I can also add log files later if that makes sense, but before posting those, I would want to at least roughly read them, for which I am too tired right now. Posting this anyway because it seems pretty major.

column3: Don't scale down images attached as "files"
column4: Sometimes there is the need for sending an image as-is, without further compression/scaling. As now Signal supports big and arbitrary attachment, please leave images alone when sending them as "Files" and not from the "Gallery".  The workaround now is renaming the file, but it's rather clunky on Android

column3: Feature request: Show letter instead of hash (#) in circle for SMS with automatic name
column4: Sometimes I receive SMS messages from organizations that have somehow automatically a name with them associated (for example from Google), but no number.  These messages appear in the Signal message history with a hash (#) in the circle in front of them, instead of the first letter of the automatically provided name.  I would prefer to see the first letter of the automatically provided name instead of the #.  Android: 4.2.2 Phone model: bq Aquaris 3.5

column3: Missing privacy option: hide last message from conversations list
column4: Sometimes I open Signal to show something to another person (e.g., recall a detail of a conversation we had on Signal). In this situation I don't like the other person to be able to see the last message I exchanged with all my other Signal contacts. I would like to have a privacy option like: "Hide last message from conversations list" (or "show last message", selected by default, to maintain a positive phrasing).  A message like "**3 unread messages**" is shown if there are unread messages.  This is similar to what is already done with notifications.

column3: SMS based safety number verification
column4: So here is the idea: now that we have persistent identity verification, an SMS based safety number verification can be implemented.  Of course this is not as good as a face-to-face meeting where the numbers are checked, but the only way to perform a MITM is to control both the Signal server and the mobile carrier, in order to manipulate the SMS message exchange. This is very unlikely (remember that the SSL certificate of the server is pinned).  I think that an attack of this kind is less likely than getting the device compromised. In this case encryption is not of any help.

column3: SMS do not get forwarded to hands free device.
column4: Sms do not get forwarded to my car system via Bluetooth when received.  Let me know if I need to provide more information!

column3: android: incoming call: notification title
column4: Since there is no support for Android wear I keep missing incoming calls - they don't show on my watch (Huawei v1), only 'missed call' notification. I worked around this problem (incoming calls using a non-wear-supporting VOIP app like Zoiper and WhatsApp) by using tasker:   - intercept notifications from specified app (AutoNotification plugin for Tasker) - check notification title - if it's something like 'incoming call' - send the text field to android wear (AutoWear plugin for Tasker)  However this method doesn't work with Signal because its notification about an incoming call is untitled.  Could this be fixed?

column3: Syncing with other android devices?
column4: Since one can sync the Chrome extension it seems like the infrastructure is already in place.  Is secondary android device syncing coming?

column3: Signal goes into crash loop after messaging contact, receiving message from contact with data connection
column4: Signal version 4.3.2 Android 7.1.2 Pixel XL, not rooted Google Play Service 10.2.98  I had a prior conversation with a contact today. About 20 minutes ago I tried messaging that same contact after leaving my office, Single immediately went into a crash loop and threw the screen allowing me to report feedback (I've reported it a few times with some descriptive text). The crash still happened after I deleted the cache to Signal.  I set the device to airplane mode and reopened Signal. I was able to open the app without a crash. Opening up the conversation with said friend I could see the message I had sent was still in a pending state (3 dots animating). I long held on the message, deleted it, killed the app (app switcher swipe), turned off airplane mode, reopened the app. No crash.  Again I attempted to message my friend, again hit a boot crash. Repeated my airplane mode steps, then went back to Signal while online and tried to send a message to a different contact. That worked fine, no crash, double check marks.  I left it alone. After about 30 minutes said contact tried messaging me again and the app in the background threw the Android crash submit feedback popup box. The airplane mode trick no longer works, nor does clearing cache. Also my session through the Chrome extension is running fine. I can see the last message I received from the friend was "Yeah, k" before any further messages from me or him would cause the app to give up on life.  At this time I was able to logcat the crash in the state that it is in now and attaching thta at the end of this bug report. I am assuming my only option at this point is to clear app data to get out of this bad state.  [bitmoji](https://render.bitstrips.com/v2/cpanel/10217268-133639651_8-s4-v1.png?transparent=1&palette=1&width=246)

column3: Track verified safety numbers
column4: Signal should remember that you've verified safety numbers with a contact.  When you run into a friend, it's easy to forget whether you've done this or not, and anything to make it more convenient increases security. Some users add a check mark to the contact's name, but this is a terrible solution. This change shouldn't require any new options or settings.  It would be nice: - for both users to see a "Your safety number with XXX was verified [/ not verified]" message in the conversation in the style that you already see e.g. "Your safety number with XXX has changed" - to see an indication of whether the safety number for any given contact has been verified in "Conversation settings > verify safety number", and perhaps also additional info about it e.g. when verification occurred, how ... - to have some ongoing visual indication of the verification status within each conversation (maybe the lock and checkmarks could become green instead of grey? or there could be a different color in the title bar or background color?) - I'm guessing it's unwise, though, to prevent someone from re-verifying a safety number with a contact in case, e.g., their threat model includes physical tampering  Thanks for considering this!

column3: Timeframe server deletes inactive accounts
column4: Right now the server logs 2 things. Registration day/month/year and last login day/month/year. This is used to determine unactive accounts and delete them if they are not used longer than a year. My question is, is it possible to reduce this logging to month/year? So the day don't get logged.   EDIT: Or even better what @bowensong recommends.  `current_year - last_login_year > 1 `

column3: Can't share from another app to group chat if not one of the 5 most recent conversations
column4: Pretty sure this is a dupe but I'm too tired to share and to annoyed that it's now difficult to share to my Bitmoji only group chat.   With a recent update (4.13.6), there's now a new list of conversations that shows up when you're sharing content from another app. With the old behavior you got a list of conversations in order of last received/sent. In the new version you first get your to five last received/sent conversations, then a list of all your contacts.  If you would like to share this content with a group that isn't in your top 5, it will now show up in that following contacts list. You'll have to go and send a message to the group separately so that it then shows up in that list.   Again I'm half asleep and slightly intoxicated. My apologies if this is a duplicate.

column3: Add support for a TOR connection using Orbot Proxy application

It is required to use on non-rooted devices, without any VPN/etc mode.  This option is available in ChatSecure, Antox (Tox), Xabbix and so on.

column4: Partial fix for #6620.  // FREEBIE

column3: Disclose when installing that metadata is visible
column4: Pardon me if this had been already discussed, but I only found one relevant issue, #838.  Since TS only supports phone numbers as an identity mechanism, it means the telcos (and hence governments) have all the metadata they need to identify users.  Thy don't even care about the communication contents - see [Why Metadata Matters | Electronic Frontier Foundation](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2013/06/why-metadata-matters) and [Using Metadata to find Paul Revere](http://kieranhealy.org/blog/archives/2013/06/09/using-metadata-to-find-paul-revere/).  Thus TextSecure offers a false sense of security.  I'd love to be proven wrong if perhaps I misunderstood the underlying handshake and transport mechanisms (SMS, GCM).

column3: [Feature Request] Make Signal availiable for users in China.
column4: Over here we do not have access to the Google Play Store and other AppStores do not provide the Signal App. Is there an alternative way to download the apk file so we can also enjoy encrypted conversations?  The App is available on the Apple AppStore in China, so I guess the software itself is not banned.   Thanks

column3: On phones with 2 SIM cards, signal ignore settings of default SIM card selected to send SMS
column4: On the phone with 2 SIM cards, signal always send SMS using first SIM card.  It ignore android settings. So even is android is set to use SIM card 2 to send SMS, signal use card no 1. This is wrong, and there is no way to change it except exchange of SIM cards. But this can be problematic if person use SIM cards from 2 countries, and travel frequently between them.

column3: [Feature Request] Swipe left/right to next media item within conversation
column4: On other messaging apps, the typical behavior within a conversation that includes multiple media files such as images, is to allow swiping left/right to the previous/next one. If multiple images are shared in a conversation, that makes it much easier to go through them all without leaving fullscreen. In Signal if, let's say, 5 images are shared in a row, you need to open them individually, then go back, open the next one and repeat until done.

column3: Allow for setting a nickname
column4: Now that the concept of a user profile exists, please add support for setting the user's own nickname, to be shown to other users when they don't have the number in their contact list.  This is mostly useful (I'd say fundamental) in groups.

column3: Throttle notifications
column4: Notifications for incoming messages are not throttled at the moment. This means that the phone makes a sound or vibration for each and every incoming message, even if they are just seconds apart. I feel like a slave to the phone because it grabs my attention constantly when I'm in the middle of something else. It breaks my concentration.  At the same time, I do want to receive notifications. Just not so many.  I propose:  1. Notify the user at most once every X minutes (default: 15 minutes?) after the last notification or after the last time the user opened Signal. There is no point in telling the user many times that messages are available. 2. Notify about an incoming message not immediately but after 1 minute delay. That way multiple incoming messages can be read in one go instead of being constantly forced to either monitor the chat or be distracted by the notifications. I think this feature must be default off because it adds a delay that users might not expect. I'm not sure.  The delay constants should be configurable to adapt the app to users diverse needs. I hope this feature request makes sense for the product. I'm using Google Android 7.1 and Windows 7 with Signal Desktop.

column3: Ability to force disable encryption for certain contacts
column4: Not really a bug, and sorry if this is already a thing somewhere in the issues, but right now, if someone had Signal on an iphone, and got rid of it, the android app doesn't pick up on it automatically, and you have to manually send them "insecure" texts by holding down the send button first. A way to just select unsecure as a default, or perhaps a conversation setting that tells signal to just send regular old messages until changed in the future, would be great. Thanks.

column4: Nexus 6P running the latest Signal-Android `master` branch on Android 6.0.1. Sender is on a Nexus 6P on Android 7.x. Not sure which Signal version.  Conversation is a Signal  Signal conversation.  There's one specific picture that causes it in my conversations. This seems somewhat related to #6207 but this is on the receiving end instead of the sending end.

column3: Replying to a group MMS via the notification pull sends the message as SMS instead
column4: Let's begin with a checklist: replace the empty checkboxes [ ] below with checked ones [x] accordingly -->  I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When replying to a group text (mms) via the notification pulldown, the message is sent as an sms and goes only to one individual in the group.  ### Steps to reproduce - Receive group text (mms) - Pulldown notification, tap reply, enter message, hit send. - From the thread in the Signal app, long press on your sent message, tap "i" for message info, notice it was sent as an sms  - Should be sent as an mms and go to the whole group  **Device:** Huawei Honor 5x **Android version:** Lineage OS 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.10.12

column3: Location sharing with OSM.
column4: It'd be great if Signal had less G$$gle dependencies, so after the GCM-free version, location sharing without G$$gle Maps would be great. There is a small messenger out there named Kontalk which implemented this feature some time ago, maybe you can take some code from their GitHub to make it less effort: https://github.com/kontalk/androidclient

column3: [Feature] Add a private PDF previewer
column4: It would be very useful to be able to view PDF documents without saving them unencrypted and with a viewer that is guaranteed not to connect to the Internet or do other nasty things.  I understand there's the danger of bloating Signal, but I think this possibility should at least be considered.

column3: Feature: Keyword-based antispam [bounty]
column4: It would be nice to have feature to automatically silence notification and/or block contact, based on specified keywords. We all don't like spammers ;)

column3: Feature request: display contact nickname instead of full name
column4: It would be nice to be able to have conversations show a nickname, e.g. "Mom" instead of "Jane Smith." This also provides a security benefit because people looking over your shoulder won't see people's full names if it's enabled.

column3: [Feature Request] Swipe left to call contact
column4: It seems like most other texting apps allow you to swipe left or right on a conversation from your list in order to call that contact. Why hasn't Signal implemented this as well? Swiping right archives the conversation; would it be that difficult to make swiping left call that contact?

column3: Group Chat maildelivery marked as failed everytime, person can't leave group
column4: In our Group-Chat one of the group-members uninstalled signal and doesn't have google play anymore. The corresponding number is still part of the group, but she can't get the messages anymore, because she doesn't have signal. We can't remove the number from the group and she can't leave, so every message gets marked as not delivered.  EDIT------------------------------------------------ Step by step: -Make a group-conversation including phone-nr. A, B and C -phone C uninstalls Signal but is still in the group -phone a sends a message -phone B receives said message, phone C (of course) doesn't -phone A gets "message could not be sent"  Result: Every message gets marked as undelivered because of phone C not having Signal anymore Expected/Ideal Result: phone C automatically gets kicked out of the group when Signal is not installed anymore, every message gets delivered.  Device Info: Happens to all 10 different phones in our group, mine would be: ZUK Z1 Cyanogen OS 12.1-YOG4PAS7DF Android version: 5.1.1 Signal Version: 4.6.1  Debug Log: https://gist.github.com/ff13303a26e8d8a8bbe03edba8b04531

column3: Feature Request: Move to SQLCipher so destination information is also encrypted
column4: Improve local storage encryption. Now only the content of the messages is encrypted. If forensics can bypass androids FDE, they can collect metadata. Please don't assume that androids FDE is safer than local encryption implemented right. Android FDE is light years away from ios and even ios is not bulletproof.   please read on the discoussion forum:  https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/passphrase-encryption-only-for-message-contents/917  Moxie commented he would want to phase it out in favor of android fde. Wich would be a mistake.

column3: [feature request] ability to relay SMS to Signal Desktop
column4: If you use Signal for Android as an SMS client, you have to look at your phone to read the SMS, even if you have a Signal Desktop paired with the Android.  It'd be great if there was a way to configure Signal for Android to automatically proxy SMS messages to/from Signal Desktop. I'm told iMessages does this as well.

column3: WikiLeaks: Signal communications vulnerable on unlocked devices?
column4: If this is the wrong place for this, sorry, please close.  I was reading more about the recent [WikiLeaks dump](https://wikileaks.org/ciav7p1/#PRESS) and noticed this from a Q&A section in an article.  > Q: The documents suggest that the CIA can access information in encrypted messaging apps like WhatsApp and **Signal**. I thought they were safe from even government spying? >  > A: No system is perfect. The documents describe ways to get information in those apps on Android devices, but only after gaining full control of those phones.  Even if the method is not yet available/disclosed, I thought it may be prudent to have a discussion (or at least an open issue) on the matter.  If there's any way these leaks can highlight shortfalls in Signal and thus help to improve its information security, there may be some good from it.

column3: Cannot administer groups anymore after re-installing signal, groups are not synced to new device
column4: I've been using an Android phone (Nexus 5) with the latest Signal version.  On this phone I created a group called "Family" where I was the admin: I could change the title, picture and members.  A couple of days ago the Nexus phone died.  As I had an older iPhone 5s, I used the SIM card from the old Nexus phone, installed  the latest Signal version on the iPhone and (re)registered the old mobile number.  None of the groups that I had created on the old Android phone were synced to the iPhone. When someone posted a new message to the Family, a new group showed up on the iPhone labeled "Unknown group".  The group picture was not set and I can't edit the group anymore.  Was I doing something wrong? How can I make sure the existing groups are properly synced to the new device?

column3: Feature: display artist & title if present in common audio tag format(s)
column4: I would love it if, when I attach an audio file, the title and artist are displayed if they are set in a couple of common tag formats - for example, MP3 id3 tags (v1 and v2), and the most common tag type used in .m4a and .ogg containers. That should cover 90+% of cases.  This is a total wishlist item given the resources available, but it's the type of subtle fit and finish that makes apps a joy to use.

column3: [Feature Request] Add possibility to sign up without phone number
column4: I would appreciate it if it would be possible to sign up without giving you a phone number. This would be another advantage over WhatsApp.  Of course, Signal promises not to save it but I still can't understand why I should install a crypto messenger and then have my phone number transferred to some server somewhere in the world.  If it is necessary that every user has a number, users who do not want to use their own number could get  another, randomly created number (which starts with 000, for example).  There is another crypto messenger, "Hoccer", with which this is already possible.

It seems, webrtc used in Signal implementation is different from what is available on link mentioned above. Is it correct ? If yes, then is there any repo available for Signal Webrtc ? Thanks.

column3: Signal apk download does not match published fingerprint
column4: I tried downloading the officially published [apk](https://signal.org/android/apk/), but fingerprint does not match. I tried using various browsers and asked a friend to try as well. So I think I am not under an attack.  I downloaded `Signal-website-release-4.1.0.apk` and the SHA256 fingerprint I get is:  ``` d7accd1465968607e4df3112c39bfc98eb0674c3a9cb4146a47d935d871e84f6 ```  I used `shasum -a 256 Signal-website-release-4.1.0.apk`.  On the website it is written that the fingerprint should be:  ``` 29:F3:4E:5F:27:F2:11:B4:24:BC:5B:F9:D6:71:62:C0 EA:FB:A2:DA:35:AF:35:C1:64:16:FC:44:62:76:BA:26 ```

column3: Feature - set disappearing timer by default
column4: I think it would be useful that one could optionally choose to have disappearing messages set, to some timer, by default. The reasoning is that I tend to view it as being an hint that I wish to exercise sane log keeping. Having the ability to set it on my end is valuable for that purpose, because it forces other parties to deliberately circumvent it. It does grow a bit tiresome to have to remember to set it on every new chat that does not yet has it on.

column4: I saw [this thread ](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/1085) on the topic but it's a few years old.  Has there been any new attempt to implement an alternative kind of identifier, besides the phone number, for registration? Or is it on the roadmap?

column3: [suggestion] Making signal server world readable
column4: I respect that Signal is trying to improve the state of secure communications and is designed in such a way as to minimize the amount of metadata available to Open Whisper Systems, but because it is not a federated protocol, all Signal users must trust that Open Whisper Systems is telling the truth. While we have no reason to doubt that, it would be better not to have to operate solely on trust. There should be no downside to making Signal's servers world-readable (except for API keys, of course) so that users can verify for themselves that all messages are encrypted and minimal metadata are stored.

column4: I mainly use signal for anonymous faceless communication with people I don't know or want to know.   I don't want to see the picture the chose for themselves when I add them to my contacts. A bubble with a letter and color will do just fine.   Please add an option to fully disable contact avatars from the app and stop downloading them from the servers.  Thanks.

column3: User Experience Suggestions
column4: I love this app but after sharing this with friends and family I see a few things that made their transition a little difficult or just revert back to whatever messaging app they used previously.  Here's a few things I've noticed: - The initial period of finding another contact and sending them an encrypted message isn't very obvious. There's nothing saying the app is syncing with the server to find other contacts that also have Signal so users are left confused trying to send each other an encrypted message but the box still says "Unencrypted SMS". An optional tour may be best here to walk new users through Signal.  - On first use, users are left with a big box at the top that asks them to make Signal their default messaging app. It seems to confuse everyone. I suggest that this option should come up after users have had a chance to use the app for a few days rather than prematurely asking them to switch immediately when new users are still exploring it.  - New users tend to switch back to the default messaging app since all the conversations are already on the default messaging app (i.e. the built-in SMS app) so asking the users to import their existing messages into Signal on first run would be more appropriate. I know this conflicts with the above point but these two points are up for discussion.  I will add more observations here as I continue to listen for difficulties with Signal from others.

I know this is possible in some circumstances because, DuckieTV (github.com/SchizoDuckie/DuckieTV) also use a single JavaScript repository, but they compile it for multiple OS like Android, Linux, Windows, OSX and a chrome add on. column3: Contacts do not appear in Signal's contact list until country code is removed
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates. This issue is the opposite of https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/7013 - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Contacts appear in Signal's contact list (Signal > Message compose) after removing the country code from the number that is saved.  When looking at the contact entry in the phone's contact list, only a Google account is shown. Resync-ing contacts (Android Settings > Accounts > Removing Signal > Open Signal > Message compose) causes no change.  ### Steps to reproduce - Have contact's phone number stored WITH the country code - Open Signal - Tap Message compose - Scroll or search for a contact  **Actual result:** Contact is not listed **Expected result:** Contact is listed  ### Screenshots  N/A   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy J7 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log  Contact saved WITHOUT the country code and is listed in Signal's contact list: https://gist.github.com/c2bb17fa187b17804ad40213244a3165 Contact saved WITH the country code and is NOT listed in Signal's contact list: https://gist.github.com/d43a61309c362c41796c9e2518368e3d

column3: Error importing backup: xmlParseCharRef 55357
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates. There are older import failure issues, but none that reference the error below, include the word `xmlParseCharRef`, or include `55357`. The ÔøΩ character is mentioned in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/342#issuecomment-66870874, but the issue does not directly refer to a solution. - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Importing a backup onto a new phone fails. There seems to be an XML parsing issue with the character `55357`, which appears 187 times in my plaintext backup.  An example message (scrubbed of personal data): ```   ```  The debug log shows `FileNotFoundExceptions`, which confuses me because the backup is in the root directory of the file system. I attached a screenshot. EDIT: I tried to import the backup before realizing my backup was not in the root directory (had moved to view it). Put it back and tried the import again. Took the debug logs after the last attempt. That might explain the file not found exceptions.  ### Steps to reproduce - export plaintext backup on old phone - move backup to new phone root directory - import backup  **Actual result:** Attempting to open the XML file in Android's HTML viewer generates the following error:  ``` This page contains the following errors: error on line 250 at column 180: xmlParseCharRef: invalid xmlChar value 55357 ```  **Expected result:** Backup imports successfully  ### Screenshots ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6969296/32359318-9b512fc6-c023-11e7-9b54-2518fff9efbf.png)    ### Device info __New Device__ **Device:** Google Pixel 2 **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  __Old Device__ **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/d04dc53f1db4dbf3810ce84016a8e000

A proposal would be to align them to a common line on the left.  ### Steps to reproduce - open the app, look at the list view and the conversation view  **Actual result:** Lots of different text alignment lines. **Expected result:** Text is properly aligned on the left at a common line.  ### Screenshots Current, for list view and conversation view: ![signal alignment current](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/925062/31470073-a074d4d0-aee4-11e7-880a-f5e24a2cc89e.png)  Proposal: please note that I‚Äôm not 100% happy with this, especially with the movement of the ¬ªSignal message¬´ part and the resulting whitespace around the emoji icon. - move ¬ªSignal¬´ title to right to align with content (maybe icon too. Also, the icon could be white?) - move ¬ªSearch¬´ text a bit to right to align with content (maybe also the back arrow) - move conversation title in heading slightly to the left to align with content - _maybe_ move the ¬ªSignal message¬´ input box placeholder. This looks strange though. ![signal alignment fixed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/925062/31470072-a0362bae-aee4-11e7-98b6-4981739506e3.png)    ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/e7cfc91a3f551cbc94ba86c8d368d74e

column3: Unable to message as phone number format switches between +1 123-456-7890 and 1234567890 repeatedly
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates.  May be related to https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6060 - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Unable to write a message while the phone number re-formats.   ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal - Type a message   **Actual result:** - As a message is being typed, the phone number format changes between +1 123-456-7890 and 1234567890 repeatedly and keyboard inputs are not seen in the message compose field  **Expected result:** To be able to message.   ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/1d9358a4190df3bc15481dce22835177  ### Temporary troubleshooting solution  1. Enable All the permissions for Signal Go to Android Phone Settings > Apps > Signal > App Permissions > Enable all permissions. Even if this is enabled, please re-toggle the setting (turn it off and back on) and restart your phone. Go to Android Settings. 2. Resync contact accounts Go to Android Phone Settings >  Accounts > Signal > Menu > Remove Account. The alert of clearing data is incorrect, your messages will not be deleted. > Open Signal > Menu > Refresh / Pull down on the contacts list to refresh 3. If the above steps don't resolve, edit the phone number format and repeat step 2.
