column3: Pictures sent from Nokia 5 get heavily scaled down (13MP -> 3MP)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates (searched for "compression", "regression", "nokia 5" and "resolution") - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I have 2 contacts using a Nokia 5 by HMD Global. When they send me full resolution (13 MP) pictures made with their smartphones, I receive scaled down pictures (approximately 3 MP). Other contacts (using iPhones with 12MP-Cameras) can send pictures that I receive just as they were shot in terms of resolution. All pictures were sent via data (not MMS). Let me know if there's additional information that I forgot to include. Thanks!   ### Steps to reproduce - find contacts using a Nokia 5 - Make them send you a 13MP-picture made with their smartphone (i.e. their camera app) - Make them capture and send the debug log - receive picture and save to device - check the details of the received picture.  **Actual result:** The received picture has a resolution of approximately 3 MP **Expected result:** The received picture shouldn't have been scaled down that much. Ideally, it would have the same resolution as it was shot.  ### Screenshots  Sender's side: ![Resolution and size of the picture that got sent.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7197813/33827389-7ce2e350-de68-11e7-9bdc-b388f7a48efb.png) Receiver's side: ![Resolution and size of the picture that I received.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7197813/33827439-a1b59e16-de68-11e7-8816-5c66103be267.png)    ### Device info  Sending Device: **Device:** HMD Global TA-1053 (TA-1053_00WW) **Android version:** 7.1.2 (00WW_3_72A, 00WW_3_72A) **Signal version:** 4.13.6  Receiving Device: **Device:** motorola MotoE2 (4G-LTE) (surnia_retde) **Android version:** 6.0 (3, MPI24.65-39-4) **Signal version:** 4.13.6  It appears that the issue is still present on Signal 4.14.4. I'm willing to provide more recent debug logs if necessary.  ### Link to debug log Contact 1: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/11a015c6447ad754149f2b1609a6a6f4 Contact 2: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/67939cb7e210fcfee7843d609b242368

column3: real time (streaming) push to talk or PTT
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates (#3563) - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature description [From Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Push-to-talk&oldid=765635499 )   > Push-to-talk (PTT), also known as press-to-transmit, is a method of having conversations or talking on half-duplex communication lines, including two-way radio, using a momentary button to switch from voice reception mode to transmit mode.  The term push-to-talk appears in #3563 but that issue seems to be about sending voice messages, and the way this feature is currently implemented is not the way the term PTT is commonly used. For PTT, voice should be streamed in real time.  PTT conversations could be left open for days or months, and at any given time no data is necessarily being transferred unless someone has their thumb on the PTT button.  ### Why  PTT is a love-it or hate-it kind of feature. For me, it would be a major selling point that I could use to get a few more people onto Signal. For couples, families, hands-free driving, and teams who might otherwise use walkie talkies, this method of communication can be a far superior experience than extensive SMS, group calls, or frequent short phone calls.  ### How  Having the phone suddenly blurt out a friend's voice is the main anti-feature. For this reason people need to be able to manage the state of being in a PTT conversation or not. Here's a draft sketch for how I imagine this working:  In order to be able to be heard live, the caller needs to first initiate a conversation through the menu in the SMS thread. When off, the interface would look and work exactly as it does currently, except for the new menu option to start a PTT conversation. The callee would accept the conversation either through a notification or an indicator in the SMS thread.  When a PTT conversation is active, the microphone icon would change to indicate that holding it will stream audio live, and a menu item for muting the conversation would be enabled. The three PTT conversation states would be **active**, **muted**, and **off**, with the only shared state being whether the conversation is active or not. When the user mutes a conversation, no indication is sent to the other party.  So long as the conversation is active, all incoming audio would be saved as audio messages the same way they currently appear in the SMS thread. When muted, the audio would not play until the user specifically listens to it. When unmuted, it would play live through the speaker phone. Details:  events ‚á© | states ‚á®| - | - | -|-|-|- _ | PTT Active | PTT Off | PTT Muted press and talk | stream audio to everyone in conversation | record audio and send as a file when finger lifted | same as PTT Off receive stream | play audio live and also save as message | save audio as unread message, as if it was not streamed | same as PTT Off receive audio message | same as PTT Off | same as existing behavior | same as PTT Off user begins PTT | N/A | send PTT invitation, change state to PTT Active | N/A user receives PTT invitation | ignore event | notification of PTT invitation | same as PTT Active user accepts PTT invitation | N/A | state changes to PTT Active | N/A user declines PTT invitation | N/A | send PTT hang-up to all members | N/A user ends PTT | send PTT hang-up, state changes to PTT Off | N/A | same as PTT Active PTT hang-up received | change state to PTT Off | drop pending invitation | same as PTT Active PTT muted | change state to PTT Muted | N/A | N/A  There are multiple ways that the shared state of being in a PTT conversion can get out of sync, but with the event handling described in the above table, such issues will default to as if PTT is not active, and can quickly be resolved by ending and beginning the PTT conversation.  To me, the above seems like a minimal way to add this functionality on top of the existing interface without moving anything around, without forcing anyone to adopt, and without disrupting existing patterns of usage, and staying in-line with familiar patterns.  ### Conclusion /TL;DR  Signal is uniquely positioned to offer secure walkie talkie style conversations to groups, teams, and families with the need for real-time communication in short bursts. The feature can be implemented with minimal UI changes and no disruption of existing usage patterns.

column3: No Signal data loads after power cycle (all messages lost/deleted/wiped)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates Potentially related issues: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/423 (I commented on this one) https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/4772 https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6441 https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6472 - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Device shut off due to low battery. I heard the Signal message notification as it shut down. Once rebooted, Signal failed to load any data, including archived messages. Signal is able to send and receive texts and I confirmed that no new key was generated with a friend (fig 1).  Android reports Signal is consuming 115 MB of data and 30 MB cache (fig 2), leaving me hopeful that the data might be recovered with some elbow grease. Open to any suggestions - my thoughts: - I'm guessing Signal is unable to open the old database and made a new one. Is it somehow possible to force it to open the old database? - If not, might there be a way to recover the message DB and decrypt all or some of the data out of band? I know my passcode and the keys appear to be intact.  ### Screenshots Fig 1 ![screenshot_20170508-223114](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/954607/25833925/ad1a22d4-3442-11e7-8319-701cfa97750e.png)  Fig 2 ![screenshot_20170508-222228](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/954607/25833928/b447aa86-3442-11e7-8c73-b73f09cb91db.png)  ### Device info **Device:** HTC M8, hw version 5 **Android version:** 6.20.654.3 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/32706bddc8b09c4db21520bca8a5a513 [taken ~10 minutes and a reboot after the incident]

I have seen this feature in Google Allo below and I think it is useful. Long press send-button activates up/down slider for text scale.   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33217529/32162682-187cdb2a-bd5a-11e7-965f-2afb00686b51.png)

column3: Notify if user does not receive mesage in a certain amount of time
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports ----------------------------------------  When the message is sent, the first tick acknowledges that the message was sent correctly and if there is an error, the notification alerting the user appears after some time. The second tick acknowledges the correct reception of the message and it would be great to have an option to notify the user if message is not received even after some time (a few days for example).  It usually indicates dead phone or battery, that the recepient is no longer available on Signal, wrong recepient, or even some exotic bug in the system, etc. Therefore it would be very practical to have a notification popping up alerting the user that message hasn't been received even after some time. I also suggest this time be adjustable and 1 day as the default setting.

column3: Remember the last used message mode per contact
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports ----------------------------------------  I have some people in my contact list that have uninstalled Signal, but didn't do a proper unregistration so my Signal app always defaults to sending them Signal messages, which they never receive. I have to manually select "SMS mode" each time I open the conversation. It would be great if the last used way of contacting a specific contact was remembered by the app.

column3: Option to pause voice message recording
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports ----------------------------------------  Currently the voice message button records the message while it is pressed down and it has the ability to cancel the recording by swiping to the left side (over the message input field). It would be an useful addition to be able to pause the recording while the swipe is halfway to the left. So that the user presses the button to record, if the need arises (for example to quickly ask another person something) swipes a bit to the left and pauses the recording with that and if the swipe is extended, message recording is canceled.

column3: Option to play recorded voice message while it is still uploading
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports ----------------------------------------  Current behaviour after the voice message is recorded is that an upload is indicated by the rotating arrow in the message icon and only after the upload is finished, the user can listen to the voice message that was sent. Upload can take some time (especially on 2G) and there is no reason that the voice message cannot be listened right after the capture, while it is still uploading. It's an obvious improvement that does not change any other functionality.

column3: "Number not registered" when using "calling beta" in 3.30.4 - missing calls instead of ringing, too
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Using "video calling beta" from an Alcatel TCL 5010D to make a call to a Blackberry Classic with no-google-play-services, on the Alcatel appears this error: "Number not registered - The number you dialed does not support secure voice!".  Both devices are running Signal beta 3.30.4. Alcatel has explicitly enabled "video calling beta" feature. Blackberry has it implicitly enabled, as per moxie0's comment in #6272 ("You don't see that settings, it's on by default for you"). [btw, before beta Signal 3.30.3, the Blackberry showed "Login failed!" when trying to place a call; now, from 3.30.3, no more "Login failed!"].  If, instead, I call from the Blackberry the Alcatel, on the Blackberry it seems all ok, ringing tone, but the Alcatel doesnt ring, and shows a missed call just after the Blackberry stops the ringing tone, manually or because of the timeout.  Texts and attachments work ok on both directions (A->B, B->A). Alcatel device can place and receive audio calls correctly to/from other Signal accounts. Blackberry device has the same behaviour as detailed here with other Signal accounts.  ### Steps to reproduce - call the Blackberry from the Alcatel, and viceversa   ### Device A info  **Device:** Alcatel Pixi4 5010D **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** beta 3.30.4  ### Device B info  **Device:** Blackberry Classic **Android version:** 4.3 **Signal version:** beta 3.30.4   ### Link to debug logs   - Alcatel calling Blackberry mostly there is, it seems to me, not so much interesting data in the debug log: http://gist.github.com/ea2bc9fb1a190aa5c6a6a4eebfd2feb7 sometimes, something appears [e.g. handleNoSuchUser, I suppose]: http://gist.github.com/f6500cf47918bfa440fb9f665c3ac650  - Blackberry calling Alcatel [last 2 account's digits edited to 00 for privacy] http://gist.github.com/6276fdd23691660ad81f3ea340a4f5fa

When these aforementioned issues are adressed - this issue will also be fixed.   ### Steps to reproduce - get new messages - hit the quick reply button - see that you don't even see the first message you just received because of the profile share banner (in conjunction with the unread message count) [see screenshot]  ### Screenshot ![screenshot_20170917-164805](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12666598/30521960-fe4ccb28-9bc8-11e7-9308-9a8ad3855b04.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.10

column3: Cannot receive phone calls or SMSs during a Signal call when on the Three UK network and connected to 4G or Wifi
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Cannot receive phone calls or SMSs during a Signal call when on the Three UK network and connected to 4G or Wifi.    Three UK has the "Three inTouch" app that handles voice calls and SMSs when the phone is connected to 4G or Wifi (com.hutchison3g.threeintouch). In practice this app is some kind of VoLTE/VoWiFi replacement for non-VoLTE/VoWiFi-enabled devices that prevents 3G fallback for incoming calls and also enables calls over WiFi. It doesn't do anything when the phone is connected to 3G.   If a Signal call is started while the phone is connected to 4G or WiFi (and thus the regular calls are being handled by InTouch), InTouch de-registers from the network for the whole duration of the Signal call and no calls or SMSs can be received or sent until the Signal call finishes. The phone appears to be out of mobile coverage to someone trying to call from a traditional network. When the Signal call ends, InTouch re-registers with the network and the phone starts receiving calls / SMSs normally again.    -This bug does not happen when calling using any other apps, including Whatsapp, Skype, Hangouts and Duo. Calls and SMSs can be received while on a Whatsapp/Skype/Hangouts/Duo call regardless of being connected to 3G, 4G or Wifi, and InTouch does not de-register from the network during these calls.    -This bug did not happen with the old RedPhone calls either, it only started happening with the new WebRTC calls.    -This bug does not happen if the phone is connected to 3G.  In a nutshell, it looks like Signal WebRTC calls are breaking Three InTouch.   Incidentally, a very similar issue happened with the early versions of Google Duo, but it was fixed soon after being reported. The only difference was that in that case, InTouch was not just being broken during a Duo call, but every time Duo was on the foreground, regardless of whether a Duo call was in progress or not. Link:   https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/Duo/yX0e4cjT2hI   ### Steps to reproduce - Be on the Three UK network, connected to 4G or Wifi, and using the Three InTouch app (being connected to 3G does not trigger the bug).  - Initiate a Signal (WebRTC) voice call (old RedPhone calls did not trigger this bug).   **Actual result:** Incoming phone calls / SMSs cannot be received during the Signal call. Calling the phone from a traditional network while on a Signal call results in an "out of coverage" message. The Three InTouch app de-registers the phone from the network as soon as a Signal call is initiated.   **Expected result:** It should be possible to receive incoming phone calls / SMSs while on a Signal call. Calling the phone from a traditional network while on a Signal call should work. The Three InTouch app should stay registered on the network during a Signal call.   ### Screenshots ![01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/28192843/25558454/116aa32e-2d1f-11e7-825c-702abf350fdd.jpg) ![02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/28192843/25558457/1fbcd960-2d1f-11e7-961c-057cc9d6ea75.jpg) ![03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/28192843/25558458/2322fef4-2d1f-11e7-8488-e95f3af75733.jpg) ![04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/28192843/25558459/26f6b52a-2d1f-11e7-80fa-f9cf4e3cf7da.jpg)  ### Device info **Device:** Nexus 5 D821 **Android version:** Stock 6.0.1 M4B30Z **Signal version:** 4.5.2 (but this bug happens with every Signal version since WebRTC was introduced)  ### Link to debug log Debug log of successful Signal call while on 4G: no regular phone calls or SMSs can be received until the Signal call has ended. https://gist.github.com/ee60c98e50a43a404f0e63f809da425a

Reinstalling the extension works for some time, but the issue will re-present itself after a few weeks.  Happens on multiple devices. I have also tried multiple versions of Chrome.  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Chrome Extension does not open  ### Steps to reproduce - Go to windows search bar - Type "signal" - open signal  **Actual result:** Permanent loading screen **Expected result:** Load my texts  ### Screenshots ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33236336/32196153-bbfc6d1e-bd8d-11e7-9002-5d36fc3d8553.png)    ### Device info **Chrome Version: 61.0.3163.100 **Signal version:** 0.44.0  ### Link to debug log Can't really do that...

column3: Unencrypted phone calls ?
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports - [X] contacted https://support.whispersystems.org/  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I've browse the Android Signal App's source code, and I haven't seen anywhere where phone calls are encrypted. Especially how and with which algorithm. I suppose that the encryption, if there is one, is used from WebRTC. However, I haven't seen the used algorithm in the Session Description when I was debugging the app.  Accordingly to https://whispersystems.org/blog/signal-video-calls-beta/, the **signaling** of calls are **effectively encrypted** through the Signal protocol. However, in the Session Description, there is **_no encryption_** information to **_encrypt streams_**. Normally, if the Session Description is correctly written (with encryption), there is a "a=crypto:1 AES_128_GCM inline:[Key+Salt] ..." somewhere in it. Here, this line is missing.  Can you explain me how the streaming encryption is done, with which algorithm and where are lines in source files ?  Sorry for my english.  Have a good day :) ### Steps to reproduce Not applicable. Work as designed.  ### Screenshots Not useful.   ### Device info Source code issue. No specific device. Issue on Signal version 4.5.2, 4.5.3 and 4.6.0. Newer and older not checked, but I think it's the same.  ### Link to debug log No log.

column3: Feature - re-invite contacts that uninstalled Signal without de-registering
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  Signal contacts that I do not frequently exchange messages with tend to forget to install Signal when they switch to a new phone (probably because I'm the only person they were using Signal with). When I send them a Signal message, I see that the message reaches the server (one check mark) but is never delivered to their device. I would like to be able to send a new invitation with the link to the Signal app to them to ask them to re-install Signal. Currently this is not possible from the menu because the user is already registered, and therefore the invite option is missing.

column3: On desktop, enabling disappearing messages initially sets 1 day
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  Repro:  1. On Signal Desktop, open a chat without disappearing messages set 2. Click the 3 dots button and click "Disappearing messages" 3. This sets the timer to 1 day.  This is a problem because if I want 1 week I now have accidentally deleted 6 days of messages (I presume). Even if that is not the case it *looks* like it might be. It's confusing and suggests possible data loss.  Not sure what the best solution is. As a user I'd be happy if clicking the menu item merely made the disappearing messages button visible but set to off. I can then directly set the desired choice.  (Also, can we have a few more choices between 1 day and 1 week and also 1 month?)  ### Device info **Android version:** 7.1 **Windows version:** 7 x64

column3: [Feature Request] Copy messages with a emtpy string between them and inserting nicknames in a copy buffer
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  It is a feature request. Please make a copying few messages like a Telegram-style copy. Or just insert empty strings between messages.  1) The first annoying thing is not adding empty string between two different messages. For example, here is a chat:  ``` John: Hello! Could you copy that?   Alex: Hi! Yep, I will try   John: Thank you. Please paste here. ```   What will be if you will select all these message and copy/paste them somewhere? You will see the following:  ``` Hello! Could you copy that? Hi! Yep, I will try Thank you. Please paste here. ```  Absolutely garbage of text, no any splits, you are unable to understand even by splitter - what message was written by who.  So, the first what is very wanted - is to add "enter" (empty string) after every inserted to a clipboard buffer message, except the last one. So, in this case you will have:   ``` Hello! Could you copy that?  Hi! Yep, I will try  Thank you. Please paste here. ``` It is not ideal, but it really much better than current behavior.  2) The best result you will get if you also will add (insert) nicknames before every new message from other guy (except a few messages from the same guy), like in Telegram.  So, you will have: ``` John: Hello! Could you copy that?  Alex: Hi! Yep, I will try  John: Thank you. Please paste here. ```

column3: [Feature request] Save scroll position in current chat window for each one contact
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  Both feature requests are on the same topic, so in the one ticket:  1) Please save scroll position in current chat window for each one contact (like it doing Telegram, for example). I.e. if you had moved scroll position upper, to some date, and then "exited" from the contact to a contact list, the back - position must be saved. And do this for all contacts please (each location/position saved for each one contact).  2) Please STAY on the same position of window if some event were added by you (for example, you had sent a message to this contact). Do NOT scroll the screen immediately down to the end of chat (to the last message, after sending it)! Just stay on the same position, where send button was taped. (Do like it done Telegram, for example - stay on the same location).

column3: Feature Request: Let users choose between GCM PUSH and the new WEBSOCKET based notifying service
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ---------------------------------------- **Feature description**  Most of signal messages I send to my buddies only get delivered( or calls tried notified) when their signal app is opened. This was the case with me until I moved to AOSP  and with the new solution for non play services users, now the messages come in very swiftly even when the app is not in foreground. All my buddies are on stock rom and I understand there may be issues with play services configuration etc.. But not everyone are geeks and everyone cannot move to AOSP for different reasons and not everyone can or wants to contact support with debug log when there are good alternatives for instant messaging already installed on their phones.  So if the affected users have ability to choose between type of notifying services (GCM PUSH or the WEBSOCKET one), it would simply overcome the issues of no/sluggish notifications and message delivery.

Overrided _get_ method with timeout parameters always throws TimeoutException because of wrong comparsion between elapsed time and timeout value.  ``` //... long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); while (!completed && System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime > unit.toMillis(timeout))    wait(unit.toMillis(timeout)); }  if (!completed) {   throw new TimeoutException(); } //... ```

column3: FOSS gradle build flavor
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  Since March 13, you can now [download Signal as an `.apk`](https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/how-to-get-signal-apks-outside-of-the-google-play-store/808/15) from the official website. This is partial done for people who have no Google Play installed on their devices. A part of this group does not have Google Play installed because they don't want to have proprietary software on their device.  Fortunately, you can use Signal without Google's Firebase Cloud Messaging but unfortunately, the proprietary libraries are still included in Signal's build. Some of these are: ```     compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-gcm:9.6.1'     compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-maps:9.6.1'     compile 'com.google.android.gms:play-services-places:9.6.1' ```  In my eyes it makes sense to add a fully free and open source gradle build flavor to Signal which builds get published on the website instead of the default Google Play release. If this is done, F-Droid can reproduce and distribute the official binaries of Signal by OpenWhisperSystems.  Reference thread in F-Droid's forum: https://forum.f-droid.org/t/signal-discussion-about-google-play-alternative/95

column3: Improve voice messaging
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  Several things should be improved (imho) to make voice messaging as enjoyable as with similar popular messaging services:  - The voice messages' lengths should be displayed next to the them. I always listen to short voice messages even if I don't have much time because I see it won't take long. With longer voice messages, I usually dedicate some time in my day to listen to them later. But one has to know how long the message is going to be before playing it back. Another argument is that when receiving more voice messages than fit on the screen, and listening to them one-by-one, it's easy to loose your current position in the messages if they can't be distinguished from each other. Currently, it's only the timestamp that distinguishes them, often displaying the same time for multiple messages (because they were sent in the same minute) or a very similar time with only a minute difference, which makes it easy to loose your current position. A competing messenger [solves the issue of indistinguishable voice messages with sound graphs](https://telegram.org/file/811140355/1/WIZMMGf4N0o/42aafb28995492f57c). - Rotation should be locked when recording starts. Currently, accidentally tilting your phone while recording rotates the screen and stops the recording. This is especially annoying since voice messaging is mostly used in situations where one can't type well, e.g. when walking on the street, eyes on the road instead of looking at the phone. In this position one doesn't pay much attention to how one is holding the phone because one is concentrating on the surroundings, resulting in accidental tilting that aborts the recording. - Recording voice messages without an active internet connection is a pain, for example on train rides or on vacation. Once a voice message is recorded, it can't be played back until it has been delivered to the server. Re-listening to what one has just said (to avoid repeating oneself) is impossible until the internet connection is reestablished. Instead of replacing the play button with a Spinner (I mean the Android View) to indicate the message is being sent, thus making it unplayable, just display a "..." animation like with text messages. - I am unsure if this is already implemented and just doesn't work for me, but holding your phone to your ear or otherwise blocking the proximity sensor doesn't switch audio playback to the earpiece. It works with competing messengers though.  To conclude, a word of compliment: It seems like when sending multiple voice messages with no internet connection, then reconnecting again, sends the messages in the order they were recorded. Some competing messengers do not care to save the order, usually resulting in the smallest/shortest voice message being sent first, and so on, resulting in a weird order that confuses the receiver.

column3: Feature Request: Multi-Device support
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  Related closed issue: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/5102 which I feel the point of which was missed for the user's misunderstanding of the implementation.  ### Bug description I cannot have two android devices or two mobile phones logged in to the same identity at the same time.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open up the app - Attempt to identify yourself without a SIM present.  **Actual result:** No options to use this app **Expected result:** Identify via *((mms)), ((email)) ((SIP/VOIP Provider)) ((Google Voice)) ((OAuth Provider)) ((scan QR code from existing device))*. You should also be able to link identities accross different ID providers (multiple phone numbers + email address, for example) once signed in by using a device scan.  ### Device info **Device:** ZTE Axon Mini 7 / Affects all Android + iOS **Android version:** 6.0.1 / Affects all supported versions **Signal version:** 4.0.0

column3: Overall Privacy-Compromise Created by Profile Feature
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  Not really sure how to report this. I deem that it belongs here since it is not a support request, and is an issue with Signal. But it it is considerably more general than other bug reports.  I have read all of the issue tickets reporting issues with the new profile feature, and all of them identify issues with the way the feature was implemented. None of them speak to the addition of this feature itself as problematic.  I use Signal because it is still the project with the most diligent commitment to smartphone messaging privacy. I have until now had high confidence that Signal development decisions would be smart and levelheaded, and would not compromise my privacy. The addition of the profile feature has shaken that confidence.  The [announcement of the Profile feature in Beta](https://signal.org/blog/signal-profiles-beta/), which I've only now had a chance to read, claims "All of this is possible without sacrificing the privacy and security that you have come to expect from Signal." This is not true.  Half of my contacts know me by one name, half by another. It is imperative that there is no crossover between these identities. Furthermore, the gmail account my Android phone is registered under is a third identity. Disclosing that identity to some Signal contacts would represent a catastrophic privacy breach, which could even, hypothetically, endanger my life.  Up until now, there has been no cause for concern in using Signal, as enforcing the segregation of these identities has presented no issues. Signal's design decisions have never presented any threat to this segregation, because the presumption has always been in favour of privacy.  The "set up your profile" wizard which announced itself after the update prepopulated the name field with the name associated with my Google account. It would have been very easy to have accidentally accepted this as my profile name. As per the Signal blogpost, this name would then have been visible to all contacts saved in my phone. This decision thoughtlessly left me a single mistake away from a catastrophic privacy breach.  The "Do It Later" option was minuscule and dangerously close in the UI to the very large "Accept" button. It was initially not visible to me, so it looked as if I was being forced to choose a unitary identity for a Signal instance where I was managing multiple identities. When I did spot it, after a reinstall, several attempts to press it on my large smartphone screen were unsuccessful. It took multiple attempts.   Before I discovered the "Do it later" option, my compromise attempt to save an empty profile returned an error message. I also discovered, after temporarily choosing a privacy-preserving pseudonymous profile name (which would nevertheless appear highly incongruous to several of my contacts) that [it is not possible to delete an identity once chosen](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6960). There is no option to do so, and if you try to save an empty profile it gives you an error. So I had to reinstall the app to delete my profile. And when you do not set up a profile,[ the app harrasses you with persistent notifications](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6927) to do so during group conversations, as if the decision not to is assumed to be a temporary one by the Signal devs.  There are several bug reports which suggests mitigations for some of these different problems (although not all of them - e.g. I have seen no mention of the prepopulation of the name field as a concern). Fixing each of these problems would indeed have reduced the severity of the threat to privacy represented by the introduction of the feature. (I also imagine there are people who believe that simply adding support for multiple profiles would solve the issue, but in my opinion this would drastically sophisticate the task of managing identities, and result in accidental breaches.)  But fixing each of those issues would not address what seems to me the major issue: that this issue was so thoughtlessly introduced at all. Yes, it is clear that - to preserve my privacy - Signal devs decided it would be unwise to just automatically create a profile for me based on the name associated with my Gmail account. Instead I was given a dialogue with the name prepopulated. But this in itself was dangerous, and the fact that I was subjected to even this danger with apparently no consideration of how it could affect people with multiple identities leaves me with little confidence that similar or worse breaches might be thoughtlessly created in the future, in order to introduce some convenience feature which is secondary to the goal of a truly private messaging application. Using Signal is now fraught with inherent risk, and I am no longer confident that Signal devs have my privacy as their priority.  For me - a Signal user whose privacy is paramount - this profile feature is not a feature but a bug. The utility added to the app by the profile feature, eliminating unknown phone numbers in group conversations, seems to address an edge case at best. It does not enhance the privacy of the user - its only effect on user privacy is to make privacy compromise more likely. I cannot see how its addition necessitates the attendant complexification of the task of staying private while using the app. And the reasoning behind its introduction, in a dev team with a commitment to privacy, is entirely opaque to me.   I submit this issue as a Signal user who values privacy, and who has experienced a privacy scare because of Signal development decisions - something which I am sure should be of concern to a privacy-oriented project. It is considerably longer than a typical bug report, because it speaks to a broader issue. If this issue can be taken on and used to improve matters, that is to the good.   If it is simply the case that Signal is reprioritising, or that it does not intend to cater to users like me with harder privacy requirements than the average (but privacy-conscious) user, that is sad to me, but I accept it. But it also suggests to me that it is misleading to call it Signal Private Messenger, and to entice users with more stringent needs into a potentially risky situation.

column3: Feature request: filtering sms from allowed number(s)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  My carrier has a service number. I need to communicate with that number about the service I'm using.  But, my carrier sometimes sends ads via that number. The ads can be filtered via regex or wild cards.  So, I cannot block that number. But I want to filter ads. Would you please consider adding this feature? If you agree, I would propose these:  - Regex and/or wild card filters for a single number. - Regex and/or wild card filters for all numbers. - Option to verify that regex is in correct form.  Thank you,

column3: Visual display for how many contacts are on Signal
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  It'd be nice if Signal had a screen that would show e.g. a pie chart that indicated how many of my contacts were on Signal. Tapping an element of the pie chart would then show a list of people in that category - this would be a nice way to get an overview of contacts I still need to convince to convert.  There's probably also room for some gamification in here - the app could display something like e.g. "Almost there! :tada:" when most, but not all, of my contacts were using Signal.

column3: Feature Request: Playback speed control
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  **Long voice messages can be tedious to hear**. There you can easily set the speed to e.g. 1.5x of normal speed. **So you can hear people, saying good structured, nice things in an appropriate speed.**  This playback achieves: - Less boredom - More time for other things  Implementation: The speed choice control could blend-in when one starts playing the voice message in signal.

column3: Missing aggressive app restart capability in background.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  **Bug description** Clearing recent apps in my phone kills those apps in recent list. Well it is a bug but some apps like WhatsApp are being restarted aggressively and working while Signal doesn't start and stays inactive. Aggressive restart behavior of WhatsApp is only observed when phone is connected to Internet.  **Steps to reproduce** - Open Signal, Whatsapp and settings> app management > running apps. - Check in running apps both signal and whatsapp are running. - Minimize all and goto recent app list. - Clear signal and whatsapp from recent. At this point whatsapp and signal services are killed. - Quickly switch to settings >app management> running apps  **Actual result:** WhatsApp service shows restarting, Signal is inactive(not listed in running until we open signal app explicitly). **Expected result:** Signal app service also restarts aggressively in background.  **Screenshots**   ![screenshot_2017-03-29-10-31-46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26134720/24439756/d6ea709a-146d-11e7-9951-6f199f71d87d.png)   ![screenshot_2017-03-29-10-31-55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26134720/24439769/e8085a68-146d-11e7-80ab-74abe2b4fe68.png)   ![screenshot_2017-03-29-10-32-05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26134720/24439777/f1ea5e46-146d-11e7-9f36-c0509904db23.png)   ![screenshot_2017-03-29-10-32-37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26134720/24439785/faeebcee-146d-11e7-9a7d-6bbfcd0f8bf6.png)    **Device info**  **Device:** Lenovo vibe k5 (A6020A40) **Android version:** 5.1.1 stock **Signal version:** 4.1.0

column3: Disappearing disappearing messages timer info
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature request description: I would love to see an option (or default behaviour) for status info about setting timers for disappearing messages to vanish from a conversation as well.   *Reason:* If one has the need for using disappearing messages it seems very likely this person does not want anyone to know that there was any exchange of communication at the time.  **Actual result:** If I switch between different timer settings, all of them get listed in the conversation. So if anyone is eavesdropping on my conversation, it might be suspicious to see that information and that could lead to questioning. **Expected result:** After a 'hidden' conversation disappered, the info about it should disappear as well.  ### Device info All devices, all Signal versions up till now.

column3: Feature Request: Button to Abort Upload
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature Request description  While sending large images or videos on a bad connection, allowing to abort the process would be really useful which otherwise blocks the already low bandwidth fully.  ### Steps to reproduce  - select a large video - start sending on a slow network - try to abort the sending to send an other file (since you might have accidentally selected the wrong one)  **Actual result:** have to wait for the first send to finish. **Expected result:** Allow me to abort the send.  ### Screenshots  Can't screenshot since it's disabled. But just imagine the small circle going from 0 to 360 degrees *very, very slowly* on your GSM connection.  ### Device info  **Device:** all? **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.9, 4.10.12

column3: [Feature Request] Cooldown time mode for locking group chats temporarily
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature request description  Sometimes things are not good on a group message and when everyone is riled up I would request a way to get a cooldown for 1 minutes, 2 minutes or 5 minutes that would disable the sending of messages for that time period. (akin to temporarily locking a thread or page in other contexts).   Perhaps this whole system could be tucked into a app preference and not displayed by default. There could be a second preference "respect cooldowns" which would be enabled by default.  It could be set up such that: one person initiates the cooldown and a second person concurs. This could be presented as a text bubble like, "XYZ requests a cooldown locking the chat for two minutes" and a "Accept" or "Decline" buttons are presented. The second person who approves could then send out a blocking message with the time limit on it.   Then the other clients can disable their send buttons, and a mellow SVG animation with some kind of hourglass or similar would appear, or maybe an abacus subtracting numbers to zero. (like a bigger hourglass than the disappearing messages one, across the whole viewport).   When the cooldown is completed the timer message disappears and the send buttons are enabled again.  I think this could in fact help the user experience significantly by giving a way to let a overall emotional moment blow over for a few minutes and then resume again. Thanks for the consideration here!

column3: [Feature request] Update emojis to Unicode 10 / Emoji 5
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature request description  56 new emojis have been added to the latest version of the Unicode standard in May 2017 ([Unicode 10 / Emoji 5]( https://www.unicode.org/emoji/charts/emoji-versions-sources.html )). Now the data source for the emojis used in Signal  `iamcal/emoji-data` (https://github.com/iamcal/emoji-data) has also been updated to support Unicode 10 / Emoji 5.  @moxie0 It would be great if you could squeeze in pulling the new emojis from there in your mile long to do list. :) thanks!

column3: Use inset dividers in conversations screen
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature Request   Add inset dividers to the conversations view in order to improve/enhance the user experience.  ### Detailed Description The conversations view presently uses no dividers at all.   Full-bleed dividers are pretty visually overwhelming in large numbers. Inset dividers are subtle and offer better distinction than what is offered presently. It is also something that is recommended in the [Material Design Guidelines](https://material.io/guidelines/components/dividers.html#).  While there are representations of how this would look in the guidelines, here is how this looks in WhatsApp.  ![screenshot_20171009-091937](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/31324866-9743d086-aca6-11e7-8d26-135a88f97df6.png)    Thank you for reading :)

column3: Use shared elements transition for media preview
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature Request We could use a [shared element transition](https://developer.android.com/training/material/animations.html#Transitions) when we are starting/finishing [`MediaPreviewActivity`](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/MediaPreviewActivity.java) from/to both [`ConversationActivity`](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationActivity.java) and [`MediaOverviewActivity`](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/MediaOverviewActivity.java).  You can see an example on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qbf-uaybG6A), in the[ Android documentation (figure 1)](https://developer.android.com/training/material/animations.html#Transitions) or in Signal when you switch between a conversation and its recipient preferences.

column3: [Feature Request] Allow third-party apps to "poll" for messages
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature description This might be related to #3944, but I'm not sure.  Basically, it doesn't appear that there's any way I can specify an application is "trusted" to receive decrypted text messages from Signal. This is probably against the general principle of end-to-end encryption, but it might be worth it so I can use Signal in conjunction with other apps.  Basically, what I'm requesting is a way to indicate to Signal that other apps on the phone (e.g. Google Assistant, Garrulo (an app I wrote - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.glasstowerstudios.garrulo&hl=en), etc... can "read" text messages (in clear text) from Signal. This is useful, because, when I'm driving, right now, when I ask Google Assistant to read my new SMS messages, it can't see anything inside of Signal.   ### Steps to reproduce - Start Signal on Android, make it the default application for SMS receipt - On another device, send an SMS message (or a Signal message) to the phone in question - Using a hands-free device (or just by talking to your phone), say "Ok Google. Read text message" when the new message is received.  **Actual result:** Google will not read clear-text (SMS) messages or encrypted (Signal) messages received within Signal. The last message it will read is the one that verifies my participation in Signal.  **Expected result:** Google assistant will read my newest text message.  I expect that, in order for this to work, I would have to whitelist the application somehow. In that sense, what I'm asking for as a feature here is for Google to be able to "poll for new messages" to Signal, once whitelisted.  ### Device info **Device:** LG Nexus 5X **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5

column3: Repeat alerts: per contact setting, allow interval, and maybe add "repeat until confirmed"
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature description My use case is getting an alert message triggered by a ticketing system via SMS, but every use case in which you really do not want to miss a message would do. If that happens, which can be during the night, I want all bells and whistles go on. I think I could do that with a nasty notification sound, a small interval (e.g., 15s) and a high repeat factor. Obviously I only want that for that particular contact.  A further extensions could be repeating until I move a slider from left to right (like in fire alert 2). But for me that is of minor importance. A high repeat factor with a small interval in a *per contact* setting should do.

column3: Feature request: group admin can delete inappropriate content
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Feature description I hope the feature can be added that group admins can delete inappropriate content. In Whatsapp when you delete an image as group admin, it is only deleted for yourself not for all the others. So inappropriate content can be posted. In short: a moderation option to remove this.

column3: Feature Request: Signal as standard phone app
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Description Would be great if it would be possible to choose Signal as standard phone app (similar to the SMS functionality) -> if a contact one trying to call is using Signal the call would be made via Signal/the Internet and if not the call would be made via the mobile network.

column3: Support for polls/surveys
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Description It would be great to have some basic polling features. Here is a selection of polling options I'd consider useful:  * **Single-choice polls**    Sample Question:   * Where should we go for lunch?    Sample Answers:     * Italian      * Indian     * Korean * **Multi-choice polls**    Sample Question:     * What days work for you?    Sample Answers:     * ‚úîMonday 10:00, ‚úîTuesday 17:30, ‚úò Wednesday 10:00     * ‚úò Monday 10:00, ‚úîTuesday 17:30, (‚úî) Wednesday 10:00 * **Agree/disagree with different levels of agreement**    Sample Question:     * Is the font to large?    Sample Answers:     * Strongly disagree     * Agree     * Neutral  * **Preference** (perhaps similar to [Schulze Method](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schulze_method))    Sample Question:     * Should polls be implemented?    Sample Answers:      * **1.** Yes, immediately, **2.** Yes, within the next few months, **3.** Not a priority, revisit in 2018, **4.** No      * **1.** Not a priority, revisit in 2018, **2.** Yes, within the next few months, **3.** Yes, immediately, **4.** No

column3: Feature request: Answer to specific contact with highlighting and notification
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Description It would be cool, if Signal provides a function for easy per contact highlighting in group chats, similar to the ones in IRC (with `:`), Whatsapp (`@`) or Github comments (`@`). In most IRC clients this works with ``, in Whatsapp a list of users is shown if `@` is entered.  Since the contacts names are not necessarily equal on the different devices, e.g. the phone number can be used internally.  A big advantage of this is, that it enables a personal "ping", so that users can mute the group chat but receive notifications if they are personally messaged (similar to IRC).   ### Duplicates I hope this isn't reported somewhere else or already supported. I have tested with Signal 4.5.2.

column3: [Bug] deleting own profile it's not possible
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description ~~This is a feature request~~ Deleting picture and name (i.e. deleting profile) it's not possible  ### Steps to reproduce - go to Settings -> profile settings -> try to delete picture and name  **Actual result:** Once you have set a profile there is no possibility to delete this. Deleting picture and name doesn't work.  **Expected result:** a possibility to delete own profile e.g. setting a profile without picture and name or there should be a button "Delete this profile"   ### Device info  **Signal version:** beta v4.10.8

column3: 4.10.12 Fails to send messages (secure & unsecure) + Fails to create debug log
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Yesterday I updated to Signal 4.10.12 and it worked just as expected. Before going to bed I checked out the new encrypted profile feature, which seemingly worked. This morning I was unable to send any messages via Signal.This includes encrypted as well as unencrypted messages. As I type in the message and hit 'send' the message is shown along the history and it looks like it's going to be sent. Only after some seconds the message will disappear with no error message whatsoever. Received messages can no longer be marked read in the app. Though 'mark read' on the Android drawer still removes them from the notification area, they are still unread in the app. Update of the encrypted profile will stuck at 'Updating and encrypting profile ...' I can't even generate a debug log, as it will only show 'Loading logs...' and do nothing.  EDIT: Device restart and reregistration of my number (aka getting a new security number) solved the issue  ### Steps to reproduce - see description  ### Device info  **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log not available, see Bug description

column3: 4.11 introduced different scroll behaviours in conversation settings
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description with the new conversation settings layout different scroll behaviours are introduced, depending from where in the display you start the scrolling as well as a difference between group and 1on1 conversation settings now exists. details in the steps to reproduce below:  ### steps to reproduce: **1on1 conversation:** - go into a 1on1 conversation with shared media -  try to scroll within the "shared media" image rail. Only a part of the screen is scrolled. the profile picture does not fade out and the "shared media" image rail gets hidden behind the profile picture. - when starting to scroll from within "chat settings" the whole screen is scrolled and the profile picture fades away as expected.  ---> expected behaviour: that scrolling behaves consistent. when starting to scroll within the "shared media" image rail the whole screen should be scrolled and the profile picture should fade away.   **group conversation:** - go into a group conversation with shared media - try to scroll within the "shared media" image rail - it does not work / scroll. - try to scroll from the "chat settings" field scrolling works.  ---> expected behaviour: scrolling is also possible when starting to scroll within the "shared media" image rail   ### Device info **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.1

column3: Signal Messages behaving oddly with shift key and long press on keyboard.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description While typing in the Signal App on Android 7.0, the Shift button will activate and deactivate.  This interrupts typing, breaks autocorrect, and prevents things like long press to get a symbol (Holding the 'A' key to get the '!').  In addition to the keyboard showing inputs that aren't happening, the number at the top of the screen changes format.  Instead of showing the number below the contact name, it will randomly switch to +xxxxxxxxxx below the contact name instead of xxxxxxxxxx.  Once this happens once, it will continue to randomly Shift throughout the app being open.  No other app on the phone does this when typing.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open messenger on Android 7.0.   - Open an SMS message or a Group message (Happens in both) - Type a word, then punctuate the word with "!" by holding the "A" key.  **Actual result:**  Keyboard shifts randomly, with the Shift key becoming illuminated or not.  Typing becomes very tedious, as the quick changing of the Shift key seems to interrupt typing.  Number at the top of the screen 'flickers' between two different formats ("xxxxxxxxxx" and "+xxxxxxxxxx").  App must be closed down and reopened to type properly.  Typing may or may not trigger this again before restarting the App. **Expected result:** The message should simply type as I input the proper keys.  ### Screenshots Due to the issue, I'm unable to get a screenshot of it in it's different states, since it happens very rapidly.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S6 **Android version:** 7.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.3.2  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b7ab2376d7b38b75bc07086e1893bd4f

column3: Feature request: dual SIM active SIM indication while typing SMS
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description While typing an SMS on a dual SIM phone, it is not visible which SIM card is active. It would be very useful if this were visible.  ### Steps to reproduce - use a dual SIM phone with both SIMs active - use Signal as SMS app - use Signal to send SMS to non-Signal contact  **Actual result:** - the active SIM card is visible as ‚Äòfiller text‚Äô text in the text box when no text is in the text box (this is good) - once something is in the text box, the active card is not visible anymore (this is inconvenient when one didn't pay attention, or when continuing a concept, or on roaming state change when crossing a border) - to check (by choosing) the active SIM, it is necessary to long-press the send button  **Expected result:** - the active SIM card is visible as ‚Äòfiller text‚Äô text in the text box when no text is in the text box - once something is in the text box, the active SIM card color is used to color the send button and a small ‚Äò1‚Äô or ‚Äò2‚Äô (or ‚Äò3‚Äô,‚Ä¶ for multi-SIM-devices) is put above the arrow (at the horizontal location of the unlocked padlock) in the SMS send button icon  I assume that the SIM number, name, and color are all available through the API; obviously the SIM name is something Signal already uses. But if, for example the SIM color is not easily accessible, using the number as suggested above would already be great. So, my suggestion is just an idea from which you can create the variation that you think is best or most convenient.  P.S.: Signal also provides quick-reply functionality for directly replying to a message; also there some part of my suggestion may be useful, although it is reasonable to restrict active SIM card change to the main interface.   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini Duos (GT-i9192) **Android version:** 7.1.2 (LineageOS) **Signal version:** 4.8.1

column3: Swiping to close Signal from list of running apps closes the list of apps
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description While Signal is running in dark mode, when I use the android menu button to list all running apps, and then swipe the signal app to close it, the menu of all running apps closes (crashes?).  ### Steps to reproduce - start Signal - push the android "menu" button (that shows all running apps) - swipe the signal app to the side to close it  **Actual result:**  The display of other running apps suddenly crashes and closes. **Expected result:**  The display of other runnings apps should not close.  ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/7453ef934baae926766680bd52b8730b

column3: Calls repeatedly crash Signal on ARMv7 devices without NEON
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description While most devices support it, some older ARMv7 SoCs (like the Nvidia Tegra 2) do not support NEON instructions. Since `libjingle_peerconnection_so.so` seems to be compiled with the assumption that the device supports NEON and does not check for this during runtime, it crashes on these devices (trace included below). Ideally this should be checked during runtime (like described [here](https://developer.android.com/ndk/guides/cpu-arm-neon.html#rd)) or a non-NEON version of the library should be loaded on these devices.  ### Steps to reproduce - Use ARMv7 device without NEON support. - Receive or place a Signal call. - libjingle_peerconnection_so.so crashes Signal repeatedly with signal 4 (SIGILL), code 1 (ILL_ILLOPC).  I recompiled the M59 version of the webrtc binaries with these options:  ``` gn gen out/Release --args='target_os="android" target_cpu="arm" arm_use_neon=false libyuv_use_neon=false rtc_build_with_neon=false is_debug=false' ninja -C out/Release ```  Overwriting `/data/app-lib/org.thoughtcrime.securesms-1/libjingle_peerconnection_so.so` with the newly compiled non-NEON version of `libjingle_peerconnection_so.so` fixes this problem (until the next reboot).  ### Debug log  ``` I/DEBUG   (  129): pid: 14049, tid: 14049, name: crime.securesms  >>> org.thoughtcrime.securesms

column3: [Feature Request] Dedupe messages
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description While known and advised before import, offer and option to dedupe the afterwards. Or event when occasionally a text is sent multiple times with network issues. It would appear that once everything is imported, inside of the signal database, and decryption is not in the way, the messages could be simply hashed on Time Stamp, To, From, and Message to dedupe them.  ### Steps to reproduce - Import sms from database or text  **Actual result:** The messages are duplicated **Expected result:** After import prompt for a dedupe   ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S6 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5

data_size, _data, thumbnail, ct, cl, cd, name, pending_push FROM (SELECT DISTINCT date_sent AS date_sent, date AS date_received, _id, 'SMS::' || _id || '::' || date_sent AS unique_row_id, NULL AS attachment_id, body, read, thread_id, type, address, address_device_id, subject, NULL AS m_type, NULL AS msg_box, status, NULL AS part_count, NULL AS ct_l, NULL AS tr_id, NULL AS m_size, NULL AS exp, data_size, NULL AS _data, NULL AS thumbnail, NULL AS ct, NULL AS cl, NULL AS cd, NULL AS name, NULL AS pending_push FROM sms WHERE (read = 0) UNION ALL SELECT DISTINCT date AS date_sent, date_received AS date_received, mms._id AS _id, 'MMS::' || mms._id || '::' || date AS unique_row_id, part._id AS attachment_id, body, read, thread_id, NULL AS type, address, address_device_id, NULL AS subject,
