column3: Unable to receive push messages after switching network type
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Whenever I switch network type (from WiFi to 3G/LTE or vice versa), Signal is unable to receive any push messages. This includes normal messages and also received confirmation (the double check mark). I am however able to send messages (single check mark) and they are also received. Switching back from mobile network to WiFi also does not solve the problem. After reinstalling Signal the bug still persists.  Important: This phone does not have GCM. It appears the websocket pipe gets broken.   ### Steps to reproduce - Switch from WiFi to 3G/LTE (or vice versa)  **Actual result:** Switching to mobile network causes Signal to not receive any push messages **Expected result:** Signal is able to handle the network switch and is able to receive both messages and received confirmations.    ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S4 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/timotk/bad33a0bff9129358938cd2c4f568ada  I believe this is the relevant part:  > 03-27 11:16:39.679 31337 31371 W MessageRetrievalService: Application level read timeout... > 03-27 11:16:39.682 31337 31371 W MessageRetrievalService: Network requirement: true, active activities: 1, push pending: 0, gcm disabled: true > 03-27 11:16:39.684 31337 31371 W MessageRetrievalService: Reading message...

column3: When video enabled, speakerphone is enabled even if headset is on
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Whenever i on my cam during call loudspeaker also on with it that issue is from 3.31.4 I think and couldnt fix and now in version 4.0.1 also  :(  ### Steps to reproduce When Touch Video Cam Opt Cam On  **Actual result:**  When Touch Video Cam Opt Speaker Also On With Cam   **Expected result:** When Touch Video Cam Opt Cam On Only  ### Device info **Device:** Qmobile Noir i6 Metal One **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.0.1  ### Link to debug log https;//gist.github.com/60f90810389990a2226ad5a0b9cd3306

column3: "draft:" in conversation list even if draft contains only spaces and will be automatically deleted
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When you write a message only with spaces (for example "    ") to a contact and you don't send it but you come back to conversation list, there is not the last message of the conversation, just below the name, but "draft:" is displayed. When you re-enter to the conversation with this contact, draft is deleted. It's confusing to show "draft:" whereas there is no real/saved/restored draft.  ### Steps to reproduce - write "  " in a conversation - go back to conversation list - "draft:" is displayed below the contact name - re-enter to the contact conversation - draft were deleted  **Actual result:** Show "draft:" in conversation list even if draft contains only spaces. **Expected result:** Do not show "draft:" in this case.

column3: Word 'message' is prepended to outgoing messages when using Android Auto
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When you respond to a Signal message using voice prompts in Android Auto, the outgoing message has the string "Message " prepended to it.  ### Steps to reproduce - Plug in your Android device to a sync'd car with Android Auto (I am using a 2017 Chevy Bolt EV - have not tested on other vehicles) - Receive a Signal message - Click to have it read - Choose to respond and send - issue will occur ~50% of the time   **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) - The message "Foo bar" will go out as "Message foo bar" **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) - The message "Foo bar" will go out as "Foo bar"  ### Screenshots    ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 (aka SAMSUNG-SM-G930A) paired with 2017 Chevy Bolt EV **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/1a46db6e62f43df5dee2cbc751e95c31  ### Extra thought This may not be an issue with Signal at all, but rather with Android Auto. The last word in the voice prompt to record a message is "message". It seems reasonable that the recording may be picking up the end of the voice prompt.

column3: Change notifications' sound in general settings is useless.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When you change notifications' sound in general settings, it doesn't change notifications' sound in contacts' settings. So you must change sound for each contacts which is very long and boring. In other terms, general setting for notifications' sound works only for new contact, not for contact already there.  ### Steps to reproduce - change notifications' sound in general settings - no notifications' sound is changed  **Actual result:** Change notifications' sound in general settings is useless. **Expected result:** Change notifications' sound in general settings is usefull :  ¬∑ Either overwriting automatically each contacts' setting ¬∑ Either overwriting each contacts' setting after asking user ¬∑ Either overwriting contacts' setting of contacts selected by user during asking user ¬∑ Something else  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung A5 2017 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.14.4

column3: Disappearing messages still appear on desktop app days later
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When using the desktop app, when a person sends me a message, the chat window jumps to a section of disappearing messages from a week ago. The disappearing timer was set to five minutes. The messages disappeared from my phone correctly, but they are still visible on my computer. The messages have also disappeared on the phone and computer of the account that they were sent to.  ### Steps to reproduce Unfortunately, I have never seen this before, so I am not exactly sure of the steps to reproduce it.  Here are the repro steps from my end that made this happen: - Send messages from Android (OnePlus 3T phone, Signal v 4.6.1) - Messages were received on Android (Google Nexus 5 phone) - Use Signal Desktop a week later on a Mac (macOS Sierra 10.12.5, Chrome 58.0.3029.110)  **Actual result:** Messages that were supposed to disappear are still visible **Expected result:** Secure messages should disappear from all devices  ### Screenshots In the screenshot you can see the text about turning on and off disappearing messages but also the timestamp showing that the messages occurred last Monday:    ### Device info Computer: **Device:** Macbook Pro, macOS Sierra 10.12.5, Chrome 58.0.3029.110 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log The desktop app doesn't seem to provide debug logs. I can provide one from my phone, if that will be useful, but the bug doesn't appear on my phone.

column3: Location Link Broken
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When using the "Location" function in signal to send somebody your location, the Google Maps link is broken. Clicking it excludes the longitude. Signal seems to detect the comma that separates the latitude and longitude in the query string as the end of the URL. Perhaps it needs encoding as `%2C`.  ### Steps to reproduce - Send somebody your location - Look at the link which was generated  **Actual result:** Expected link not generated **Expected result:** Expected link generated  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20170625-135226](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/330908/27804468-fbc3a6ca-6026-11e7-9917-6e3b147c849a.png)  ### Device info **Device:** OnePlus One **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.7.4

column3: Emoji icon not visible on LineageOS
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When using Lineageos on oneplus x with system emojis enabled, the icon for the emoji drawer is not available  ### Steps to reproduce - On lineageos disable signal emojis - Go to a chat and see that the emoji icon is gone - Emojis written when signal emojis were active are displayed as system ones (testet with the macbook user and the default smile)  **Actual result:** Go to a chat and see that the emoji icon is gone **Expected result:** Go to a chat and see the normal emoji icon  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20170703-200541](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22525368/27803900-336ff042-602c-11e7-9023-e389ece7bac0.png)    ### Device info  **Device:** Oneplus X **Android version:** 7.1.2 **LineageOS version** 14.1-20170629 **Signal version:** 4.7.4

column3: Inconsistent message colors in thread
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When upgrading to 4.9.5 (I didn't check if this also occurred at 4.9.4 but it didn't happen in 4.8.1) I see that messages in this thread have 2 colors. There are preferences set for the contact and the contact is in my phone contacts but under "Lyca Mobile", not "LYCAMOBILE".  In 4.8.1   Lyca Mobile is a phone operator.  ### Screenshots Note: the number for which I received these messages has expired so I don't care  wether pin's are published here.  ![signal-inconsitent_colors_20170803-233700](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8427572/28945144-8a37a6cc-78a5-11e7-80e5-315228788fe6.jpg)  This is the same conversation (backup restored on another device) in 4.8.1: ![lyca_mobile_2017-08-03-23-46-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8427572/28945350-65364d1e-78a6-11e7-9483-7e800f9b312b.jpg)   ### Device info  **Device:** Sony Xperia Z3 compact **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.5  ### Link to debug log None.

column3: timeout during unregistering without play services
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When un-registering by tapping "signal messages and calls", it says "Error connecting to server".  I have a custom ROM based on cyanogenmod without play services, i installed signal from a backup made with titanium backup (using the "app + data" option). when the backup was made, play service were still installed. i had microG installed temporarily on the new rom, but have removed it in the meantime.   ### Device info Device  : samsung Galaxy Nexus (yakju) Android : 6.0.1 (a83d380ef9, cm_maguro-userdebug 6.0.1 MOB31K a83d380ef9 test-keys) Memory  : 22M (0.11% free, 256M max) Memclass: 96 OS Host : cyanogenmod App : Signal 4.0.0  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/3b43447bb25479a5b5ecef242bc82da7  besides the two exceptions, it also says "gcm disabled: false" which does not make sense to me.

column3: Phone number wrongly associated to contact
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When trying to send message to - or receiving message from - a phone number which only differs by one or two specific digits compared to a number in one's directory, the conversation which opens is the one corresponding to the number in the directory.  I have made some tests, only on French mobile phone numbers, which are in the format +33 (0)6 xx xx xx xx or +33 (0)7 xx xx xx xx,  and here is what I have observed: - what I have described above applies when the digit right after the leading 6 or 7 changes; - it also applies when you replace the leading 6 by a 7 or the leading 7 by a 6; - it also applies if both conditions above are met; - it seems not to apply when it is another digit which is modified; - it applies both for numbers written with an international dialling code (+33 6 xx xx xx xx) and for numbers written without it (06 xx xx xx xx); - it applies both for signal contacts and non-signal ones; - actually, if the second number is also in the directory and a previous conversation with the first number already exists within Signal, when one tries to start a conversation with the second number, the conversation with the first number opens.   ### Steps to reproduce - Pick up any number in your directory. Let's say it is 06 12 34 57 89, and that the number is the one of  Robert Dupont. - Try to write a message to a number  where the 6 or the 1 (or both) is changed, for instance 07 12 34 57 89 or 06 92 34 57 89, or 07 82 34 57 89. - Alternative to step 2: find a way to receive a message from one number such as the ones mentioned in step 2.  **Actual result:** The conversation which opens is your conversation with Robert Dupont, who has the number  06 12 34 57 89. If you send the message, it is sent to that number.  **Expected result:** The conversation window which opens should correspond to the number you actually typed (or received a message from), and the message should be sent to that same number.  ### Screenshots So, if I type any of the following numbers: ![screenshot_typing_number_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19377750/27769722-96513d26-5f30-11e7-9c6e-837fc11e24b5.png) ![screenshot_typing_number_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19377750/27769725-a26c3aac-5f30-11e7-9eef-f34cf2589c1f.png) ![screenshot_typing_number_3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19377750/27769727-abdb6f04-5f30-11e7-9faa-0a5016929f34.png)   When I press "New message to...", the conversation window which opens is: ![screenshot_result](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19377750/27769728-b0c7c51c-5f30-11e7-95c8-5483de31c60a.png) (with the contact "Contact" owning the number +33612345789 previously added in my directory)   ### Device info **Device:** HUAWEI G740-L00 **Android version:** 4.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/efed29ecd96d3ec8728c894903a43e3d

column3: Calls repeat connecting sound indefinitely when receipient is unavailable
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When trying to make a Signal call to a recipient who is unavailable due to their device being off, lacking network connectivity, or Signal not running, the caller hears the connecting tone indefinitely. With a normal phone call, the caller immediately hears the recipient's voicemail message or an automated message from the recipient's carrier.  ### Steps to reproduce - Install Signal on two devices - Turn one device off - Call the device that is off from the other one  **Actual result:** Caller hears connecting tone indefinitely **Expected result:** Caller's phone stops trying to connect if the recipient's phone is off and plays a different sound to indicate this

column3: Message ordering reflects device time, which may be inaccurate
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When the device time is wrong, messages appear out of order  ### Steps to reproduce - find a long running chat (over several days). - Change the device time to sometime in the bast - send a message in the long running chat. Have the recipient message you back  **Actual result:** The message enters the view at the bottom of the chat history as usual but then vanishes and appears earlier in the history. Likewise, when you receive a message - you'll get a notification but the message preview doesn't display the message you just received.  **Expected result:** The chats should appear in the "correct" order, with the correct time, independent from the device time. The preview should work normally.  **Additional Rationale why this behavior is undesirable**: If you travel very frequently, you may end up jumping timezones where you are sending messages in what appears to be the past. Other messengers like whatsapp correctly handle this.  ### Device info  **Device:** Galaxy S5 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9f40af46fec2f62a91cd5c996f7317a2 111

This happened on several 7.1.2 roms and on 8.1. stock now as well.   ### Steps to reproduce - Take pictures with google camera - open signal to share pictures  **Actual result:** Signal crashes and needs to be restarted **Expected result:** Signal should not crash of course ;)  ### Device info **Device:** Nexus 5x **Android version:** 8.1.0 **Signal version:** 4.14.10  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/1b6568be81fedb75b37f42dbc9d435a0

column3: Use volume rocker to click pictures
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When taking a picture you can take one by pressing the on-screen button, however most camera apps by default support clicking a picture by using either volume keys. I recommend following this practice as well.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open a conversation in Signal. - Click on the camera icon in the input field. - Observe the camera viewfinder open up with the on-screen button to click a photo. - Attempt to take a photo by clicking on either volume key.  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) No action takes place when the volume keys are pressed when the camera viewfinder is active. **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) A picture should be taken.  ### Screenshots  N/A  ### Device info  **Device:** LGE Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log  N/A

column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When switching to video from an audio call with headphone jack inserted, the switch causes the audio to get sent through the phone's speaker and internal mike.  ### Steps to reproduce - make a call with headphone inserted - make a video call  **Actual result:** The headphone and microphone plugged into the headphone jack are unresponsive **Expected result:** The audio should continue to pass through the external mike and headphones which are plugged in rather switch to the internal speaker and mike when video starts.   ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Huawei P8 lite **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.0.1  ### Link to debug log

column3: Messages send after a received SMS should not default to Signal message replies
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When Signal is used as an SMS client, it is frustrating for the user and the recipient of messages in which the recipient has Signal installed but is still using SMS. Many of my contacts have signal installed but still use SMS separately, or use iPhones where they cannot use signal for SMS.  When a Signal contact sends me an SMS message, the Signal default is to respond via a Signal message, which is confusing for the other party and inconvenient for the user, who has to remember to change the mode to SMS. This discourages users from using Signal as their SMS client.  ### Steps to reproduce Receive an SMS from a phone number registered with Signal.  **Actual result:** The user responds with a Signal message, which may appear differently on the recipient's device and cause confusion. **Expected result:** The Signal app should either match the sender's mode of communication (perhaps with a warning about encryption) OR remember the user's preference for that contact across restarts of the app.  ### Screenshots Friend sends an SMS. I reply in Signal without realizing, then re-reply via SMS. ![screenshot_20171120-104348](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5578698/33027455-25a5d1c0-cde1-11e7-99a0-7d9c755fd195.jpg)  Friend sends an SMS. I remember to change the send-mode to SMS, but after an app restart the app is back to the default of sending Signal messages. ![screenshot_20171120-104455](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5578698/33027546-5f55d76c-cde1-11e7-8d9c-fed032f0abab.jpg)     ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.12.3  ### Link to debug log

column3: Calls always income as missed ones without ringing
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When Signal is opened in front of me on my phone and via Hangouts PC I hear the other party while his Signal is actually ringing me. My Signal shows no sign that I'm being called. At the end of ringing, when the network automatically disconnects, I immediately receive a "You have a missed call" notification in the chat.  Reproduced on three different WiFi networks with the same person.  The time difference between the two phones is approximately 5 seconds. Both phones are set to synch to carrier time.  ### Steps to reproduce * Make phone A call phone B in Signal * Observe that phone B gets no notification about the incoming call just the missed one.  ### Device info  **Device:** Sony F5121 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.10  ### Link to debug log   Callee debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9984ab543d85a181b06b02954564c060 Caller debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/5eae662fee114e5e07a72dbd02c0e92d

column3: Percent-encoded SMS URLs are handled improperly.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When Signal attempts to open an sms: url in which the initial `+` sign is encoded as `%2B`, the way it interprets the URL is not in keeping with other SMS apps.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open the URL `sms:%2B18005551212` in signal.  **Actual result:** Signal creates a new message to +1218005551212. (Signal strips the % and B, then prepends +1 to the resulting number.) **Expected result:** Signal creates a new message to +18005551212.  ### Device info OnePlus 3T running latest LineageOS  ### Notes: - Google's SMS app (com.google.android.apps.messaging) handles this url as described in "Expected Behavior" above. - The sms: urls described in RFC 5724 use an actual + sign, rather than url-encoding the plus sign as %2B. As such, it's not clear whether my example URL should be valid or not. However, it is obvious how this URL is intended to be parsed, and some developers do create SMS urls this way. - The Lyft android app is an example of an app that generates sms: urls with %2B in place of the plus sign. As such, this app works with the built-in SMS app, but breaks with Signal.

column3: Attachments Sent Cannot Be Accessed on Android Side
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When sending an attachment of any file extension (tested with TXT, MP4, PDF, ZIP) will be sent to the recipient (be it via Desktop client ~~or within Android~~) they are delivered but you cannot do anything like open them, or save them, on Android conversation with that recipient and often show Unknown File as the name. They also do not show up under the documents tab of the media library for that conversation.  ### Steps to reproduce - Send a file to someone, using desktop client - Attempt to open or save them on Android client - The files are unknown and inaccessible - Check all media and the documents tab and they will not be there either  Issue originally opened here: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1853 (worked with Scott to figure out what is going on, he was able to reproduce the issue and found it to be an Android client issue, could not reproduce on iOS client and was suggested I open this issue here)  Issue similar to https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6791 (except not just for PDF but for ANY file type - list of tested types so far mentioned above) and the system contains viewers for all these file types and they work normally outside of the client, the issue is not opening them but rather that you can't open or save them at all, they basically show up as an entry with unknown as the file name and nothing more can be done with them.  **Actual result:** The files are not accessible and marked as unknown under the Android side for anything sent either via Desktop client to someone. **Expected result:** Files should be properly listed with their names and be accessible to open or save and appear under the documents tab of the all media library.  ### Screenshots Screenshots available at the referenced original issue above but do not reveal anything special beyond what is described.  ### Device info **Device:** Motorola Nexus 6 (shamu) **Android version:** Nougat 7.1.1 (stock N6F27M) **Signal version:** 4.14.3 (beta)  ### Logs https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f06a523736972102de8f296e85c224fc  I would be happy to provide anything else you need and as with Scott, we worked directly with each other to send stuff so we can see the behavior, if anyone needs me to use the special debug build and do the same, be happy to do it, just give me a way to contact you privately like with Scott. Thanks.

column3: Registration per Websocket works, but is not propagated to other users
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When register a new account per websocket, the registration works and I can send push messages to other contacts, but my account is not propagated to other users. This seems to be a problem with version 4.13. I have tried with 4.12 and everything works. I've also tried on two phones with two different numbers (same phone model, OS and apk) with the same results.  Existing accounts with websocket connection work with 4.13, too.  ### Steps to reproduce - compile Signal 4.13.6 - install on a phone without GCM - register an account  **Actual result:** Registration works. I can send push messages to other contacts. But other contacts don't see my account and have only the abbility to send SMS.  I also tried to link a Signal Desktop installation. The QR-code scan works, but Signal Desktop freezes with "Generating keys" and the phone account is disconnected. A message like this is shown on the phone: Your account seems to be connected on another device. Please register again.  **Expected result:** Other contacts see my account.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy SII **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.13.6  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/f8fe91f1bc40e59312833c0ca291d533

column3: Screen turns on, despite still being next to the ear (voice and audio messages)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When listening to an audio or voice message ends, the screen turns on and the touchscreen accepts input, despite the phone still being next to the ear, after listening to an audio or voice message. This leads to unwanted calling and other actions, the user never intended to do.  ### Steps to reproduce - Start listening to an audio or voice message. - Hold the phone next to the ear, so that the screen turns off and input from the touchscreen is ignored. - Wait for the audio or voice message to end.  **Actual result:** The screen turns back on and input from the touchscreen is no longer ignored. **Expected result:** The screen stays off and input is ignored, as long as the phone is next to the ear.   ### Device info **Device:** Moto X Play **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.0  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d495bc418ede007bf7b5f563f446ea85

Signal was already set as the default messaging app.  Changing to Messages, then going through the steps works as expected.  Something with the assumption that Signal is not default? column3: Video calls should not continue transmitting video when call screen is not foreground view.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When in a video call, if I tab out of the application, transmission of video should stop and the user I am talking to should see their contact image of me.  ### Steps to reproduce - Use latest android app. - Call someone who is using latest iOS app. - During video call go to the home screen, or task-switch to another app  **Actual result:** The iOS user I am speaking to should *NOT* continue to see what my camera is seeing. **Expected result:** The iOS user I am speaking to is able to continue to see live video feed from my camera while I am in another application.  When the behavior is reversed, and the iOS user switches apps, the live video stops and I see their user icon, so this appears to be the correct expected behavior.  It's possible that it would be useful to continue transmitting video while switched to another application, *especially* if #6279 is implemented, however this should be something that must be user-enabled each time. (other video chat apps have set the standard that video transmission pauses once the app is backgrounded.)  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Moto X Pure 2015 **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 3.31.4  ### Link to debug log

column3: [4.13.1] Unable to share to group from another app when not listed in recent chats.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I try to share from an another app I cannot share to a group when it's not listed in the recent chat history. The recent chats only contains 5 items, which is a mixture of contacts and groups. When I scroll down to the contacts there are no groups. Also searching for the group did not find it.  ### Steps to reproduce - open an other app - select share with signal - try to share to a group, not listed in the recent chats.  **Actual result:** Unable to find the group. **Expected result:** Should be able to select the group. I guess the best solution would be that the group is listed in the contact list. Which seems to be tracked here #6053  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.13.1  ### Link to debug log

column3: [4.14.1] Signal crashes when trying to send sms without sms permissions.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I try to send an sms with the sms permissions disabled, Signal crashes. I'm not having sms enabled in Signal however by long pressing the paperclip icon in a conversation I can send an sms. Since 4.14 would support permissions I thought, let's disable the sms permissions for Signal and send an sms by long pressing the paperclip. As a result I got the message "Signal stopped" and it cannot be started again. I first had to enable the sms permissions before I was able to start Signal again.  ### Steps to reproduce - Disable sms permissions for Signal - In a conversation long press the paperclip so you can send an unsecured sms - Send unsecured sms message  **Actual result:** Signal crashes **Expected result:** After selecting unsecured sms in a conversation I would expect Signal to request the sms permission and after excepting it I would be able to send an sms or if I denied it sms would not be possible.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.1  ### Link to debug log  logcat output: 12-04 13:44:28.219 14129 14144 W JobConsumer: java.lang.SecurityException: Sending SMS message: uid 10210 does not have column3: [Issue] SMS messaging part in Signal slows down and becomes unusable
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I try to open SMS conversation in Signal. It slows down and becomes unusable. Scrolling through the texts becomes laggy.  Bringing up a keyboard takes a few seconds and if keyed in, will not input a character due to extreme lag.  ### Steps to reproduce Note: this may not be reproducible bug but here's what I did:  Wiped the phone and reinstalled a select few apps including Signal.  Set up Signal as normal and used plaintext import option to keep my messages.  Signal ran normally.  Removed SIM 1 (Three) then moved SIM 2 to slot 1 (EE). Added new SIM to slot 2.  Signal started to run slowly when viewing SMS conversations. Other Android Google app (Message) also had the same issue.  Wiping conversations and other data as well as reinstalling the app did not work.  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) N/A  **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) It shouldnt slow down.  ### Screenshots N/A   ### Device info  **Device:** Oneplus 3 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.8  ### Link to debug log   https://gist.github.com/44d802059305d74dbf56de6c27f29110

column3: 4.9.9 repeatedly crashing, cannot enter passphrase
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I try to open Signal, it flashes the "Enter passphrase" screen and then crashes, and I get the "Unfortunately, Signal has stopped" Android error.  This behavior started before Burning Man, but I didn't have time to troubleshoot it then, and I had my phone off that week & Labor Day weekend anyway. I was hoping it was a transient issue that would somehow work itself out when I came back to cell signal, but no such luck.  I didn't get a chance to poke at it until this weekend, when I went to the Play Store to see if there was any update to the Signal app.  Updating to 4.9.9 gave me the ability to enter my passphrase once, and I could see my conversation list for a moment, but then an "updating database" screen came up, stayed for about 60 seconds, and then Signal crashed again. After it stopped during the "updating database" it's back to the same behavior (crash at the "enter passphrase" screen) as before the update.  Restart / wait / try again did not resolve - I waited about five minutes.  I'm using Signal from the Play Store. Airplane mode doesn't change the behavior.   I looked at issue #6948 but this doesn't appear to be a duplicate (different platform, different logcat errors)  ### Steps to reproduce This happens every time I try to open Signal.  **Actual result:** When I tap the Signal icon, it flashes the "Enter passphrase" screen and then crashes, and I get the "Unfortunately, Signal has stopped" Android error.  **Expected result:** When I tap the Signal icon, it allows me to enter my passphrase and access my messages.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** LG G3 LGLS990 **Android version:** 4.4.2 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  My phone is rooted.  ### Link to debug log I can't capture a debug log because it won't run, but attached is the adb logcat.  [signal crash - adb logcat.txt](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/files/1297849/signal.crash.-.adb.logcat.txt)

column3: Signal crashes on opening (4.13.4)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I tap on Signal logo, Signal seems to open for halo a second then closes. No error, no toast. Also my contacts told me that they sent messages, but I had no notifications. I am on Signal Beta (4.13.4). I reinstalled yesterday (Nov 24) because I bought a new phone (oneplus 5t). It worked with no issues for 24h. I tried to clean cache and to reboot phone.  ### Steps to reproduce - tap signal icon  **Actual result:** Very brief flash (half a second) of the animation of app opening. Then back to home screen. **Expected result:** Signal opens and I receive my message.  ### Screenshots If necessary I can upload a screen recording.  ### Device info  **Device:** Oneplus 5t (8gb ram) **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.13.4  ### Link to debug log  I can't open app. Is there another way to get error log?

column3: sent sms messages still show pending
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I send a sms, the three bouncing dots indicate "sending" indefinitely. MMS gets a sent checkmark. I have verified with the recipient that the messages got through.   ### Steps to reproduce - send sms  **Actual result:** messages show "pending" **Expected result:** messages show "via sms"  ### Screenshots  ![unsent2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8355554/29176680-5fbd26d2-7da1-11e7-9937-eab51007bb17.png) ![unsent1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8355554/29176677-5e3f0c1c-7da1-11e7-929c-c738ded760a1.png)   ### Device info  **Device:** Google Pixel **Android version:** 8.0.0 (4187591, OPP4.170623.014) **Signal version:** Signal 4.9.7  ### Link to debug log   https://gist.github.com/anonymous/fd40b948f7dd24781d0f4316f0530260 https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b7599368a85b42dce46d8791b7cb708e

column3: Pictures send from Signal desktop are not visible on master android device
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I send a picture from Signal desktop to someone, the picture is sent successfully to the recipient  but on the Android Master device I only see an empty white frame.  ### Steps to reproduce - send picture from Signal desktop to a friend - check if she received the picture - check on your Android master device if the message has been synced  **Actual result:*The picture is successfully sent to friend but on the Android Master device the picture is not visible **Expected result:** The picture send from Signal Desktop should be received by the friend and the message should be synced to the master device.  ### Screenshots ![signal-2017-08-29-203727](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6071818/29843107-660b7198-8cfa-11e7-8386-0ebc7a3f1082.png)  ### Device info **Device:** samsung SM-N910F **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/a5e559d18f6b4d96a70b9d56e6f25492

column3: notification reply button doesn't always work for groups
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I receive a notification for a signal message I see buttons to: - Mark read - Reply  When using the aforementioned reply button to send a message to a group, sometimes only one of the group members gets my reply.  ### Steps to reproduce - create a new group which contains insecure users. - send a message so the group is saved - leave the group screen so you can get notifications about it - wait to receive a message from the group - when a message arrives, reply directly to the notification (see above description)  **Actual result:** only one of the members in the group receives a direct message containing your reply. **Expected result:** all of the members receive a group message containing your reply.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log  Can't provide one now. Will try to if anyone asks me to.

column3: Sender not in contact list message when opening a conversation.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I open some old 1:1 conversations from the conversation list I get the message "The sender is not in your contact list". These persons are in my contact list though and if I check my contact list, Signal is listed in the "connected via" list. Also some of them are part of Signal groups that I do use regularly.  It can easily be resolved by choosing the "Add to contacts" option and then directly go back to Signal, without actually adding the contact so it's not a major issue however it's a bit confusing. Attached a logfile from the moment I opened a conversation and got the "Sender not in contact list" message. Just to specify 'old' :-) Conversations older then September show this behavior.   ### Steps to reproduce - Open old conversation   **Actual result:** Some contacts are reported not to be in the contact list when they actually are. **Expected result:** Don't get "sender not in contact list" message for contacts that are in the contact list.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.1  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/2f9eb52d3f69ede8cd82e1208122da28

column3: Icon for advanced settings equals that of appearance on Android 4.4.4
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I open settings on an Android 4.4.4 device the icon for "Advanced" equals that of "Appearance". On Android 6.0.1 this is not the case. Now that I look back to the screenshot in issue https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6601 , this was already so in 4.5.2.  ### Screenshots Android 4.4.4: ![screenshot_signal460-android444](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427572/26029498/9fc32282-3836-11e7-9d7a-fd433572d33f.png)  Android 6.0.1: ![screenshot_signal460-android601](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427572/26029501/a4945182-3836-11e7-8b8d-714a1ef45cdf.png)  ### Device info **Device 1:** Sony Xperia Z1 Compact **Android version:** 4.4.4 **Signal version:** 4.6.0  **Device 2:** Sony Xperia Z3 Compact **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.0  The bug is located in src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ApplicationPreferencesActivity.java, line 218:  ```java this.findPreference(PREFERENCE_CATEGORY_ADVANCED).setIcon(appearance); ``` it should be ```java this.findPreference(PREFERENCE_CATEGORY_ADVANCED).setIcon(advanced); ```

column3: Problems with multiple safety number errors in group message
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I only partially addressed the outgoing identity key errors in a partially-sent group message, the error notification went away in the conversation view. But not all recipients had received the message. Also, the verification decision I made for a user didn't show up in the conversation view or on my linked desktop install.  ### Steps to reproduce   - In a group with four participants, all are verified   - Keeping the conversation open, two participants reregister   - Attempt to send a message   - Get an error in the conversation, and you can tap the message for more information. You see two errors, with view buttons.   - Tap the first 'view' button, and see a dialog explaining the situation. Tap Accept. First error is now gone.   - Tap the second 'view' button, see the dialog, tap the text to take you to the safety number screen. Then back out of all that - tapping cancel on the dialog, then back to the conversation view.  ### Actual/expected 1. The conversation view no longer shows an error. Expected the message to still have the red icon. One recipient never got the message, but the conversation view shows no error. 2. The decision I made about that first user's new identity key was not added to the conversation view. This was also not sync'd to the linked desktop, so a message sent from desktop ran into the two identity key errors even though a verification decision had happened on Android.  ### Device info **Device:** Moto G5 Plus **Android version:** Android 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/183b9ff4e8104a092b18eec0a95624b1

column3: Signal deleted all my contacts
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I installed signal, it deleted most of the contacts on my phone. Only a few remain, they appear to be other signal uses. About 90% of contacts were lost.  ### Steps to reproduce - Install signal on an Android phone - Set it to be the default SMS app - Check contacts list  **Actual result:** All phone contacts have disappeared from the phone's contact list except perhaps those belonging to people who have signal (I'm unsure if every remaining contact has signal and if that is what saved those contacts, but there seems to be a correlation). When checking call logs, these missing contacts show up as unknown numbers. I have observed this occurring on two different phones. **Expected result:** Contacts should remain.  ### Device info **Device 1:** LG G3 **Android version:** 5.0 **Signal version:** 4.5.3  **Device 1:** Samsung Galaxy S5 **Android version:** Unknown (not my phone) **Signal version:** 4.5.3

column3: When I initiate a voice call, the other end cannot hear me
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I initiate a voice call to any of my contacts, they can never hear me while I can hear them. However, when I receive a voice call, we both can hear each other and it works fine.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal - Call any contact - Wait for them to pick up  **Actual result:** The contact cannot hear me. **Expected result:** The contact should be able to hear me.  ### Device info  **Device:** HTC Desire (htc_bravo) **Android version:** 4.0.4 (eng.k900.20120624.010557, IMM76I) **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log Output of `adb logcat` (anonymized) just after reproducing the bug after a fresh reboot: https://gist.github.com/righy/39fb39c8e2bf2d10031fde7aab2d748c

column3: Delete function inserts characters from earlier in the message
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I have entered text into a text message field and then want to delete a typo I press the delete key. At this point signal inserts a previous word from my message, appends it to the location below my cursor and deletes from it. This causes it to take about twice as long to delete any word, as it inserts a word on first delete press.  ### Steps to reproduce - Type a message - hit delete - notice that there are extra characters inserted that were not there before delete was pressed.  **Actual result:** A word from previously in the message is now before the cursor. (but with a letter deleted as a result of pressing delete) (the word is also still in its proper place in the message) **Expected result:** The character before the cursor should be deleted.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4  ### Link to debug log

column3: Typed Text Is Not Visible
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I go to type a message the text I type does not appear inside the input box.  The "spell-check" seems to detect the words as it makes recommendations, but the typed text is invisible.  This does not happen every time I try to send a message.  This happens occasionally, and seemingly random.  ### Steps to reproduce - I have not yet determined what spawns this, and as such do not currently know how to intentionally reproduce this - When this happens, I "back" out of Signal, then go back into Signal (no cache clearing, or force stopping, et cetera), and Signal then shows typed text.  **Actual result:** The above description covers this. **Expected result:** When typing a message, I should be able to see the text I am typing, character by character, prior to sending the message.  ### Screenshots Fail on my part.  I will grab some screenshots the next time this happens.  ### Device info **Device:** Google Pixel XL **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.0  ### Link to debug log Yep, on a roll here.  I have not pulled a debug log yet, but will next time this happens.

column3: "Learn more" web link from "Verify safety number" results in 404 error
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I click on link "Learn more" in "Verify safety number" I see address whispersystems.org redirects to signal.org and reports 404. It looks like http server redirect for this particular link is not working properly.  ### Steps to reproduce - Start Signal. - From main Signal window click on pencil button. - List of contacts is displayed. Click on one of Signal user. - From top-right menu select "Conversation settings". - Select "View safety number". - At the bottom tab on link "Learn more".  **Actual result:** Now problem appears. In address bar there is https://whispersystems.org/redirect/safety-numbers that redirects to https://signal.org/redirect/safety-numbers but this page displays "404" with text "Something is amiss! You might try browsing for what you wanted." Clicking on link "browsing for what you wanted" displays https://moxie.org web page.  **Expected result:** Instead o 404 actual help should be displayed.  **My humble suggestion:** - Quick fix: fix the http server redirect (this will fix help links in currently installed Signal versions) - Long term fix: replace all of the whispersystems.org links to signal.org in Signal app (the same in iOS and desktop version) to remove chance of redirect problems.

column3: exporting and importing completely breaks group chats
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description when exporting and importing data from and to signal, the imported data is completely broken, all messages i've received in a group chat are now under the conversation with the person who sent it, not under the group chat, the only messages that are still in the group chat are the ones that you've sent yourself, essentially making it impossible to piece back how the conversations went, on both the private chat and the group chat  ### Steps to reproduce - export data - uninstall Signal - install signal again - import data  **Actual result:** described above **Expected result:** all group chat messages are still under the group chat, not scattered between the messages of 1on1 conversations  ### Screenshots    ### Device info **Device:** Oneplus3T **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.8.1 before reinstall, 4.7.4 after reinstall (wanted to move back because notifications seem broken on 4.8.1)  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/646df806f62e842efe8fe201a5544c86 {the end of the log is when i tried to deleted the messages because they're useless to me}

column3: Signal Crashes if you swipe to dismiss "Inbox Zeeerrro"
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When everything is archived and the (rather stupid IMHO but that's unrelated) "Inbox zeeerrro" message is showing, you can swipe right to dismiss it.  This causes a "Signal has stopped" message.  ### Steps to reproduce - Swipe to archive all messages on front screen. - View the "Inbox zeeerrro" message and say to yourself "Gawd that's silly, I'll swipe right to dismiss THAT" - Swipe right to dismiss it. - Signal Crashes  **Actual result:** Signal Crashes **Expected result:** "Inbox zeeerrro" message goes away, or unable to swipe away "Inbox zeeerrro" message.  ### Screenshots There is nothing worthwhile to take a screenshot of.  It's either the "Inbox zeeerrro" message or the "Signal has stopped" message.   ### Device info  **Device:** Pixel OG **Android version:** 8.1.0 Dec Security Patch **Signal version:** 4.14.9  ### Link to debug log Unable to capture, Signal crashes and exits.  ### Other I have clicked the "Send Feedback" button a number of times, I don't know if you or Google get that feedback info.

column3: Incoming messages are only received after sending a message
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When encrypted text messages come from a verified contact, sometimes I do not receive them until I send another message back.  Other similar bugs mentioned that power saving may be an issue. Via the "Security" app in the MIUI I set battery saver to "Off", and under "App Battery Saver", Signal has a custom setting  of "No Restrictions".  ### Steps to reproduce I cannot consistently reproduce the bug. Steps that have caused it in the past: - Signal is open in the background (i.e., I have recently used it, have not closed it via the task manager, but have used other apps since opening it) - Contact sends a text message to me - I open the signal app - I send a message back to the contact  **Actual result:** The message they sent appears only after I have sent another message back to them **Expected result:** The message from the contact should be received as soon as it is sent  ### Screenshots In the screenshot you can see that the final message shown was from 39 minutes ago, yet was delivered after the message I sent 22 minutes ago. This was because the final message was only delivered after I sent the second-last message. This means that in the debug log, it will be around 16:49 when the message was finally displayed, thought it may have been received any time after 16:32. Line 532 is right around the time this would have happened. ![screen shot 2017-11-27 at 5 13 38 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8398540/33292220-74303d66-d396-11e7-8779-636f62f75e63.png)    ### Device info Device  : Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 (mido) Android : 7.0 (V9.0.3.0.NCFMIEI, AL1512-mido-build-20171028011511) Memory  : 34M (24.05% free, 512M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : mi-server App     : Signal 4.12.3  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/6848cc7789aefa05008659a5c4f3caa1

column3: Disable (or at least add an option to disable) separation of Signal vs non-Signal users in Contacts list
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When creating new message and looking for the contact, user has to search first in alphabetically sorted list of Signal-using contacts and then in alphabetically sorted list of non-Signal-using contacts to find a non-Signal-using recipient. Assuming you don't know if your recipient is using Signal(why should one even care) it adds unnecessary overhead for searching. When using Signal as default SMS app, this results in clunky UX.  ### Steps to reproduce - press round blue icon with pen - contacts are sorted by those using Signal and those not using it  **Actual result:** Contacts are separated into Signal and non-Signal. **Expected result:** Contacts are sorted alphabetically only(or there is an option to enable this).  ### Device info **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 14.4.10

column3: Contact "joined" Signal notification can be misleading
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When a person that already is on Signal is added to the phones contacts, the "contact joined Signal" notification is somewhat misleading, whereas "contact is on Signal" is more generally correct. This confusion will occur more often the more people already are on Signal.  I also think that "is on Signal" sounds less scary than "joined Signal".  ### Steps to reproduce - add a new contact to your phone - on the next day, see generated notification: "contact joined Signal" - ask your contact about it: tells you he joined Signal months/years ago  The wording was changed in 75782affd1a1996b408731babe41f53d0f4cdae8.

column3: Unable to send or receive MMS with two Cricket phones
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When a non-Signal user sends MMS to either of two phones using Signal Private Messenger with Cricket service, message fails to download. The following error is received:  "Error downloading MMS message, tap to retry"  Tapping to retry also fails.  When attempting to *send* an MMS message to a non-Signal user, the message "Not delivered" is received. Tapping for details shows the message "Failed to send" and tapping "RESEND" also fails to send message.  Each phone's standard messaging app is able to send and receive MMS successfully.  Troubleshooting steps that did not resolve the issue: - Using data vs Wi-Fi - Disabling data network and only using Wi-Fi - Restart phone - Uninstall / reinstall Signal - Reset APN information from Cricket - Enable 'WiFi Calling' compatibility mode  Settings in use - Receive all SMS & Receive all MMS / SMS Enable (Signal is set as default messaging app) - SMS deliver reports are disabled - "Manual MMS settings" are all set to default  ### Steps to reproduce - Receive MMS message (from non-Signal user) - View message "Error downloading MMS message, tap to retry" - Tap the MMS button to retry - Message attempts to download but is never successful  **Actual result:** MMS messages are not received **Expected result:** MMS messages should be received and downloaded.  ### Device info  **Device 1:** HTC One S (HTC VLE_U, from T-Mobile) **Android version:** 4.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  **Device 2:** Samsung Galaxy S4 (SGH-M919, from T-Mobile) **Android version:** 4.4.4 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log Device 1: https://gist.github.com/cffa944e6416c6dafda2b4cffd5122fd  Device 2: https://gist.github.com/0e39d8b53302fbe3620db2fcfdecea15

column3: New group member resets the disappearing messages timer
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When a new user is added to a group for which a disappearing messages timer has been set, the first message the new users sends also resets the timer ("NewUser set disappearing messages time to Off").  ### Steps to reproduce - Create a group with a couple of users; - Set a disappearing messages timer and test it; - Add a new user to the group, *note that the new user doesn't see the timer as set*; - Have the new user send a message to the group *before any other user*. - This message disables the timer for everybody.  **Expected result:** The new user sees the timer immediately after being added to the group.  This doesn't happen if the new user receives a message before sending anything. In this case s/he gets the timer information.  Edit: the same problem occurs when linking a desktop client and sending a message to a group from it. In this case it seems that receiving a message is not enough for getting the right timer information: the first message sent from the desktop client still resets the timer.  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 6 **Android version:** Stock Android 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.0.0-play

column3: Change New Signal Contact Behavior - "XXX is on Signal, say hey!"
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When a new user installs Signal, Signal notifies all of their contacts who have Signal that Signal has been installed. This is an invitation to communication which may be unwanted or long outdated.  ### Steps to reproduce - Install Signal - Get messages from ex-lovers or business associates you have no interest in communicating with  **Actual result:** Signal, without advising me, tells everyone with my phone number stored in their phone that I have installed Signal. **Expected result:** When I install Signal, it should be my choice if Signal tells everyone who has my phone number, intentionally or not, that I've done so.  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20170321-125045](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10855297/24168062/3b15678e-0e36-11e7-9d83-26794a2962cf.png)  Notification from an OKCupid date 8 years ago.   Two suggestions:  - Allow the new user to choose if these notifications are generated. - Only notify a contact that Signal is available when composing a new message to a contact with Signal installed.

column3: Unregistered contact still marked as verified
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When a contact, whose safety number was verified, unregisters from Signal, it is still marked as verified.  ### Steps to reproduce - verify safety number of contact A - contact A unregisters from Signal - check conversation with contact A: messages are sent as SMS  **Actual result:** Contact is still marked as verified. You can still access "view safety number" in conversation settings. **Expected result:** Contact is not marked as verified. Option to view safety number is invisible.  ### Device info **Signal version:** 4.7.1

column3: user abadoned signal, workaround
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Well the problem i have is some contacts hav tested Signal (on iOS) but have stoped useing the app. Signal stil expect them to use Signal. Since on my P9 I use Signal for all communiction SMS get to Signal conversation flow. If the contact that have passively abadoned signal write an SMS it gets listed and Signal defaults to send them an answer over data service, which the doesent reach the Phone of the SMS message received before. This is very bad. Moste of the time I am aware the person doesnt use Signal and chose SMS to sen dthe message but sometimes I forget it and the to be receiving person is going to be upset because she doesn't receive an answer. ### Steps to reproduce - register mobile number A for signal - delete app from phone of user A - send an SMS from user A to B - B uses Signal Android as SMS App - B receives SMS message insecure - B knows A has removed Signal from phone and wants to write back but forgets to choose SMS for sending the message - A doesn't receive the message because it never contacts the server    **Actual result:**  contact doesn't receive an answer **Expected result:**  Either the receiver should get the message over the way he sent it to the receiver or the sender should be made aware the receiver probably doesn't uses signal anymore or  sms should be a default option to chose from in contact setting  There are some workaround for this - drop SMS on Android app altogether (which is a no brainier in myy eyes) - make trafic type selection permanent, in user settings, which would just wire up some available functions as defaults (workaround) - implement active database , eg a number doesn't communicate once in a (to be defined, weeks/months ) timeframe to the server (connect to server not sending receiving a message) either   1.  drop the number from Secure user circle  2. or notify the sender of a data message the chat partner has seen no data usage recently and my not receive the message in time (optimal, but provides probably meta data leak)  ### Device info  **Device:** HUaweii P9 to iPhone 6 **Android version:** 7.0.0 **Signal version:** All until to date as of writing

column3: New emoji need multiple backspace taps for deletion
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Using emojis there are two types of backspace buttons you can use for removing them: the one from the emoji drawer and the one from your keyboard.  Using new emoji like üßú (basically [Emoji 5.0](https://emojipedia.org/emoji-5.0/), I think) shows different behaviours of the backspace buttons. I have to press the backspace button of my keyboard four times to make the emoji disappear. With the backspace button from the emoji drawer it disappears after one tap (expected behaviour).  This issue may be related to #6676. Threema shows the exact same behaviour, WhatsApp needs three taps for deletion.  ### Steps to reproduce - open a conversation - open emoji drawer - enter a emoji from the Emoji 5.0 set in the input field - open keyboard - press backspace button (repeat until emoji disappears)  **Actual result:** I have to press the backspace button four times. **Expected result:** Emoji disappears after one backspace tap.  ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.9

column3: Recurring Blank "Select SIM card" Popup When No SIM Is In Phone
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Using a phone without a SIM card. Using Signal only through WiFi. Signal seems to be recognizing there is no SIM card, as if it has lost contact with the SIM or it is a dual-SIM phone (it is not). So every time a contact's message page is opened, an empty popup asks to "Select SIM card" and there is none to select. This doesn't make Signal very user-friendly since you have to hit outside the popup before reading or sending a message. And this happens over and over again every time you click on a contact's name to send a message or see what was sent.  ### Steps to reproduce - Take out phone's SIM card. - While SIM card is out of phone, try to send a message to a contact.  **Actual result:** "Select SIM card" popup will be there every time.  **Expected result:** "Select SIM card" popup will not be there every time. That Signal doesn't need a SIM card to be present, since non-SIM phone numbers can also be used to register with Signal.  ### Screenshots   ![signal_screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27523404/31873280-acdbdc48-b7b1-11e7-83a8-b164c7e492cb.jpg)  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.10.12

column3: duplicate groups
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description User sent image to group with poor connection. Group member responded. Thread list looked like this afterwards:  ![signal-2017-03-27-095226](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10261186/24354110/f37f58f2-12f0-11e7-8b3f-10f992bdd720.png)   As you can see, the group is listed twice. New incoming messages arrive in the new one (but old messages are only in the old group), new outgoing messages arrive in both.  After a reboot the old group appears with a new name ("+X" where X is a set of numbers) and the group avatar is gone. The old group can no longer be used to send signal messages, it displays the "enable signal for sms" button.   ### Device info  **Device:** Xiaomi HM 1SW (armani) **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** Signal 4.0.0  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/0833749e245fe91bfda6ca7712f5a7a1 Since the debug log contains only **four** minutes, it contains no useful info as the incident happened before.

column3: Neither SMS nor call registration works
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Unable to register -- SMS is not intercepted by Signal (and hence not used); `CALL ME` button does not seem to have any effect ("Requesting call" message pops up, but no incoming call is ever received).  I recognize Jolla is not supported, but previous versions (3.16.x for example) of (Libre)Signal used to work well. Registration via a call was possible.  A simple fix would be to allow manually typing the code received via the SMS (perhaps after clearly informing the user about the problems with this approach). The code does not currently seem to work with Voice Verification.  ### Steps to reproduce - install Signal on Jolla (using either Signal Website Release, f-droid, or LibreSignal) - enter phone number when prompted - receive SMS; SMS verification timeouts anyway - tap `CALL ME`, expect a call with the code  **Actual result:** No call is ever received; tapping `CALL ME` multiple times ends in the "Too many requests!" message **Expected result:** Incoming call with the code is received, registration can go through.  ### Device info  **Device:** Jolla **Android version:** 4.1.2 (alien dalvik) **Signal version:** Website Release 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log   No access to the debug log, since this happens before registration.

column3: [4.13.6] Unable to complete registration
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Unable to complete registration if user is not authenticated in GooglePlayServices.  ### Steps to reproduce - you need a device where user is not authenticated in GoogleAccount - install Signal v4.13.6 - type your phone number and tap on "Registration" button  **Actual result:** I got a message "Unable to connect to service. Please check network connection and try again." **Expected result:** You should catch GCM IOException [here](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/RegistrationActivity.java#L288) when you try to obtain gcmToken.  ``` Optional gcmToken = Optional.absent(); column3: message queue stuck, only flushed after media send
