column3: Time span of messages uses incorrect grammar in Polish
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Time label of messages (`DateUtils_minutes_ago`) uses incorrect grammar in Polish (and possibly in other languages that uses some strange grammar rules).  Numerals in Polish are complicated. Below is the correct grammar: - 1 minuta - 2 minuty - 3 minuty - 4 minuty - 5 minut - 6 minut - 7 minut, etc...  I understand that this cannot be done simply by changing the translation file. `DateUtils` does not support 'advanced' grammar rules like this. This would be done programatically.  I could prepare a pull request to fix this critical issue, but before I start any work I would like to hear your opinion whether this change would be considered as something useful. üòÑ   ### Steps to reproduce - Write a message while using Polish locale. - Observe time span.  **Actual result:** - It will show: Teraz, 2 minuta, ... , 8 minuta.  (English: Now, 2 minutes, ... , 8 minutes) **Expected result:** - It should show: Teraz, 2 minuty, ... , 8 minut.  ### Screenshots ![scr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32469996/31151702-f75ebe8e-a898-11e7-811c-855cc5d1cafd.png)   ### Device info **Device:** Motorola Moto G4 **Android version:** Stock 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.12

column3: Disappearing & Reappearing draft
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description This issue is not about the feature called "Disappearing Messages". It's about a draft that I composed, left in the draft compose box and that, when I made a Signal voice call, disappeared from the draft compose box. Strangely, when I left the app and then re-entered the app, the missing draft re-appeared.  ### Steps to reproduce - compose a draft - make a Signal voice call to the message draft recipient - check that the draft disappeared - leave Signal, returning execution to the Android OS - re-enter Signal, see that the draft returned.  **Actual result:** described above  **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) - compose a draft - make a Signal voice call to the message draft recipient - check that the draft did not disappear from the draft compose box  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:**OnePlus A0001 (bacon) **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4  ### Link to debug log App did not crash, so no debug log included

column3: Signal messages/calls "enabled" after unregistering
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description This issue has been introduced with the webrtc calling functionality. (tested with 3.30.x enabled beta calling and 3.31.x) When you open a conversation with a signal contact after unregistering, it looks as if you are still able to send signal messages and make secure calls. It is even possible to initiate a secure call that never successfully connects, but the other device will receive a "missed call" notification.  EDIT: found the culprit 53d590947ed7d60129fddb014550cd8490ec71c4  ### Steps to reproduce - Unregister (settings > advanced > toggle "Signal messages and calls" off > confirm dialog) - Open a conversation with a signal contact  **Actual result:** It looks as if you are still registered (blue send button, phone icon with lock etc.) **Expected result:** Only SMS functionality should be available. (gray send button, phone icon without lock etc.)  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 3.31.1  ### Link to debug log

column3: Missed "leave group" event will eventually get member re-added to groups
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description This is somewhat of an extension of #6177 with additional consequences.  I changed phone numbers and devices, added my new number and removed my old number from a few large groups.  A small fraction of group members didn't receive the update (maybe due to key changes, but I don't know).  Some weeks later, these group members have updated the group to add new members or change the group name, and this had the practical effect of propagating their device's view of the member list to everyone else in the group, resurrecting my membership and exposing the new owner of my old phone number to group messages.  #6177 mostly describes a nuisance of continuing to receive messages from people that didn't get your "leave group" event.  My issue feels more like a security concern, since my old group membership gets re-propagated to everyone in the group even if I don't have control of the original device or number anymore.  ### Steps to reproduce - join a large group - have a member of the group change their key and don't accept the change - leave the group - observe that most members no longer see you're a member - cancel your phone service and recycle your phone - have the member that didn't get your "leave group" event make a change to the group  **Actual result:** The previously-left number is re-added to the group **Expected result:** The previously-left number should get propagated somehow to the group member that didn't get the memo and the old number should not be re-added to the group.  ### Device info **Device:** Google Pixel XL   **Android version:** 7.1.1   **Signal version:** 3.31.4

column3: Changing group avatar results in strange behavior.
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description This is a follow up to https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/7225. While https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/commit/a350106f7d73182934babf019e24f61b6e7de8e6 did fix the crash. It did not fix issue with the group avatar.   ### Steps to reproduce The avatar you see in this image below is in fact the old avatar. I already replaced it with the new one (Buddy Jesus). However it is not displayed.  ![signal-2017-11-27-220005](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18451020/33289781-8ecf54fa-d3b8-11e7-8c6d-f83c7426dbca.png)  In the group view the old avatar is still shown as well. Although a recent change is recognized.  ![signal-2017-11-27-220009](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18451020/33289865-d00ca1a2-d3b8-11e7-8c5a-13fff2583535.png)  The recent chat overview shows an even older avatar. Restart of phone doesn't help.  ![signal-2017-11-27-220012](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18451020/33289951-0f6e6a10-d3b9-11e7-80ba-79c90c86a7ad.png)  However if I go to the settings again, there is Buddy Jesus in full glory.  ![signal-2017-11-27-220710](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18451020/33290093-87cca7ce-d3b9-11e7-9dd8-e1fd61d7fca1.png)   **Actual result:** Avatar setting is mixed up. This is not limited to the phone that changes the avatar. It applies to the receiving phone(s) as well.  **Expected result:** None of the above   ### Device info  **Device:** see log **Android version:** see log **Signal version:** see log  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/9a6a03113c7322da2315803e3108abc3

column3: Improve use of space in the message view
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description These are small issues but I think they could have some impact on user experience. Here they are (in order of importance): 1. There is too much empty space between messages from the same person. The amount of space is OK for messages from two different people but that space is too much for messages from the same person. I often express my point in several consecutive messages and the spaces are breaking the flow. Right now you could fit about two extra lines between the text of two consecutive messages. 3. Similarly it's not necessary to display the profile picture for every message. In one-on-one chat you actually don't need the pictures at all. But I'm less sure if this is actually an issue.  **Actual result:** a lot of space between messages which interrupts the flow of conversation **Expected result:** good use of space

column3: Two issues with the latest translation changes
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description There are two issues with the latest change of Signal translations: - "Contact joined Signal" string in the "Events" chapter is missing from translations, - In the "Message font size" chapter the word "Normal" has an old translation string, probobly the one also used in "LED pattern". That's not the problem in English language but in Slovenian the word gets transleted to "Normalno", which is ok for "LED pattern" but it's not an ok translation for "Message font size" (it sholud be: "Normalne"). Please add "Normal" as a separate translation for "Message font size".

column3: Domain Fronting for Iran
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description There are a couple of other issues (#6468, #5992 and WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS#2903) about this problem. One of them has been closed and the other two could've been filed in a more structured way so I'm opening this one hoping we can move this conversation forward in a constructive way.  The problem is that Google App Engine blocks connection from Iran and this renders the anti censorship feature of signal useless for Iranian people. This is important now as the authorities are trying to shut down all the secure messaging platforms following the uprising and economical protests. Additionally, Telegram, -the main social media and messaging app for Iranian people-, has been blocked recently and this gives us a golden chance to help people adopt Signal. All it takes is to make sure all the Iranian numbers are being routed through a meek server that is not Google.  We at Tor, have tested both Azure and Amazon and they work perfectly fine. I assume this is gonna be the same with other major CDNs as well.  ### Steps to reproduce - Try to connect to Signal servers from an Iranian IP address  **Actual result:** Connection fails due to censorship. **Expected result:** OWS needs to either switch to, or add new meek servers on a platform that isn't Google App Engine and Signal should automatically enable censorship circumvention feature for Iranian phone numbers (+98).   ### Device info  **Device:** Any device **Android version:** Any device both Anodrid and iOS  Here are some additional info for the curious mind: https://twitter.com/CDA/status/947556800328433664 and https://twitter.com/mrphs/status/947601608061353984  Please help us to enable and empower millions of vulnerable people to communicate securely with making this change.

column3: Manual MMS Settings Missing
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The underlying problem is that my MMS messages are not being sent correctly in a group chat. My contact says that "I can see some of your message until I open it up. Then the phone converts it to a MMS & I can no longer see what you said.".  I am using Sprint, and on some other issues I saw that on Sprint it may be necessary to go into Signal's manual MMS settings and set a different MMS server from whatever it defaults to.  However, the manual MMS settings are missing on my copy of Signal. Under Settings -> SMS and MMS, I have only three options: "SMS Enabled", "SMS delivery reports", and "'WiFi Calling' comparability mode". There also does not appear to be any relevant option in the "Advanced" section if the settings.  Searching the source code for "Manual MMS Settings" reveals a bunch of hits, so I assume the settings have not been removed, and that they are just not appearing on my device.  How do I make the manual MMS settings appear so I can apply the Sprint MMS workaround?  ### Steps to reproduce - Have a Sprint LG G2 - Open Signal's SMS and MMS Settings  **Actual result:** No Manual MMS Settings option appears **Expected result:** A Manual MMS Settings option should appear  ### Screenshots  http://m.imgur.com/QmuD83z ### Device info **Device:** LG G2 **Android version:** 5.0.2 **Signal version:** 3.31.4  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/660f15e53aa9639df0d16afd6fed2465

This looks a bit dirty typographically / alignment-wise.  ### Steps to reproduce - have some conversations in the list and look at the timestamp - especially noticeable for long group names where they almost touch the timestamp text  **Actual result:** Timestamp line is a bit higher than the baseline of the contact name / group name. **Expected result:** Timestamp line is properly aligned on the same line as the contact name / group name.  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20171011-234754](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/925062/31468897-0e1a2f8a-aee0-11e7-82c3-4c906f622575.png)    ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/e7cfc91a3f551cbc94ba86c8d368d74e

column3: Keyboard Visible Behind Share Menu
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The size of the share menu is smaller than the keyboard. I know this depends upon the height chosen for the keyboard but the menu is smaller than the "normal" setting and this makes the keyboard jut out behind the menu when the menu is accessed with the keyboard already open. Is there anyway the menu could scale with the keyboard or could it just be made larger than it is now? Or maybe the keyboard could be minimised/hidden whenever the share menu is accessed?  ### Steps to reproduce - Tap on the text field to pull up the keyboard   - Tap on the share button to show the share menu    **Actual result:** The top of the keyboard is visible behind the share menu   **Expected result:** Keyboard should either be hidden or menu should be larger than keyboard so that the keyboard isn't seen  ### Screenshots Keyboard Open    ![screenshot_20170626-080837](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/27522904-0418c3fa-5a19-11e7-91b5-aa26757ae270.png)  Share menu also opened. The black bar between the text field and the menu is what I'm talking about.    ![screenshot_20170626-080828](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20235646/27522921-22be1058-5a19-11e7-8a88-de97a74c45a0.png)   ### Device info **Device:** OnePlus One  **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.7.3

column3: Registration crash after entering voice code
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The registration crashes after entering the voice verification code. No Google Play Services installed.  ### Steps to reproduce - Install Signal - Enter phone number for registration - Press Register button - Wait for 2min timeout (AVD cannot receive SMS) - Trigger voice call - Answer call, enter code - Press Verify  **Actual result:** The registration progress is shown (the window with the four steps) but then Signal closes. The registration process starts again after opening Signal. **Expected result:** The registration progress is shown and finishes successfully, showing the conversation list afterwards.  ### Device info  **Device:** AVD Galaxy Nexus **Android version:** 4.0.3 (without Google Play Services) **Signal version:** 4.5.2~x (da6a00c4dca734d4d15be13aa4225081646e39a2 + own commits far away from registration stuff)~  ### Link to debug log These are full device logs. I did not manage to capture Signal's output only. https://gist.github.com/FeuRenard/e7cc4eb065dcb96128350bcec9ef2233 https://gist.github.com/FeuRenard/106fb3507f050d6ff4ef2f76ed0bae6f Signal-only log: https://gist.github.com/FeuRenard/9cdacb7d84cd4ce60d5b47d6a3c03653

You propably pressed something on the screen **Expected result:** The screen turns off  ### Device info  **Device:** HTC 10 **Android version:** 7.0 stock **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/06e40e8deefcd098bef5263ac0e2418d

column3: Profile name not shown in call screen
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The profile name of any user that is not in ones contacts is not shown in the incoming and outgoing call screen.   ### Steps to reproduce - call a user that is not in your contacts, or - receive a call from a user that is not in your contacts  **Actual result:** Only shows phone number **Expected result:** Should show the name as available from profile data  ### Screenshots ![profilename_callscreen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3845150/31142481-b6f32e70-a87a-11e7-829b-5a9bf06c3606.png)  ### Device info **Signal version:** 4.11.0  ### Link to debug log

column3: Missing/empty thumbnail for some pictures
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The pictures sent by one of my chat partners are shown as empty thumbnails. I can however open them. Only the thumbnail is the problem. Pictures from other contacts show just fine. The pictures in question were taken by the senders phone, no modifications were made.  Before sending me the first picture, the contact sent me a video. Maybe that is related to the problem.  ### Steps to reproduce - get a picture sent by the contact in question - open conversation - thumbnail is mising/empty  **Actual result:** Thumbnail of the picture is empty **Expected result:** There should be thumbnails  ### Screenshots ![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15171154/26777797/d524a3e2-49de-11e7-8cd9-5c56078fcde3.jpg) column3: Permission request barely readable with dark theme
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The permission request for the camera is barely readable when dark theme is in use.  ### Steps to reproduce - disable camera permission - attempt to take a picture  **Actual result:** Request text barely readable **Expected result:** Request text easily readable  ### Screenshots  ![screenshot_20171206-223725](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11895833/33687136-1422a586-dacf-11e7-86da-c0b86009b2e5.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** Blackphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.2  ### Link to debug log  [log](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/db495ec2ad22aa80d409db17d0421988)

column3: Textspace for backup screen too cramped on small screens
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The new screen for the backup / restore dialog introduced in 4.5.0 has too little vertical space on small screens.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal, go to settings - import / export  **Actual result:** The descriptive text of the plaintext backup and restore is cramped against the separators without any vertical space left. **Expected result:** Some strechup in vertical direction to allow for more space.  ### Screenshots  ![screenshot_2017-04-27-16-19-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427572/25487912/de5e00c6-2b65-11e7-8f0c-324ce0adac61.jpg)   ### Device info **Device:** Acer Z205 **Android version:** 4.4.2 **Signal version:** 4.5.0 ** Screen  specs:** 480x800, 4" size  ### Link to debug log None, this is a layout issue, not a real bug.

column3: Document overview shows empty entries for voice notes
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The new document list shows empty entries for voice notes. Also note the small scroll bars appearing beside every date entry in the screenshot.  ### Steps to reproduce - select a conversation containing voice notes - open media gallery - switch to document overview  **Actual result:** I see a list of empty entries for the dates when voice notes were sent or received. **Expected result:** Only "real" document entries are shown.  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20171003-213918](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16167751/31145458-1268196a-a884-11e7-82d8-77002bd39ceb.png)   ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.0

column3: Use keyboard incognito mode API
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The new [keyboard "incognito" mode API](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v13/view/inputmethod/EditorInfoCompat.html#IME_FLAG_NO_PERSONALIZED_LEARNING) should be used so that keyboards such as Gboard do not collect input data from messages typed in Signal.  ### Steps to reproduce - Type a message using Gboard  **Actual result:** Keyboard does not use "incognito" mode **Expected result:** Keyboard should be loaded with personalization disabled.  ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.9

column3: Missing lock icon on message bubbles.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The lock icon is not appearing in message bubble when texting with other Android or iOS signal users. column3: Sporadic layout issues in recipient preferences
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The layout of the Recipient Preferences > Privacy block looks messed up some of the time (see vertical string placement & separator lines). It seems like when opening that view the first time after opeing Signal, it's displayed correctly. The issue only arises after that.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal - Go to recipient preferences of new (empty) Signal conversation (probably looks normal) - Tap the phone's "Back" button once - Go to recipient preferences again (issue most likely there)  ### Screenshots (English & German)  ![wg1cmv6s](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12624674/31311628-892b71f8-abb0-11e7-88e1-474faa40d055.gif)   ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.2  **Device:** Nexus 4 **Android version:** 7.1.2 (LineageOS) **Signal version:** 4.11.2

column3: Instruction strings for selective permissions are correct for Nougat only
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The instruction strings included in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/commit/64c8b4b2ef9eea3aa8551397793c3d39dd3b7c6d (support for selective permissions) how to change the app permissions are true for Android 7 (Nougat) only. E. g. in Android 8 (Oreo), the "path" for those settings differs. Not sure right now about other Android versions, but I guess they differ somewhat as well.  I'm not sure how to solve this nicely, though. Is it possible that Signal does the work for the user and opens the correct settings page for each Android version?  Example of a current string: *Signal requires the External Storage permission in order to attach photos, videos, or audio, but it has been permanently denied. Please continue to the app settings menu, select "Permissions", and enable "Storage".*  Android 7: Settings >> Apps >> Signal >> Permissions >> Storage  Android 8: Settings >> Apps & notifications >> App info >> Signal >> Permissions >> Storage

column3: In-conversation invitation broken if not default SMS app
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The in-conversation invite feature does not work when Signal is not the default SMS app. That feature uses the usual text input field, which is in this case fully replaced by the enable SMS button.  ### Steps to reproduce - User A and user B are talking on Signal - User A does not have Signal as default SMS app - User B unregisters - User A opens conversation with B, sees invite reminder  **Actual result:** Tapping the invite reminder or choosing invite from the menu does not do anything. In the conversation list you can see that an invitation draft has been saved for that conversation.

column3: Default group icon too small in share menu
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The default icon for groups is very small in the share menu on recent Android versions.  ### Steps to reproduce - Make sure that a group with the default icon is at the top of your last conversations in Signal. (For me four contacts/groups were shown) - Go into an app, from where you can share stuff (such as an image) in the gallery app. - Share the picture. - Let the share window pop up (see screenshot). **Actual result:** The default icon for a group is very small. **Expected result:** The icon should be normal size.  ### Further Info When clicking on the Signal Icon in the share window then the list of the contacts/groups appears and there all icons have the correct size. This issue only appears for the default group icon. Custom group icons, custom contact icons and default contact icons (the letters) all appear normal sized. Screen size: 720 x 1280 pixel. 4.6 inches.  ### Screenshots ![screenshot-blured](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3579374/28012325-b4509264-6565-11e7-8b18-74ae28516207.png)    ### Device info  **Device:** Sony Xperia Z5 Compact **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/9f6788629fe390b37913724f2feaaba1

column3: Inconsistent display of date labels (landscape - portrait switching)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The date separation labels are not centered, when switching from landscape to portrait and the other way around.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open a conversation while in landscape mode. See Picture 1. - Scroll to a date label. - Switch from landscape to portrait mode by turning your phone. See Picture 2.  **Actual result:** The date label "today" is shifted to the right. Note that the other label is centered correctly. It was not in the view while in landscape. **Expected result:** The date label is centered.  ### Screenshots Picture 1:   Picture 2:    ### Device info  **Device:** Sony Xperia Z5 compact **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.8.1  ### Link to debug log I do not think, that this is necessary. But if you think otherwise, then I can post a debug log.  Additional info: I think that this is linked to #2930, where the incorrect action bar height and font size is tracked. This might be a new symptom to the same root cause. I think, that this has to do with `configChanges="orientation"` being set in the `AndroidManifest.xml`. As a user already stated in that other issue.

column3: isLowMemory should use getLargeMemoryClass, not getMemoryClass
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The current [isLowMemory code](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/util/Util.java#L431) suboptimally uses `getMemoryClass` instead of `getLargeMemoryClass`. Since Signal already sets `android:largeHeap`, the relevant limit is returned by `getLargeMemoryClass`, [as per the Android documentation](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/ActivityManager.html#getLargeMemoryClass()). I think this is behind the effect where some devices can easily send higher resolution images over other messaging apps (e.g. Whatsapp) but get a rather low memory class rating in Signal and compress the images too much as a result.

column3: disappearing messages does not cover call logs
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The awesome "disappearing messages" feature does not cover call notifications (`MessageRecord_called_s` and `MessageRecord_s_called_you`). IMHO they should disappear the same way other messages do. For one, these kinds of metadata records can be sensitive information, too. And from a user perspective, "messages" should cover *all* message types.  ### Steps to reproduce - set "disappearing messages" to any value - make or receive call - wait until time for disappearing messages has passed  **Actual result:** call notification does not disappear **Expected result:** call notification disappears  ### Device info **Device:** any **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.8.1

column3: Groups not available in "share with" screen other than within 5 most recently contacted
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description The "share with" screen only contains the most recently contacted contacts and groups and a complete list of contacts. The groups feature of Signal is hugely useful but this design flaw means sharing to them is a real pain and without copying and pasting, impossible.   ### Steps to reproduce - choose to share a link, image, etc using signal  ...   **Actual result:** ...  - notice the group you sent a message to last before contacting 5 other contacts/groups is not anywhere to be found.  - pull hair out with irritation.  - leave the other participants of said group in ignorance of the un-shared item  **Expected result:**   ...  - group you're looking for isn't in 5 most recently contacted contacts/groups - scroll down to find group in list of contacts and groups.   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Note 3 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** Signal 4.14.10  ### Link to debug log N/A  ### Personal message Please excuse my sarcasm, I really love Signal. It has revolutionised my IM experience, in that I have had confidence in it's security and functionality sufficient to convince all my friends and family to start using it. None of us have looked back.  We all really appreciate the hard work you all have put into it!

column3: Incorrect "Tap for unsecured fallback" prompt
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Testing current master @ 59d3e666. Got a message from a contact who has new safety numbers. Replying on my phone fails and offers unsecured fallback ("This message will not be encrypted because the recipient is no longer a Signal user"). The input text field still says "Signal message" and the contact still appears in the list of Signal contacts, even after a contact list refresh.  Sending messages from Desktop to this contact works fine.  ### Steps to reproduce - receive a Signal msg from someone with new safety numbers - try to reply -> unsecured fallback  - refresh contacts, try to reply -> same - reply from desktop (works), try to reply from Signal-Android again -> still getting unsecured fallback prompt  ### Device info **Device:** FP1 **Android version:** 4.2.2 **Signal version:** master at 59d3e666 (edit: still happening at 52311eb8)  ### Link to debug log I think there's an unrelated crash in this log, I'll probably have to open another issue for that one. https://gist.github.com/anonymous/90fbff8812f10e19f659ad12cf588a3b

column3: [4.11.3] Inconsistent behaviour when tap on group avatar in conversation list.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Tapping on group avatars in the conversation list shows inconsistent behavior.  For some groups tapping on the avatar doesn't seem to have any effect, while for some other groups tapping on the group avatar shows details information for a specific contact. This contact is not part of that group.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open signal - tap on group avatar  **Actual result:** As described for some groups nothing happens, while for others detailed information from a contact, not in the group, is showed.  **Expected result:** Don't know. Perhaps the behavior that nothing happens is expected, however it should at least not show detailed contact information.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.3  ### Link to debug log  In 18:38 tapped on group avatar and info for contact ***99 was shown In 18:39 tapped on different group avatar and info for contact ***74 was shown  https://gist.github.com/6b925711aa1ede3d076b8a5ad305c0e7

column3: Downloading video keeps spinning forever on Moto G3
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Sometimes when I send a video to my mother's Moto G3, the video either 1. Just sits there spinning 2. Starts loading and then halfway through it goes back to spinning again  I have no idea why this happens, the phone has plenty of free memory and the delete timer is set to 1 day so the chat isn't bloated at all. This has been happening for several months now and it's getting really annoying.  ### Steps to reproduce 1. Receive a video (It doesn't happen every time) 2. Wait for it to finish loading... 3. Oh wait! It never does! 4. Restart the device 5. It now works just fine  **Actual result:** Videos get stuck downloading until a restart **Expected result:** Videos should never get stuck   ### Device info Device  : motorola MotoG3 (osprey_reteu) Android : 6.0.1 (2, MPIS24.107-55-2-5) Memory  : 31M (14.53% free, 256M max) Memclass: 96, low-mem device OS Host : ilclbld36 App     : Signal 3.30.4  In the most recent debug log below: App     : Signal 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/494993a950189778dc6e6d7f469d1e58 https://gist.github.com/anonymous/0c21e2e84df4dcc8a7a3ecb3af8a34b7

column3: UX: Misleading menu item text '*Leave group*'
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Sometimes people accidentally leave a group. They misinterpret the menu item '*Leave group*' as '*Leave current group chat back to chat overview pane*'. I see several possible enhancements: - Change menu text to '*[End | Cancel | Terminate] my group membership*'. This was an easy change which should clarify the purpose of this menu item. - Enhance confirmation dialogue like it is in Signal / iOS. Add a clarifying sentence, what it means to leave the group. - Add a menu item '*Back to chats overview*' for people who are looking for this functionality. - Move '*Leave group*' menu item to the '*Edit group*' submenu. Maybe you should be able to remove yourself from the group at the same place where you can add people to the group.   I'd prefer the combination of moving this item to the '*Edit group*' submenu and enhancing the confirmation dialogue like it is in Signal / iOS. But this might be (to) much work for a minor issue...  ### Steps to reproduce - Give unexperienced user a device with Signal - Ask him to open an existing group chat - Ask him to leave this chat back to chats overview  **Actual result:** People sometimes open 3dot-menu and choose '*Leave group*' and ignore or misunderstand confirmation dialogue. **Expected result:** People always understand purpose of '*Leave group*' item and never accidentally leave the group.  ### Screenshots None.  I don't think screenshots are helpful here and i'm lazy ;-)  ### Device info not reasonable, device-independent issue.  ### Link to debug log not reasonable as it works like it is designed.

column3: SMS text messages sent without reception get stuck in "pending" state and never "fail"
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description SMS Text Messages sent without cell tower connection are stuck as pending and cannot be retried as they have not "failed".  Only a full app restart while in an area of mobile reception gets them to send again.  I'm assuming this is a device specific issue in that the phone doesn't properly notify Signal that it was unable to send the message and so the app doesn't change the message state to "failed".  ### Steps to reproduce - Send a message without cell reception  **Actual result:** The message gets the little "bouncing ellipsis" that indicates it is trying to send, but it stays like that and never "fails" so that there is no retry option.  Only stopping the app and then starting it again gets it to retry sending. **Expected result:** The sending should fail immediately if there is no mobile signal with a retry option.  ### Device info  **Device:** LG G3 (LG-D855) **Android version:** 5.0 **Signal version:** 3.31.4

column3: [Feature Request] Check with the SMS Database to pull in new messages as an option
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description SMS Messages added through Cortana / Windows 10 link will not appear when sent from a Windows 10 client.  ### Steps to reproduce - Download and Setup Cortana on an Android device - Setup Cortana on a Windows 10 machine with at least the Creators Update - Link your Microsoft Account - Use a separate device to send an SMS (not Signal) to the device with Cortana - Wait for the message to be received and for Cortana to forward it to your Windows 10 machine - Reply to the message through the Windows 10 interface  **Actual result:** The message is sent back through your phone but does not appear in Signal as a sent message. It will appear in the default "Messages" app though. **Expected result:** Signal should be listening for any SMS to be added to the database that are from the current device.   ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S6 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5

column3: "Permanent Signal communication failure!" since updated to 3.29.6
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Since updating to Signal 3.29.6 I get, several times a day, a failure notification saying: "Permanent Signal communication failure! Signal was unable to register with Google Play Services. Signal messages and calls..." Also I no longer receive messages unless i open Signal. I dont have Google apps on my phone but before updating (which i was forced to do) signal was working fine with MicroG core. Since then I have updated microG core, but this has not fixed the issue. I guess I am going to be told to report this issue to microG devs rather than here, but since it's a signal update what resulted in this issue, I would like to know if we are gonna see Signal go further into the road of being incompatible with phones not monitored by google. We are forced to update Signal too often. (not too often would be once every 1 or 2 years). if every update is going to bring problems, I will move on  ### Steps to reproduce - normal Signal usage. The failure notifications usually come when network state changes and when opening Signal  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) **Expected result:** receiving notifications of messages without having to open the app. not receiving notifications of communication failure with Google.   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S4 **Android version:** 4.4.2 **Signal version:** 3.29.6  ### Link to debug log

column3: 4.10.12 Contact names don't show for contacts stored in phone without country code
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Since the profiles upgrade, names do not show up for some Signal users whose numbers are stored in my phone without a country code (as in 555-555-5555 instead of +1-555-555-5555). Instead their phone number shows up. Adding the +1 to their stored contact info and refreshing the contact list by tapping the new message button and dragging down fixes the issue on a per contact basis.  ### Steps to reproduce - Upgrade to 4.10.12 - Look in either message list or contact list for composing a message - Notice that Signal users whose numbers are saved in your phone do not show their name in your phone, instead only the phone number - Edit their contact information by adding the country code - Refresh contact list - Notice that their name now appears.  **Actual result:** Phone numbers are displayed instead of contact info **Expected result:** Contact info should be displayed instead of phone number   ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S6 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/498d14bfcd7cbe9d70bc3824ac7b8a4e

See the picture.  ### Steps to reproduce Honestly I wish I knew. I've had my phone for about 7 months now (Since last Christmas) and I've been using the same install of Signal all this time. This morning I look at Signal's storage usage and I discover it's using waaaaaaay more than it should.  I have the SD timer set to 12 hours on 2 chats and 24 hours on 1 chat. **I've tried deleting my 3 chats to see if that would help. It didn't.**  **Actual result:** It seems Signal isn't properly deleting attachments or something. **Expected result:** Signal shouldn't use half a gigabyte of my phone's memory unless I got half a gigabyte of attachments in my conversations. I don't.   ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20170628-154942](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12563436/27640592-03685ab2-5c1a-11e7-9144-39bebc034378.png)   ### Device info Device  : motorola Moto G (4) (athene) Android : 7.0 (4, NPJS25.93-14-4) Memory  : 34M (15.22% free, 384M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : ilclbld31 App     : Signal 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/e897db97fadd015e7e207306b7835b82

column3: Signal incompatibility with NetGuard
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Signal is unable to send or receive messages over an LTE / 3G connection if NetGuard is active simultaneously on the device. This behaviour persists even if Signal is given full access to both WiFi and cellular connections in NetGuard. This behaviour is unique to cellular data connections. Signal works properly on WiFi while NetGuard is active.  It is not yet clear whether the problem is in Signal or in NetGuard. If it turns out to be the latter, then a help / faq page saying "NetGuard breaks Signal, there's just no way to make it work, here are alternatives / workarounds" would be a good idea.  Running without NetGuard or a similarly capable alternative is not a workaround, as that would permit other apps to quickly gobble up mobile data (which, in this case, is expensive and in extremely limited supply).  ### Steps to reproduce Debug log attached, generated as follows: - While an active WiFi connection is present, close and then start Signal. - Verify that NetGuard is set normally (firewall is on, Signal has full access for both WiFi and cellular modes). - Move outside the range of the WiFi connection. Device automatically switches to LTE connection. - Attempt to send a plain text message in Signal.       **Actual result:** Get a "failed to send message" error.       **Expected result:** Message is sent, shows 1 checkbox (sent), shortly thereafter shows 2 checkboxes (received). - Turn off NetGuard entirely. - Try sending the message again in signal.       **Actual result:** Message is sent correctly.       **Expected result:** No change. - Re-enable NetGuard and move back into WiFi range.      **Actual result:** Signal works normally.  ### Device info **Device:** LGE Nexus 5 (hammerhead) **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d9a7d59b0737474aec9191101ee182a5

column3: Signal crashes on incoming and outgoing calls
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Signal crashes, when I when there is an incoming SIgnal voice call from an Android device or an outgoing Signal call to an Android device (I didn't test with the iOS version). For incoming calls, the crash happens immediately when the ringing would normally start. When I restart Signal afterwards, I see that there is a missed call. For outgoing calls, the crash happens immediately, after the call screen is shown, before the ringing starts.  ### Steps to reproduce - Be called on Signal Android by a Signal Android device (no need to pick up or even have the screen active) - Alternatively, call a Signal Android device.  **Actual result:** Signal crashes immediately. **Expected result:** Signal should not crash and establish a call.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S2 (I9100) **Android version:** 7.1.1. (lineage-os) **Signal version:** 4.2.5 (self-updating version from the Signal website)  ### Link to debug log   https://gist.github.com/anonymous/01b16245e6af6d65659b03bce5975282

column3: Signal 4.10.11 crashes when opening group on Alien Dalvik
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Signal crashes with the _"Signal" has stopped unexpectedly_ when opening a group on Jolla/Alien Dalvik.  It looks to me that this happend due to a method missing in that implemementation. `Configuration.getLayoutDirection()` is API level 17 while the actual Aliend Dalvik provides Android 4.1.2 with API level 16. So this is is no bug in Signal but having a workaround would help Jolla users to use vanilla Signal on their device.  ### Steps to reproduce - Start signal - Open a group  **Actual result:** Signal crashes with the message _"Signal" has stopped unexpectedly_ **Expected result:** Group should open as they did with Signal 4.9.5  ### Device info **Device:** Jolla (alien_jolla_bionic) **Android column3: crash when showing/opening SMS

column3: Weak APK signing key (RSA1024 / SHA1 Digest)
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Signal APK on website (and likely via Google Play store) is signed with cert that uses a RSA1024 key with SHA1 digest. Unsure if this is actually an issue as it seems likely that you would be aware already but since I couldn't find a prior issue I thought I should raise it.  My instinct tells me that changing to a >=2048bit key would break update functionality as the signing certificate digest is pinned in the app.  Better safe than sorry to raise this anyway, Livvy  ### Steps to reproduce `jarsigner -verify -certs -verbose Signal-website-release-4.8.1.apk`  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) ``` - Signed by "CN=Whisper Systems, OU=Research and Development, O=Whisper Systems, L=Pittsburgh, ST=PA, C=US"     Digest algorithm: SHA1     Signature algorithm: SHA1withRSA, 1024-bit key  jar verified. ```  **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) Not necessarily a bug report so not necessarily an "expected" result but in an ideal world: ``` - Signed by "CN=Whisper Systems, OU=Research and Development, O=Whisper Systems, L=Pittsburgh, ST=PA, C=US"     Digest algorithm: SHA1     Signature algorithm: SHA256withRSA, 4096-bit key  jar verified. ```  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** N/A **Android version:** N/A **Signal version:** 4.8.1  ### Link to debug log

column3: Importing issue to Signal Desktop
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Signal Android does not properly sync up with Signal Desktop. This [issue was notified in the Desktop repo](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1727#issuecomment-343634749) but after submitting error logs, it was determined the issue was on Android side.  ### Steps to reproduce - Set up Signal desktop, latest version on mobile and desktop - Try to import contacts, chats & groups  **Actual result:** Signal Desktop is empty, no data is synced. New outgoing/incoming messages do come in/out, but the contact has no name.  **Expected result:** Contacts, chats and groups will be imported to Signal Desktop.   ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.12.3 **Desktop OS:** Ubuntu 17.10 GNOME **Desktop Version:** 1.0.37  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/Julian2000nl/4cc0c7ccdc6ce436deae4059c584aea6 Link to issue on Desktop repo: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1727#issuecomment-343634749

column3: Replying from the heads up notification in a phone with two active SIMs labels the encrypted message with the SIM card's name
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Replying from the heads up notification when two SIMs are active in a dual-sim phone, the message is labelled as sent like an SMS, with the name of the SIM card on the message bubble. The message is however properly sent via the encrypted channel.  ### Steps to reproduce - open a heads up notification from Signal - reply in the provided text box and send the message - open conversation in the Signal app and check the message you've just sent,   **Actual result:** Although it is an encrypted message, it is labelled as sent via a SIM card, but not with an unlocked padlock. **Expected result:** Not having the SIM card name as a label  ### Screenshots  [screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12595662/31552676-d7bca29e-b040-11e7-8c3d-fa402b4d0469.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** Honor 8 **Android version:** 7.0 (C432B394) **Signal version:** 4.11.3  ### Link to debug log  Can be provided upon request.

column3: Notify sender if Signal message has been sent but not delivered to recipient after some time
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Recipients who are registered for Signal may not be able to receive secure signal messages due to reasons such as: - temporary unavailability of internet access (e.g. prepay plans with hard data caps; otherwise intermittent data connectivity) - permanent unavailability having uninstalled Signal without first unregistering  Neither of these are apparent to the sender, and sending a Signal message results in the message sitting on the server for some undefined length of time. The sender does not get notified that while their message has been sent to the server, it has not been delivered to the recipient, leading to frustration once the fact is discovered ( #6377, https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/2285#issuecomment-218601632 etc). The status is available in conversation UI in the form of one tick vs two ticks, but this requires the sender to explicitly check back in the conversation UI.  It would improve the user experience if a signal message that was sent but not delivered after some timeout (minutes?) triggered a "lack of delivery" notification on the senders phone along the lines of "Your secure message to YYY could not be delivered after N minutes. Would you like to resend via insecure SMS?" This way it is up to the user to explicitly fall back to the less secure protocol.  (This notification proposal is orthogonal to but complementary to the ability of Signal to better remember the per-contact preference of transport channel suggested in #2285, https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/845#issuecomment-134381412 etc. It would also serve as an easier to implement and more secure alternative to automatically falling back to SMS as suggested in #678, #2847, #3074, #4009, #5001)

column3: Strange short vibration and no notification sound when recieving messages
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Quite often when I receive messages, I get only one short vibration and no vibration pattern. When this happens, I don't get a notification sound either. The fact that I get only one short vibration and no sound leads to me missing the fact that I have received a message. This happens even though all sounds in the system, as well as the vibration, are turned on.  If I get another message a few seconds later, the behaviour is often the way it should be with the usual pattern and a notification sound.  The bug appears as follow: - A message is received. - If the normal vibration pattern of Signal is assumed to be approximately (250 ms vibration, 250 ms without vibration, 250 ms vibration), the vibration I get is more like 50 ms vibration and then nothing more. Thus, I get ONE very short vibration and not a pattern like I usually do, and there is no notification sound.  ### Steps to reproduce - Unknown, although I have tried to find out how to reproduce this during the past few months. - I most often experience the problem when the phone is lying on a table. It is possible it happens with the phone in a pocket as well. The vibration is so short I'm not sure I would feel it if the phone is in a pocket. - The screen appears to have to be turned off, usually for a while.  **Actual result:** A message is received and I only get ONE short vibration instead of a vibration pattern. I get no notification sound. **Expected result:** A message is received and I get the usual vibration pattern (250 ms vibration, 250 ms without vibration, 250 ms vibration) and a notification sound.  ### Device info **Device:** Google Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.2 (stock, unrooted) but had the problems on 7.1.1 as well **Signal version:** 4.3.2  ### Link to debug log Update: https://gist.github.com/ecd9eceea928b11d171beb4beba05dac Happend with the screen on while holding the phone in my hand

column3: Intrusive & confusing notifications on Android 8.1 without Google Play Services
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description On devices without Google Play Services, Signal creates a notification to inform the user that a background connection has been established to the Signal servers. On earlier versions of Android (pre 8.1), this notification was present but low priority, and therefore did not have an icon in the status bar and did not show up on the lock screen. It only was visible in the expanded notification drawer.  On Android 8.1, however, the background connection notification is visible in both the status bar and the lock screen notification view. Furthermore, it uses the same icon as incoming Signal messages, creating the effect that a message notification is always present and causing user confusion. (See annotated screenshots.)  ### Steps to reproduce - run Signal on a device running Android 8.1 without Google Play Services - look at the lock screen or status bar  **Actual result:** background connection notification is shown in the status bar and lock screen. **Expected result:** background connection notification should only be shown in the notification drawer, and the Signal icon should not be present, per previous versions.  ### Screenshots Standard usage of the device, without any dismissable message notifications. (The icon in the status bar is from the background connection notification.) ![screenshot_20171207-232132](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3037552/33751266-be67a59a-dba7-11e7-9d08-d03c1f44aad3.png)  Standard usage of the device, with an undismissed notification. Note how two Signal icons are present in the status bar, one from the message and the other from the background connection notification. ![screenshot_20171207-232226](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3037552/33751284-dc1cc318-dba7-11e7-9193-91216ddc5194.png)  The expanded notification drawer. ![screenshot_20171207-232236](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3037552/33751300-045ed41a-dba8-11e7-8eb1-4998c09aee97.png)  _(Irrelevant sections of screenshots removed for privacy.)_  ### Device info **Device:** Google Pixel **Android version:** 8.1.0 (without Google Play Services; running CopperheadOS, like raw AOSP) **Signal version:** 4.13.6

column3: Feature request: Settings for media quality
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Need an option for media qualities  ### Steps to reproduce - send image taken form within the signal app  - add image from your album  **Actual result:** Different image qualities are sent to the recipient. **Expected result:** The app should send images of the same quality or at least ask the user should be able to specify the qualities somewhere in the options  ### Screenshots  ![picture added from my album app](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25491255/28490397-7339fb08-6ed9-11e7-9358-f65b352d8882.jpeg) ![picture taken from within the signal app](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25491255/28490396-7338933a-6ed9-11e7-8ac7-f5356aff89b5.jpeg)  ### Device info  **Device:** Sony E2303 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.8.1  ### Further explanations The quality of media sent varies with the chosen method (e.g. attach an image file from your album app, take picture within the app). There should be options in the settings menu that specify the default media quailty and maybe one can even specify qualities on the fly like so: this specific image should be in a lower quality (saving data volume) or this one should be 100%. Same goes for video and audio..

It's since re-appeared with this other non-signal (iOS) user, who sent 2-3 messages that appeared this way over two days.  She's never tried replying before.  ### Steps to reproduce  Have not tried to reproduce.  **Actual result:** Message went to the wrong user. **Expected result:** Messages should go to the other contacts in the thread, not to an unrelated contact.  ### Device info  **Device:** Moto G4 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.8.1  ### Link to debug log  [device_log_issue6885.txt](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/files/1272938/device_log_issue6885.txt)

column3: Signal keeps a lock on the earpiece speaker after ending call
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description My phone (HTC 10) uses the earpiece (calling) speaker along with the bottom-firing speaker for media playback, HTC calls this "BoomSound Hi-Fi" and it noticably enchances audio quality. Unfortunaly, after performing a voice call using Signal, this speaker seems to be locked, and is not used for media playback system-wide, untill Signal is killed from Android settings (just swiping it away in multitasking view does not help)  ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal and select a contact also using signal - Perform a voice call (any length) - Exit Signal to home screen - Open any app with media playback (youtube).  **Actual result:** No sound comes from the earpiece speaker untill Signal is killed **Expected result:** Signal has no effect on audio setup system-wide after ending the call  ### Device info **Device:** HTC 10 **Android version:** 7.0 NRD90M stock **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/014984344c90627acfad261269f7c695

column3: "In-conversation notifications" setting doesn't really work as intended
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description My mom has a Moto G3 and she often leaves the screen on when she's in a conversation with me while she's watching TV or whatever. The problem is that while the phone always beeps when she gets a new message, the beep is often really quiet/short when the screen is on and she's already in a conversation with me. "In-conversation notifications" is enabled, which is why it beeps at all. However, it seems the message is marked as "read" too quickly, so the beep is interrupted. My mom is old and she just can't hear the beep which means she can't respond right away when I'm texting her at the supermarket or whatever.  ### Steps to reproduce 1. Receive a message when your screen is on with the chat open, make sure "In-conversation notifications" is enabled in the settings 2. Most of the time the notification beep is really short, which makes it easy to miss  **Actual result:** The beep is seemingly interrupted **Expected result:** The beep is fully played, just like you'd expect it to  ### Device info Moto G3 Latest non-beta Signal Android 6.0.1  ### Link to debug log Don't think this is necessary, but if it is just tell me and I'll post one

column3: MMS doesn't fully notify until app opened
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description MMS messaging does not download or fully notify until after app opened. Upon receiving a MMS message, LED and notification icon both appear but notification sound/vibration does not occur and message does not download. Messages can then go unnoticed until phone checked for other reasons. After opening signal or opening and unlocking signal, MMS messages promptly download as expected and only then does sound/vibrate occur. In the case of group messages they show as numerous new texts from individual users but then download sequentially and are placed in a single group automatically (time stamps indicate actual download time regardless of send time or how long they have been in limbo). Wi-fi connection does not seem to make a difference. After opening, MMS response time seems improved for short period and messages will download as expected. SMS and signal messages consistently alert with the notification as expect as soon as message arrives in all cases.   MMS set to auto fetch all types in all situations in Signal settings Signal "doze" turned off, background data unrestricted pnf - no root app doesn't seem to help either Issue is not new and has been occurring for some time which and has led to use of alternative messaging apps from time to time however built in and all other 3rd party apps work as expected  ### Steps to reproduce - allow signal to be idle for period - receive MMS message - failure of notification - open signal to receive message and notification  **Actual result:** SMS and signal messages notify with sound/vibrate/LED and icon as soon as they arrive. MMS messages arrive but only result in icon and LED flash. Once signal opened, MMS downloads and sound/vibrate occur **Expected result:** MMS message arrives and notification alerts per phone settings just as with a SMS or signal message regardless if recently opened  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Note 5 - Verizon (SM-N920V) **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/7a8fc709485afbc2c9ae96ed530c716d
