column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description MMS drafts under a new group are not displayed in the messages list even though the draft is saved.  ### Steps to reproduce - Start new MMS group - Compose message - Go back to message list  **Actual result:** The draft is not displayed in the message list, but if you re-enter the group you can access the draft. **Expected result:** The draft message should be shown in the messages list.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.12.3

column3: 4.11.3: MMS conversation splits out one user if phone is off while messages come in
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description MMS conversation has some jank if phone is off and then messages are sent by other parties, and then I turn my phone back on  ### Steps to reproduce - Have MMS-only conversation with a few other users - Reboot phone, and while phone is rebooting, have 2 messages come in - Enter password into Signal to start it up - Had two messages come in Msg A, Msg B.  **Actual result:** Msg B came into the conversation correctly. Msg A started a new thread with that user and only and said MMS could not be downloaded.  Tapped download and message went to correct conversation and that new thread disappeared correctly. **Expected result:** Both messages come into the thread initially.  This doesn't really matter much to me, not sure about others...might be somewhat jarring.  If you mark this "duly noted" and close it, it won't bother me.   ### Device info **Device:** Galaxy S8 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.3  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/6dfa1da3490cd3d9ab5cbcf75941a04a

column3: Crash after accepting permissions for the first time during an incoming call
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Microphone and video permissions are disabled. Signal crashes after going through the permissions prompts that appear on an incoming call.   ### Steps to reproduce - Alice disables permissions on Android - Bob calls Alice (12:41 PT) - Bob sees dialing, then ringing.  - Alice sees the call on her lock screen and swipes up to answer.  - Alice sees a Microphone prompt (image 1).  - Alice taps continue and the prompt is backgrounded and not dismissed.  - Alice sees the record audio permission prompt (image 2) - Alice taps Allow - Alice sees the record video permission prompt (image 3) - Alice taps Allow - Bob sees the call as connected. - Bob can not hear Alice. **Alice can hear Bob.**  - Alice sees the microphone prompt on the screen as it was originally backgrounded (image 1) - Alice taps Continue on the microphone prompt (image 1).    **Actual result:**  - Signal crashes (image 4)  - Although crashed, live call icon is still displayed. - Audio still transmits from CALLER (BOB). Bob still can not hear Alice.  - Alice taps the call icon and sees the same crash screen (image 4) - Alice hits back and sees the call is fully disconnected.  - Bob sees call ended after about 5 seconds after the previous step. **Expected result:** Alice can not hear Bob until all prompts are done. Bob's microphone works after all the prompts are done. And no crash.    ### Screenshots  Don‚Äôt rely on timestamps from the screenshots.  image 1: ![1microphone](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4898366/33959966-05117b10-dffe-11e7-82d0-9ecd183dd7de.png) image 2: ![2recordaudio](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4898366/33959972-08ec37ca-dffe-11e7-89f0-726ac1740176.png) image 3: ![3recordvideo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4898366/33959975-0afa218a-dffe-11e7-85ef-831f1efc62c4.png) image 4: ![4crash](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4898366/33959978-0ce2f5b2-dffe-11e7-8c50-b12d2807c9d0.png)   ### Device info  **Device:** Google Pixel 2 **Android version:** 8.1.0 **Signal version:** 4.14.6  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/e54125a959a46f833130aba70292e447

column3: Incorrect person's messages showing up in threads
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Messages intended for a different recipient are showing up in the wrong thread. This is a really nasty bug because it's led to messages being sent to an unintended recipient, which is not good at all... why should I continue to use an application where I have to risk sending sensitive information to an unintended recipient?  **ADDITIONALLY** ALL OF THESE MESSAGES WERE already **DELETED**. They shouldn't even exist anymore, yet old **deleted** messages are showing up not only in the signal client, but in the wrong threads.  ### Steps to reproduce (As far as I'm aware... I'm not sure what triggered this to happen) - Receive message - Open thread  **Actual result:** Messages from someone completely different show up **Expected result:** Messages from the correct recipient should show up, there should be no messages from person A when I'm in the thread for person B.  ### Screenshots  Messages have been censored but portions of names left for clarity.  **PLEASE NOTE! THIS IS NOT A GROUP MESSAGE!!!** ![screen shot 2017-07-14 at 1 51 51 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8071536/28230744-21587b4e-689d-11e7-8a97-a3190675ec94.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log Sorry, I don't have a debug log. An acquaintance showed me this bug, and it's been too long to grab that debug log. However, this is not the first time that it's happened to them, AND it's even affected the desktop client.

column3: Messages not delivered over wifi
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Messages fail to send over wifi.  ### Steps to reproduce - Connect to wifi at home - Send a message to another Signal user - Get "Not delivered - Tap for details" error. When tapping for details the error message is: "Some issues need your attention."  **Actual result:** Message not sent. **Expected result:** Message sent.  ### Screenshots n/a   ### Device info **Device:** OnePlus 3 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/891bac2b8b2c2f42197b22cbbd9e4082

column3: Message Notifications disappear when also using Signal Desktop App
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Message notifications get marked as read immediately, and sometimes don't cause the phone to vibrate. The result is that all incoming messages are marked as read, and I have to manually go into signal to see if I've received any messages.  ### Steps to reproduce - Have Signal open on a phone and on the desktop client - get a message (while the computer is asleep) - watch as the notification appears on the lock screen and then immediately disappears.  **Actual result:** messages get marked as read immediately removing the notification **Expected result:** The message notification should stay on my lock screen and the message should be marked as unread.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4  ### Link to debug log

column3: Message "failed to send" to previously added contact after phone OS re-installed
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Message "failed to send" to previously added contact after phone OS re-installed  ### Steps to reproduce - Add contact and successfully send messages - Re-install phone OS - Install Signal - Re-add user  **Actual result:** Can receive messages from contact, get "Failed to send" when attempting to re-send messages. Attempted "Reset secure session" and  "View safety number" for contact, all fail **Expected result:** Should be able to send message to previous contact after the above steps.  ### Device info **Device:** Oneplus One **Android version:** Android 7.1.2 (Lineage OS 14.1-20171016-NIGHTLY-bacon) **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/b011de4bdf730cc2db5e8910e3c5df41

column3: Marked verified status still updates groups sometimes
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Marking a contact as verified/unverified still sometimes automatically updates all groups the contact is in. The groups jump to the top of the conversation list without any group interaction. The problem was already discussed in #6744.  ### Steps to reproduce I managed to reproduce the problem using two Android virtual devices running a fresh Android 7.1.1.  * install Signal 4.7.4 on both devices * add phone numbers to each others contact books, as well as another contact * A sends message to B * A creates two groups with B * A sends message to another contact (for reference)   * see screenshot 1 * try to reproduce the issue by verifying B: no problems   * see screenshot 2 * A links a desktop device   * then power off desktop device * try to reproduce the issue by verifying B: problem shows up (sometimes)   * see screenshot 3 * put device B into airplane mode * try to reproduce the issue by verifying B: no problems * switch off airplane mode on device B: problem shows up without interaction on device A   * sometimes there are two check marks next to the status message * unlink desktop device: issue not reproducible anymore  ### Screenshots ![pic1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3845150/27649445-16d65082-5c32-11e7-9196-df949563004f.png) **Screenshot 1: before contact verification**  ![pic2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3845150/27649463-24836238-5c32-11e7-8e20-67f2178952e8.png) **Screenshot 2: contact verification works as expected**  ![pic3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3845150/27649526-58d0fe2e-5c32-11e7-9d29-29846173e653.png) **Screenshot 3: contact verification updates all groups**  ### Device info **Device:** Android virtual device **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.7.4

column3: Marked as verified status messages should not be shown in groups
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Marking a contact as verified or unverified generates a status message in each conversation the contact is in. But both actions are manually and deliberately carried out by the user, so I think that one status message in the one-to-one conversation is enough.  ### Steps to reproduce - choose a contact that is member of several groups - mark that contact as verified - check the conversation list  **Actual result:** All conversations that the contact is in have a new status message and thus jump to the top of the conversation list, however old the group conversation may have been **Expected result:** Only show a status message in the one-to-one conversation  Maybe it would still be somewhat helpful to generate a status message in a group once all group members have been verified.  ### Device info  **Signal version:** 4.7.0

column3: Outbound (and maybe inbound?) calls are marked as unread
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Made an outbound call, once the call ended, the conversations screen showed the unread message divider with the call record beneath.  ### Steps to reproduce - make call  **Actual result:** outbound calls are marked as unread by divider. **Expected result:** successful calls should not be marked as unread. Missed calls, on the other hand, should.  ### Device info  **Device:** Moto G4 Plus **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4 beta

column3: Messages sent from my Android device aren't showing on Signal-Desktop with latest Android beta 4.7.3
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Like recently posted by Dyras in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1275: Messages sent from my Android device aren't showing on Signal-Desktop with latest Android beta 4.7.3. Messages sent from the Desktop are displayed correctly on my Android device.  ### Steps to reproduce I sent 2 messages to a group conversation:             - one message from android to group            - one message from desktop to group    ### Screenshots Here how it looks: on Android: ![screenshot_20170625-001202](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12666598/27512291-1c9bf308-593c-11e7-9174-c2d086155d39.png)  on Desktop: ![signal desktop](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12666598/27512294-2bedd768-593c-11e7-86e5-d8cfc03bd7f6.PNG)  **Note:**  the missing second checkmark on the Android screenshot is a known bug, where delivery receipts are not cached for group conversations when they arrive before sync message, tracked here: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/4924 and here: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/5573. I confirmed the successuful delivery with all group members.   ### Device info Desktop: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/59.0.3071.109 Safari/537.36 Signal-Desktop/0.41.3 Android: Device: Fairphone FP2 Android: 6.0.1 Signal 4.7.3 beta  ### Link to debug log Desktop: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d11acb1f94c6158c415ce4e0ae1a972b Android: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/43685b4bf3e4aa24e4c1ea6a6962614e

column3: No file size limit for arbitrary file types
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Just startet sending a 300 MB zip file o_O This is great, but surely not inteded   **Actual result:** file can be sent (tough it takes long) **Expected result:** File size limit at around 100 MB, like for a/v - maybe 50 MB is a good value to start with...  ### Screenshots ![grafik](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/25354712/599d6f26-2934-11e7-97a4-d4e503995825.png)

column3: New group is empty after I joined, no interaction possible
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description It seems like someone added me to a push group. I just got two messages. That's the only interaction I had with this group. I cannot send texts because the input panel is not responsive. I can't even type anything.  ### Steps that happened - I am not part of this group. - I get two group messages in this group from the same person, presumably the creator  **Actual result:** Member list is empty, name is "Unbenannte Gruppe" (german for unnamed group), nothing happens when tapping on the input panel. **Expected result:** Member list has entries, I can send texts to the group.  ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log I received the two mentioned group messages some minutes before taking this log https://gist.github.com/4f7a2b47c2a40e771e5cbd4a06f78c58

column3: Other party suddenly becomes silent during a call
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description It has happened a few times now that while I'm having a call I suddenly stop hearing the other party's voice after a while (~several minutes) but they can still hear my voice. So far this has happened only when I'm having a call with Signal iOS. But I haven't had long calls with another Signal Android so nothing to say about that.  ### Steps to reproduce - Call Signal iOS device - Talk for some time  **Actual result:** Suddenly I stop hearing the other party's voice but they can still hear my voice. **Expected result:** Both parties can hear each other for the duration of the whole call  ### Device info #### Android **Device:** Moto G4 Play **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4 #### iOS **Device:** iPhone 4S **iOS version:**  9.3.5 **Signal version:** 2.7.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/3d87be38fce2a11107b10164322a96bc https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c0102e788ffd853143dbd1ec78a213f1 I guess the relevant parts are before I disconnect the call after I notice that I can't hear the other party anymore Unfortunately, I don't have logs from iOS  ### Related issues In #4532, #6140, #6271 the other party can't hear anything but it seems that the silence is there from the beginning of the call, not after talking successfully for several minutes.

column3: Description of keyboard incognito mode incorrect
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Incognito mode's description string currently says *"Use keyboard without suggestions or auto-correct"*  When using Gboard in incognito mode, my keyboard *does* use a) suggestions and b) auto-correction.  A better description would be something like *"If set to incognito mode, the keyboard won't remember, learn, or store any words you type"*  On a related note: It seems like incognito mode is currently only used in conversation threads. What about Signal's other input fields like password, search, etc?

column3: Profile create activity: "Who can see this information?" not in line with info symbol
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In the profile create actitivy, the text "Who can see this information?" is not in line with the info symbol in front of it (info symbol too high/text too low).  ### Steps to reproduce None  ### Screenshots  ![profile information](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12624674/30249809-08902164-9644-11e7-9780-c09d5a0a80aa.PNG)   ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.6  ### Link to debug log  None

column3: In new share, recent chats groups have their string identifier instead of number
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In the new share from another app, single contacts look fine but for a group it shows the string identifier for the group where the number for an individual contact would go if it was a 1x1 chat.   ### Steps to reproduce - have a signal group you've chatted with recently - go to another app to share back to Signal - signal pops up recent chats  **Actual result:** 1x1 chats show contact number but groups show string identifier **Expected result:** group chats would show nothing or maybe "3 members"

column3: Register & Cancel button not readable
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In the first activity of registration the register button (and optionally the cancel button) are completely white. As a consequence they are hard to find and their text ("Register" or "Cancel") is not readable.  I suppose the use of `android:backgroundTint` causes this, as it is only available with API>=21. Maybe the buttons could be tinted in Java code. EDIT: This is already done in [code](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/RegistrationActivity.java#L98).  ### Steps to reproduce - Install Signal - start Signal - look at registration activity  **Actual result:** It's hard to find the buttons to go on. **Expected result:** Buttons and their labels should be clearly readable.  ### Screenshots Device 1 ![device-2017-04-30-184308](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16167751/25566344/179fe6a6-2dd7-11e7-89c8-abf4866b5c2b.png) Device 2 ![device-2017-04-30-184413](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16167751/25566342/15f200e6-2dd7-11e7-8719-546682865ecd.png)  ### Device info 1 **Device:** AVD Galaxy Nexus **Android version:** 4.0.3 **Signal version:** 4.5.2  ### Device info 2 **Device:** Sony Xperia U **Android version:** 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod) **Signal version:** 4.5.2

column3: Use single button to open attachment window.
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In the conversation window, there are 3 ways to open/close the attachment window.  ### Steps to reproduce The paperclip will open and close the attachment window. The green down arrow (that is visible in the attachment window) will close the attachment window. The ellipses in the upper right of the conversation window have an option to open the attachment window.  **Actual result:** As described above. **Expected result:** From a usability and attractiveness perspective, there should be only a single way to open and close the attachment window.  ### Screenshots See the [thread on Discourse Hosting](https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/conversation-window-ui-tweak/895) for screenshots and discussion of alternatives.  ### Device info **Device:** Moto X Pure Edition **Android version:** 6.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.1.0

column3: 4.10 regression: still offers to send Signal message after unregistering
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In the conversation view, Signal offers to send a Signal message by default even if the user unregistered from within the app. It should only allow to send SMS.  ### Steps to reproduce - clean install of Signal 4.10.9 - register using phone number - send a message to a contact - unregister in advanced settings - check previous conversation  **Actual result:** Offers to send a Signal message **Expected result:** Should ask to enable SMS / send SMS  Bug does not occur in Signal 4.9.9.  ### Device info **Signal version:** 4.10.9

column3: Notification default sound is call default sound of android
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In settings or contact settings, notification sound set to default will play call sound of android, neither notification sound of android nor notification sound of signal. I think that someone call me every time I receive a sms/mms.  ### Steps to reproduce 1. Open settings 2. Set notification sound to default OR 1. Open contact settings 2. Set notification sound to default  **Actual result:** When default is selected for notification, play call sound of android for sms/mms. **Expected result:** When default is selected for notification, play notification sound of android or signal for sms/mms.  ### Screenshots  **Contact settings** ![screenshot_20171212-130324](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20989929/33884012-56516e74-df3e-11e7-8eb2-33942b9cf35a.png) **Signal settings** ![screenshot_20171212-130343](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20989929/33884013-581eae06-df3e-11e7-94ef-350528e8ffae.png) **Android sound settings** ![screenshot_20171212-130354](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20989929/33884017-59c6a498-df3e-11e7-8d94-d0d7f49bede1.png) **Android notification sound settings** ![screenshot_20171212-130359](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20989929/33884019-5cfebdd0-df3e-11e7-8d00-bdb920b09ee8.png)   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung A5 2017 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.14.4

column3: Media preview no longer displays "You" for sent media
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In prior versions media preview showed "You" in the action bar when I looked at media I sent. Now there is always the recipient's name. See also https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/commit/cd82ca6938bed94106487c335aea9b0eea0c675d#commitcomment-24455471  ### Steps to reproduce - choose single conversation - send picture or video - tap on the sent media  **Actual result:** Recipient's name is in action bar. **Expected result:** "You" is displayed in action bar.  ### Device info **Signal version:** 4.11.1

column3: Should not ask to make profile visible to group as long as all members are in contacts
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In most of the groups all members are in my contacts already (e.g. close friends). I am never asked to make my profile visible to any of those users individually, because they are in my contacts. But now in those groups I am asked to do this explicitly. It would be nice if I would not see this banner as long as there are only contacts in this group.  ### Steps to reproduce - someone else creates a group where all members are already in your contacts  **Actual result:** Banner requests to make profile visible. **Expected result:** I already made my profile visible to all group members individually (e.g. automatically), so the banner should not be there.  P.S.: The "contact verified" flag could also be used to decide that a profile should be made visible automatically.  ### Device info **Signal version:** 4.11.0

column3: Movable thumbnail preview (video call)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In a video call, I should be able to move around the thumbnail showing my camera's video. Sometimes this covers up what I want to see from the other person's camera.    ### Device info  **Device:** Moto G4 **Android version:** 7.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.3.5

column3: Profiles: cannot share profile without adding to contacts after having replied
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In a new conversation with an unknown contact, users can't go back to choose "Don't add, but make my profile visible" after replying once.  #### Note It's also not obvious that "add to contacts" will make one's profile visible, unless you know the details of the implementation. One extra line of text at the top could fix that.  ### Steps to reproduce - receive a message from someone not in your contacts - reply to conversation  **Actual result:** `UnknownSenderView` will disappear. Now the only option left to share one's profile is to save that contact to phone contacts, which is not obvious. **Expected result:** There should be an option in conversation settings to make one's user profile visible.  ### Device info **Signal version:** 4.10.9

column3: Signal crash after leaving Giphy browser
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In a conversation I've opened the Giphy browser and typed a search term. Switched to the stickers and selected the tile view. I decided not to use the sticker so I left the Giphy browser with the back button. Shortly after the conversation view returns the message shows up: Signal is gestopt ( Dutch for Signal stopped)  ### Steps to reproduce Note that I cannot reproduce this every time and if the steps below are really needed, however at least  with this steps it happened multiple times. - open Giphy browser - enter search term - switch to stickers - select tile view - exit Giphy browser without selecting a gif  **Actual result:** Signal stops **Expected result:** Signal does not stop.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.12.0  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/23277e594e920d32dac978a67a3a9e2f

column3: Images from disappearing messages can be saved to phone
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Images from disappearing messages can be saved to phone before they disappear. They are permanently available afterwards. This is problematic because many people that use the disappearing messages function trust that pictures that are sent remain confidential and cannot be shared.

column3: Cant register
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Im trying to register to Signal. I open signal and i cant press the register button. I press it but nothing happens  ### Steps to reproduce  - Follow the instractions to build and sign signal ( https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/How-to-build-Signal-from-the-sources ) - Install signal - Open Signal (it automatically detects my country and phone number) - Press Register button  **Actual result:** Nothing happens **Expected result:** Receive registration sms  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung J1 mini prime **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.31.2  ### Link to debug log Dont have any debug log.

column3: Not able to select group when forwarding picture
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Im trying to forward a picture fom a signal chat to a specific signal group. In the list where i choose the recipient there're no groups in the contacts. If I'm lucky and the group is in the recent list, i can forward it but otherwise i can only go into that group and insert a saved picture.  ### Steps to reproduce - long press picture in chat - tap 3 dots in top right corner and tap forward - take a look at the list shown and search for groups  **Actual result:** No groups are shown in the list of Persons (what makes sense, cause groups aren't persons) but the ones in the recent list at the top. **Expected result:** Have a part of the list contain all signal groups or insert them into the persons list.  ### Device info  **Device:** Oneplus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.14.10

column3: Images shot while a communication is still ongoing are not shown in quick image pane
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If you take pictures or the picture is still processed in the background (think HDR+) the newer images are not shown when sending images using the image pane above the keyboard. I remember this was reported when this feature was introduced but I didn't find an open bug on that.  ### Steps to reproduce - chat with someone - take images or take images which are processed in the background an open chat dialog  **Actual result:**  those newer images are not shown in the quick image pane  **Expected result:**  those newer images should be shown in the quick image pane without having to leave the chat and enter it again  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 6p **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.7.4

column3: Sharing safety numbers before animation finishes shares incorrect numbers
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If you share your safety number using the share button before the numbers finish animating, the numbers shared are different from their actual value.  ### Steps to reproduce - open a conversation - tap "view safety number" - observe the set of numbers animating - tap the share button before the numbers finish animating - share to an app - freak out because your safety number is different from your contact's  **Actual result:** The numbers shared are the numbers from the instant you tap the share button **Expected result:** The numbers shared are always the numbers at the end of the animation  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.7.0  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/568b5f5e814437da45c8e867f79b953b

column3: Sent time is incorrect
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If you open the detailed information on a message (both SMS and Signal messages), they show the time they were sent. On an earlier version of Signal, this worked as expected. With the current version (4.8.1) however, this is no longer possible and all messages and texts show incorrect information. Additionally, I cannot find the setting in the preferences anymore  ### Steps to reproduce - have no network connection for some time - restore network connection - receive message that was sent while you were unavailable - open the message's detailed information  **Actual result:** The message was allegedly sent only seconds prior to the reception (which is wrong) **Expected result:** The "sent" time should be correct, i.e. when the sender sent the message.  ### Device info **Device:** Oneplus 3 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.8.1

column3: No warning that microphone is disabled on Signal call
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If microphone permission is disabled, calls can still be made but the recipient cannot hear the user.  ### Steps to reproduce - Disable microphone permission - Secure call a contact  **Actual result:** Call goes through, call recipient cannot hear user. No warning is given that microphone permission is disabled. **Expected result:** On hitting call button, there should be a check if microphone is accessible. If not (mic permission is disabled), prompt for granting app microphone permission should be displayed to the user before they are able to make a call.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.5

column3: [4.11.4] Detailed group info view shows default avatar.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If I tap on a group avatar in a group conversation a detailed overview is shown with an enlarged default contact avatar on top.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open group conversation - Tap on group avatar   **Actual result:** Group detail is opened with a large default contact avatar. **Expected result:** Group detail should open with an enlarged group avatar on top. This does happen for 1:1 conversations.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.4  ### Link to debug log  At 9:32 I open the group conversation. https://gist.github.com/anonymous/3310b91c7cf1a1c3c659b851cca53584

column3: Videos sent from Moto G4 can't be played without saving them first
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If I send my friend a video the video gives an error if it's played in the app without saving it first. However, it works just fine if you save it outside the app and open it in the Photos app.  This started happening quite recently, it has always worked before.  ### Steps to reproduce 1. Record a video on a Moto G4 2. Try playing it before sending it. It works. 3. Send the video 4. Try playing it in the app 5. It ain't working  **Actual result:** Videos give an error message if you try playing it in the app **Expected result:** Videos should work just like they always have  ### Screenshots https://nup.pw/BAMir2.png

column3: video from iPhone cannot be forwarded correctly from Android
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If I receive a video from an iPhone (never got one from an Android yet), and then try to forward it, other iPhone's can't open it. But the video plays fine on the Android (and original iPhone).  ### Steps to reproduce - receive video from iPhone onto Android - long-click, click `‚Ä¶`-menu and "Forward" to another iPhone   **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour)  - my Android plays the video I received just fine - the second iPhone owner, who I sent to, gives me a reply saying "what's this 7mb file, it doesn't open" - my Signal Desktop shows a working video preview in the conversation where I received the video - my Signal Desktop shows the filename `signal-2017-05-08-182819.*` (with tooltip `Unsupported attachment type. Click to save`) instead of the Video/preview in the second conversation (where I forwarded the message). Saving this file, I can use `/usr/bin/file` on it, which gives: `/tmp/signal-2017-05-08-182819.*: ISO Media, MP4 v2 [ISO 14496-14]`   **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour)  - Desktop and the second iPhone should be able to play the forwarded video   ### Device info  **Device:** Sony Xperia LT25i **Android version:** 4.3 **Signal version:** 4.5.3  ### Link to debug log https://gist.githubusercontent.com/anonymous/2bf8f99d16ae854c404cd9a5d14674db/raw/6505f9155112b9a0a82ac76ebbd42fcf0c660ff3/cat.log

column3: Ringtone won't stop playing on open conversation
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If I receive a message in a conversation I have already open the ringtone goes off and won't shut up untill I kill Signal. I can record a movie in case it's not obvious what happens.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal - Open a conversation - Ask that person to send you a message - The ringtone won't shut up even if you reopen the conversation  **Actual result:** Ringtone goes off and stops only after it's played in full length. **Expected result:** I'd expect the ringtone to stop after I tap anywhere on the screen or after I go back and reopen the conversation.  ### Device info **Device:** Xiaomi Mi 5 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/707f3ee517560d89cab64dd027f83077

column3: [Crash] Signal crash and makes the phone restart if locking the phone while Signal is on foreground

column3: Conversation view crashes without phone permission
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If I deny the phone permission (`READ_PHONE_STATE`), the app crashes when opening a conversation thread.  ### Steps to reproduce - deny phone permission - click on a conversation in the main view (or a notification that opens a conversation)  **Actual result:** App crashes and appears blank **Expected result:** App should display conversation  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 6P **Android version:** 8.0.0 (CopperheadOS) **Signal version:** 4.10.12 ([CopperheadOS build](https://github.com/copperhead/Noise))  Was not reproducible with Signal 4.9.9.  ### Link to debug log  Here is an excerpt from `adb logcat`      FATAL EXCEPTION: main     Caused by: android.view.InflateException: Binary XML file line #57: Binary XML file line #167: Error inflating class org.thoughtcrime.securesms.components.SendButton     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.ConversationActivity.onCreate(ConversationActivity.java:261)     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.PassphraseRequiredActionBarActivity.onCreate(PassphraseRequiredActionBarActivity.java:50)     Caused by: java.lang.SecurityException: getActiveSubscriptionInfoList: Neither user [redacted] nor current process has android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE.     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.util.dualsim.SubscriptionManagerCompat.getActiveSubscriptionInfoList(SubscriptionManagerCompat.java:50)     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.TransportOptions.getTransportOptionsForSimCards(TransportOptions.java:149)     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.TransportOptions.initializeAvailableTransports(TransportOptions.java:129)     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.TransportOptions.(TransportOptions.java:34)     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.components.SendButton.initializeTransportOptions(SendButton.java:47)     at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.components.SendButton.(SendButton.java:35)     ... 38 more

column3: URLs containing emojis are not clickable
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If an URL in EmojiTextView contains an emoji then it is not clickable even if it is a completely valid URL.  ### Steps to reproduce * Send a signal message with the text: http://üçÑ.ga/ * Observe that neither sender nor recipient can click the link  **Actual result:** Link isn't clickable **Expected result:** Link should be clickable  ### Device info **Device:** OnePlus One **Android version:** 5.0.2 (but probably all) **Signal version:** 3.30.4

column3: Can't send message to verified contact after she reregistered
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If a verified contact reinstalls signal, messages can't be sent any longer.  ### Steps to reproduce - your friend registers with Signal - you verify the safety number - your friend reinstalls Signal - you try to send a message, it fails because of the changed safety number - you click on the failed message - you see a warning that the safety number changed and press the button next to it - you're asked if you want to accept the new safety number, you do - try to resent the message or send a different message, either one fails  Only once I received a message, I could send messages again.  **Actual result:** It is not possible to send messages after accepting the new safety number. **Expected result:** After accepting the new safety numbers, you should be able to send messages again.  ### Device info  **Device:** Blackphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.2  ### Link to debug log [log](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/db3ea6a5df4fbe63bfda04033e19f90c)

column3: Two question marks instead of emoji
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If a space is inserted after an emoji at the end of a line, sometimes two question marks are sent instead of the emoji.   ### Steps to reproduce - Create a new text message. - Enter about 15 emojis. - Move the cursor to the position after the 11th emoji (just before the end of the line) and insert a space. (The position may differ dependent on the screen resolution and/or the font size.)  - Send the message.  **Actual result:** The 11th emoji is converted to two question marks. **Expected result:** There should be the emoji.  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_2017-05-24-10-22-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20823006/26415074/85b9c458-40b1-11e7-8e18-7bbd3d31a563.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** Wiko Pulp 4G **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.0

column3: Label "unread messeges" is confusing (and sometimes just wrong)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If a new message arrives while the conversation list is active, a label "1 unread message" is added to the conversation (which can be seen after opening the appropriate conversation of course). If one opens that conversation and a second message arrives, the label changes to "2 unread messages", which is actually not true. In fact the conversation view is not able to know if someone read a message or not. That's only known by the reader himself. I mean, I'm staring at the screen reading the new messages and Signal is telling me that I haven't read the messages!?  The truth is that I did not answer the 2 messages mentioned before, that's why the label stays where it is. But: why should it be useful to see a label right under my last answer telling me that I did not write anything since then? That's just logical.  In conclusion this label is just useless in my opinion. More than that it is confusing because one might think of a bug if that label does not disappear.  ### Steps to reproduce - Go to conversation list - Receive a message - Change to conversation view - Receive another message  **Actual result:** Label "x unread message(s)" stays until something has been sent **Expected result:** No label should be shown at all  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_2017-05-10-14-15-54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20901110/26000612/f0794f0c-3729-11e7-81ca-c1e6c904b82d.png)  ![screenshot_2017-05-12-16-34-01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20901110/26002928/7e8ae4fc-3731-11e7-8795-2f94de6e35f9.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung S5 mini (SM-G800F) **Android version:** 6.0.1 (also 4.4.4) **Signal version:** 2.5.3

column3: Safety number still marked verified after contact reregisters
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description If a contact's safety number is marked as verified and that contact reregisters, the new safety number is marked as verified.  ### Steps to reproduce - mark contact's safety number as verified - contact reregisters with Signal (via Settings ‚ÜíAdvanced ‚ÜíSignal messages and calls) - new safety number is marked as verified  **Actual result:** New safety number is marked verified without asking the user. **Expected result:** User is asked to verify new safety number.  ### Device info  **Device:** Blackphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.2  ### Link to debug log [log](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/de34d026d41031898e282cf68a62dac0)

column3: Badge count not working properly for Sony Launcher
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Icon badge is not working for Sony Launcher `com.sonyericsson.home`, though it is working with the [Badger TestApp](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=me.leolin.isbadgeworking). Stepping through the debugger I found that there is an exception thrown and silently catched in ShortcutBadger. (see Screenshots) ` java.lang.RuntimeException Can't create handler inside thread that has not called Looper.prepare()`    Not sure if there is something that can be done on Signal side - The test app for ShortcutBadger is working fine... There is a pending pullrequest for ShortcutBadger around this region - but I didn't get if this would fix the behavior we have. https://github.com/leolin310148/ShortcutBadger/pull/189  _At some point of debugging, I managed to have the counter set to 1. Still figuring out how_   ### Steps to reproduce - have Sony Launcer com.sonyericsson.home installed - get a message - check badge count  **Actual result:** badge counter not changed/set **Expected result:** !(*Actual result*)  ### Screenshots  ![unnamed1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/24607106/845f5a50-1870-11e7-9fef-ad6cead3641d.png) ![unnamed2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5326916/24607111/86bac686-1870-11e7-876d-be353f8b6b16.png)  ### Device info  Device : Sony E5823 (E5823) Android : 6.0.1 (2701308494, 32.2.A.0.253) Memory : 36M (16.24% free, 512M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : BuildHost Signal 4.2.1

column3: Crash when opening MP3 file
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I've sent an MP3 file via Signal Desktop. It plays there alright. When playing the same file in Signal Android, the app crashes. There's also a toast saying "Error playing audio!" or similar.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open Signal Desktop - Send some MP3 file to somebody - Open the same conversation in Signal Android - Click the round play button for the MP3 file  **Actual result:** Unfortunately, Signal has stopped. Plus a toast message. **Expected result:** Well, it should... play the audio file.  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/41a5ec32e3c002f230099cd0079ad949

column3: Cannot send Signal messages with attachment when using local mall's public Wi-Fi hotspot
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I've recently connected to a local mall's public Wi-Fi network and noticed that Signal wasn't able to send any messages, while the other messenger I have installed (Threema) & the web browser had no problems.  Can you spot anything suspicious in the debug log?  Edit: I've tested this again and noticed that this only happens when the message has attachments (in my case a photo, haven't tested other attachment types). Messages without attachtments are getting sent instantly. Additionally, I've noticed that the same happens with Threema. Message without attachment = successful, messages with attachtment = failed. Also, I've done a second debug log which I'll add below.  ### Device info  **Device:** LG Nexus 5X **Android version:** 8.0.0 / 8.1.0 **Signal version:** 4.14.2 / 4.14.7  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/RiseT/b83f578b298154a9442db721c62c6ebd https://gist.github.com/RiseT/2bf662172ab9b8661710ae584be34df3

The animation opening the menu area got stuck somewhere in the middle and resulted in a crash a couple of seconds later. I've had this 2 times in a row now.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open conversation - Tap on paper clip button  **Actual result:** Opening animation isn't completed, crash **Expected result:** Open the attachment menu without crashing  ### Screenshots  None  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/55715ded01ef69d58579a638f0cbf20d

column3: New MMS group chat thread created with exact same users as another
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I've had an MMS group chat thread going with me and two other people for several months now. Just this morning, one of the contacts send a message to this group. Signal created a new thread for this group chat, even though the recipients specified are the same. I have noticed that they're in a slightly different order, however. For example; the older thread is Person 1, Person 2, and Person 3. The new thread shows that the recipients are Person 1, Person 3, and Person 2. Perhaps Signal thinks this justifies creating a new thread? IMO this should still go in the old thread.  ### Steps to reproduce - Create a group MMS, send - Create another group MMS to the same people, but with them in a slightly different order  **Actual result:** Two threads are created for the same people. **Expected result:** The old thread is continued.  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20171012-162207](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/842942/31523841-cff14924-af6a-11e7-8c95-b5f8cbb66d0d.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** HTC One M8, S. Team ROM **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log N/A, thread was created too long ago.

column3: Android app may be syncing wrong phone number from a contact with two phone numbers
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I'm opening this [as requested](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1406#issuecomment-327647980) to follow up on a problem I experienced in the desktop client.  As background, there's a contact in my address book on my Android phone that has two cell phone numbers. Both are labeled as "Mobile" in the Android Contacts UI. The first number, ending in 199, doesn't have Signal installed, but the second number, ending in 060, does.  In a group message that contains this contact, when I send a message from my Android phone, everything works fine, but when I send a message to the same group from the desktop app, I see "some recipients failed", with an error message of "number is not registered" for that contact. If I view the group members, either on Android or on desktop, I see the wrong phone number (ending in 199, without Signal installed) for this contact. (even though on Android I can send messages without error)  ### Device info **Device:** LG Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log Desktop debug log posted at https://gist.github.com/6f0eca3e20d21ac9c265658b6ad36488  (cc @scottnonnenberg)

column3: Add separate notification settings for messages and calls
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I would like to configure _call_ notifications differently than _message_ notifications. To be more specific, in my use case I have messages only make the LED blink, but no vibration, no sound, because I consider messages being asynchronous and non-immediate communication requests. In contrast I consider calls being synchronous and immediate, that's why I want them to make my phone vibrate or use a sound.  Adding separate sections in the notification settings was mentioned by @moxie0 in another, two year's old bug: ‚Äúeventually we'll add separate sections‚Äù, see https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/4164#issuecomment-144825913. The title of this other bug doesn't really make one think of this feature request in my opinion, that's why I created this one. Maybe the other one can be closed then. Or merged and title changed.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S5 Mini **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.4

column3: International (Vanuatu) phone number coerced to same country
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I was sent a link to a Vanuatu phone number in +678 format (where 678 is the country code). Clicking on that link to message the number opened a conversation to +61678 - i.e. despite the + at the beginning of the number, the number was coerced to an (invalid) Australian number.  Saving the number as a contact allowed me to start a Signal conversation with the correct number.  ### Steps to reproduce - have Signal as default SMS app - Receive a Vanuatu phone number - click on the phone number link and choose the SMS option - Notice that the number has been coerced to different number  **Actual result:** The number was treated as a +61 (Australia) number instead of a +678 (Vanuatu) number **Expected result:** The phone number would be the same as the one clicked on, i.e. a +678 (Vanuatu) number  ### Screenshots 1. Link shows the number in +678 format ![screenshot_20170330-090747](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/735413/24500212/d76f47e6-1587-11e7-914b-4e6267abb3ca.png)  2. Conversation opened by clicking that link shows the number as a +61 number ![screenshot_20170330-090817](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/735413/24500224/e4d00650-1587-11e7-8dff-5879558d15b2.png)    ### Device info  **Device:** Google Pixel **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0    ### Link to debug log (I was at work at the time so this was taken later - sorry!) https://gist.github.com/6091eb4e268a625c04a4b5869451385a

column3: Avatar in conversation view should be tappable
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I want to tap the conversation header to open the new conversation settings screen which also shows the enlarged avatar. I can tap the contact / group name, but not the avatar itself, which is unexpected.  ### Steps to reproduce - open a conversation - tap the avatar in the conversation header  **Actual result:** Nothings happens. **Expected result:** Should open the conversation settings screen.  Also note that in the old conversation screen one could tap the avatar on the left of each message bubble (which has been removed) to see that users full contacts info to e.g. start a normal (non-Signal) phone call. This quick access option is not available anymore anywhere.  ### Device info **Android version:** 5.1.1 & AVD 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.0

column3: Update to/ Installation of newest version breaks system
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I updated some apps from the Play Store yesterday, shortly after the Signal update started, the Cyanogenmod boot animation was displayed (notification bar and on-screen buttons on top, but unresponsive). I waited a few minutes until I hard rebooted the phone. After booting, the regular "Enter PIN" screen + background was displayed shortly, then again the background changed to the boot animation and the device became unresponsive to touchscreen input. A few seconds later the background changed to black. I rebooted several times, wiped cache and Dalvik cache from CWM, but to no avail. I finally did a factory reset, after which the phone worked normally again. Assuming the issue wasn't due to this specific update, I later reinstalled Signal from the Play Store, which resulted in a broken system all over again.  ### Steps to reproduce - Update or install current Signal version (on CM11)  **Actual result:** Boot animation is displayed and system becomes unresponsive **Expected result:** Signal is updated/installed  ### Device info  **Device:** Sony Xperia Z1 Compact **Android version:** 4.4.4 (CM 11-20141112-SNAPSHOT-M12-amami) **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log NA

When I started Signal, it crashed after typing in my password. After restart everything worked OK.  The relevant line in the debug log is  ``` java.lang.AssertionError: Migration didn't happen! /data/user/0/org.thoughtcrime.securesms/files/signed_prekeys/13787880, 1 ```  ### Device info  **Device:** Sony Z3 compact **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.4 (self built)  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/e19d0b5e8c180c4f439db67169656d96

column3: Back button in ShareActivity doesn't route back to 3rd party sharing source
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I share something from a 3rd party app to Signal. If I then use the back arrow in `ShareActivity` I will be forwarded to the activity I used the last time in Signal. But I would expect to be forwarded to the 3rd party app I shared from.  ### Steps to reproduce - open a Signal activity (a conversation, a settings page, an image, anything...) - leave Signal via home button - share something from another app to Signal - press the back arrow in the action bar of Signal's "Share with" activity  **Actual result:** You see the activity you opened in the first step. **Expected result:** You see the app from which you wanted to share something via Signal.  ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.10

column3: Viewed/Read Received SMS Remains Bold Unread
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I received a message from someone else.  I first saw the notification. I touched the notification, and the Signal application was called/opened.  Signal opened to the specific message, and I read the message.  I touched the onscreen back button, and noticed the message I had just read was still bold, implying it was unread.  I touched the message again, and confirmed that I was in the complete message thread, then went back out of the thread, and the message remained marked as unread.  I danced with this for a brief moment, then the message eventually was marked as read after the 3rd or 4th time viewing the message.  ### Steps to reproduce - This has happened to me only one time.  I do not know how to reproduce it.  **Actual result:** My description covers this fairly well. **Expected result:** I expect the message to be marked read automatically, once that message has been viewed.  By "viewed," I mean the primary screen is displaying the specific messages entire message thread, at the screen where I would respond to the message.  ### Screenshots No screenshot(s) to share at this time.  ### Device info **Device:** Google Pixel XL (1st gen ... not 2017 model) **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/609405771a79f2d85be9e61413260d59

column3: Inconsistent behavior in chatting with myself
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I often send messages to myself in order to remember things. I noticed that on Signal Desktop I can see my profile picture and I can send messages to myself. Those messages are correctly received also on my phone. On my phone, instead, I cannot see my profile picture, I can send messages to myself and see messages sent from Signal Desktop, but when I send a new message, I cannot see it on Signal Desktop.  ### Steps to reproduce - send a message to yourself - open Signal Desktop and check if you receive the message  - check your profile picture when chatting with yourself  **Actual result:** I cannot see my profile picture when chatting with myself. Signal Desktop doesn't receive messages sent to myself from phone application **Expected result:** I can see my profile picture when chatting with myself. Signal Desktop will receive messages sent to myself from phone application  ### Device info  **Device:** Huawei P10 Lite **Android version:** Lineage OS 14.1 **Signal version:** 4.13.6

column3: MMS messages are recieved multiple times
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I often receive MMS messages multiple times. It is not clear why I receive multiple copies of the message but the most recent occurrence was when I went out of country and was roaming. The messages themselves are identical with no problems in transmission, download or display. This has happened with multiple messages which are re-received n+1 times. These re-receptions do not seem to occur in a regular manner with some of them coming in days or even weeks later.  May be related to #1436  ### Steps to reproduce - Have someone send you an MMS message (preferably while roaming or experiencing network problems) - Wait  **Actual result:** Receive multiple copies of the MMS message **Expected result:** Receive only one copy of the MMS message  ### Screenshots https://drive.google.com/open?id=1xYLEvyCUwSgbtNh_sUT3gbELEwWjfg7S https://drive.google.com/open?id=12ZDQnsTawsEV1SA8WQaVMapWTZlsA--J  ### Device info  **Device:** Google Pixel 2 (Bell Canada version) **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.13.6  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/ea8351730a42f9d19c8bbc4f0bdf04d1

column3: High battery usage, probably network issue
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I noticed a very high battery usage during signal is running in the background. Signal uses 3 to 4 times more energy than K9, which has a similar task (open push connection, waiting for messages). The battery drain seems to be constantly in the background and happens even if no message is received or send. The log shows a lot of EOFExceptions in the WebSocketReader, so it seems to be a network related issue.  I tried to enable/disable the android internal battery optimization - in both cases the Exceptions happened. I also uninstalled Signal for a day to confirm that it is Signal which uses the energy and not an error in the statistics. And I checked with BetterBatteryStats for uncommon wakelocks/alarms without result.  I already reported this issue in a comment in #6717, but it seems to be a different problem.  I am using Android 7.1.1 on a phone without GAPPS.  ### Device info Device  : motorola Moto G (lineage_falcon) Android : 7.1.1 (cdc512c087, lineage_falcon-userdebug 7.1.1 NOF27B cdc512c087 release-keys) App : Signal 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/efd6d9b9ae725b831134654ff3250bd2 https://gist.github.com/anonymous/216fae3f5f7857c88eee3af101b54c83

column3: Backup/restore doesn't properly import group chats
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I installed a different ROM for my phone and made a backup of my conversations. After installing the ROM I registered my device and tried to restore the backup. That seemed to work fine but on closer inspection it turned out that group chats had been split into separate conversations, one for each person in the chat. So, for example, if I was in a group chat with Tom and Jerry, I would now have one chat with Tom (with all messages he sent to the group) and one for Jerry (with his messages). The group chat was not restored at all.   ### Steps to reproduce - Use Signal like normal (I did use a custom build with layout changes I've been working on with my own signing key, version 4.6.0), participate in group chats - Create a backup in Signal - Install a custom ROM (Lineage OS in my case). I wiped everything like system, cache, etc, except the internal storage (data) partition. - Reinstall Signal - Import the backup you've created earlier   **Actual result:** Group chats are imported as separate chats for each person participating in the chat. **Expected result:** Group chats should be restored the way I backed them up, so all the messages from that group should appear in that group chat.   ### Screenshots Omitted because privacy and I don't have photoshop at hand to do some blurring.   ### Device info  **Device:** Moto X 2014 (victara) xt1092 **Android version:** 6.0.0 (stock moto) -> 7.1.2 lineage os nightly june 2nd **Signal version:** 4.6.0 / 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log Sorry, don't have that..

column3: Signal gets killed by its own verification SMS [4.9.1 & 4.9.2]
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I haven't experienced this prior to v4.9.1. Don't know if this is related to the various issues mentioned in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6838  ### Steps to reproduce Prerequisite: Installed Signal 4.9.1 or 4.9.2 **with SMS enabled**  1. In Android, go to Settings > Apps > Signal 2. Press "Force Stop" 3. Open "Storage" by pressing it 4. Press "Clear Cache" 5. Press "Clear Data" 6. Leave Android's settings 7. Start Signal (will open up with registration screen like a new installation) 8. Enter your phone number for registration 9. Start registration process by pressing that button 10. Watch Signal crash at the moment the verification SMS should arrive 11. From that point on, whenever you try to open Signal, it instantly crashes 12. (un- and re-installing Signal fixes the situation until you do the steps described above again)  **Important notes:** - The crash doesn't happen if Signal is not registered as the SMS app - The verification SMSes are from German phone numbers used by twilio for German registrations  **Actual result:** Crashes **Expected result:** Doesn't crash ### Screenshots  None.  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.9.1, 4.9.2  ### Link to debug log  None.

column3: Hanging up immediatly after call init behaves odd
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I ended a new call by pressing the hangup button instantly after the starts (sonar sound just started playing the first time) Then the call was ended (no more sonar sound) but the WebRtcCallActivity was not closed. I just sat there waiting for nothing(?) After letting it ring some seconds (2 sonar pings) The hangup works as expected. And afterwards the this bug is not reproducible. But leads to this crash: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6348#issuecomment-285964643 Not sure yet, if this is the same issue... (will merge into 6348 if so)   ### Steps to reproduce - start Web RTC call - press hangup immediatly after the button ist visible - ~~maybe helpful for repro: the recipient's Signal was not receiving any incoming call, cause it got and stayed killed after Debugging (Android Emulator)~~  **Actual result:** *Sometimes* WebRtcCallActivity stays active, nothing more happens **Expected result:** WebRtcCallActivity gets closed  ### Device info  Device  : Sony E5823 (E5823) Android : 6.0.1 (2701308494, 32.2.A.0.253) Memory  : 36M (16.24% free, 512M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : BuildHost App     : Signal 3.31.2  ### Link to debug log After cleaning out the leaks, here you go: https://gist.github.com/McLoo/0074df6170a3b8d6856d5c69c89b7122#file-gistfile1-txt-L360 (I left WebRtcCallActivity and the Convo by back-button. Then locked Signal, to access the "Submit Debug log" faster)  https://gist.github.com/McLoo/e5c6c93596a632b5dece6942fcbf1179#file-gistfile1-txt-L337 (left WebRtcCallActivity and the Convo by back-button, then Settings->Submit)

column3: Show message text at direct reply with privacy option of only showing the name of sender
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I enabled the option "Show name only" in "Notifications". When I receive a message, the text "New message" is shown in my notifications (which is intended), but when I want to reply directly in the notification, it should show the message that I received (but still shows the "New message" text). How can I answer if I don't know what the message was. This worked on my old phone with Android 4.2.2, but does not with my new one with Android 7.  ### Steps to reproduce - In options: Notifications > Show > Name only - Close Signal - Receive new message - Try to reply directly from your notifications  **Actual result:** When I use direct reply within the notifications, "New message" is shown **Expected result:** When I hit direct reply within the notifications, the message text should be shown  ### Screenshots  ![screenshot_20170928-140050](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12643214/30965572-1d6325b2-a456-11e7-9ed6-e87e64a11baf.png)   ### Device info  **Device:** OnePlus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.12

column3: Signal 4.2.x crashes when sending picture
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I am running Signal in the Blackberry Android Runtime which equals ‚ÄòAndroid Jelly Bean‚Äô. Since version 4.2.0-253 there is a bug which crashes Signal when sending a picture to a contact. It crashes with the message: ‚ÄòUnfortunately, Signal has stopped.‚Äô  After that first crash, Signal remains crashing a couple seconds after opening. The only way to solve the issue is by reinstalling Signal.  Affected versions, 4.2.0-253 and 4.2.1-254  I do not expect support for Blackberry Runtime, but I guess the bug is there on Android devices also.  ### Steps to reproduce Send a picture to a contact. It does not matter if you share it from your photo gallery or select it via the paperclip.  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) It crashes with the message: ‚ÄòUnfortunately, Signal has stopped.‚Äô **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) The pictures hould have been sent and the app should remain running. ### Screenshots   ### Device info Blackberry Android Runtime which equals ‚ÄòAndroid Jelly Bean‚Äô Affected versions, 4.2.0-253 and 4.2.1-254  ### Link to debug log  I cannot get the log since it crashes and remains crashing.
