column3: Hitting "Open directory" after saving media has no effect
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Hitting "Open directory" after saving media will have no effect if none of the installed file managers can handle a "resource/folder" intent. (see also #6164)  ### Steps to reproduce - Open conversation - Scroll to an image/video/audio message - Long-press this media message - Choose "Save" from the context menu. - A snackbar will pop up and offer an "Open Directory" action. Hit "Open Directory".  **Actual result:** Nothing will happen (if none of the installed file managers can handle a "resource/folder" intent) **Expected result:** Don't offer "Open directory", if there's no app to perform this action.  ### Tested file manager apps Works as expected:  - ES File Explorer  Doesn't work:  - Amaze File Manager - Built-in 7.1.1 file manager (Settings -> Storage -> Internal Shared Storage -> Explore)

column3: Messages not delivered
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Hello, I would report a bug and hope that this can help improve this cool software. Yesterday a friend of mine sent me some message but the program says that they are not been delivered (with a red exclamation point). His internet was good and also mine, maybe there was a temporary interruption of your servers as has happened a few months ago. Now he tried sent me again these messages but I am able only to receive new messages from him, so these messages are still pending and not delivered.  I would suggest to introduce a function that can automatically send these messages without the need to do that manually or that delete "pending" messages after a reasonable amount of time from your servers and from client for security reasons.  ### Steps to reproduce  **Actual result:** there is no function that tries to automatically send not delivered messages which remain pending forever.  **Expected result:**  - introduce a function that can automatically send these messages without the need to do that manually  - delete not delivered messages after a reasonable amount of time from your servers and from client for security reasons, especially who choised to use the disappear message option.  ### Screenshots  ### Device info  **Device:** all **Android version:** all **Signal version:** 4.9  ### Link to debug log

column3: Heart emojis don't get made jumbo
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Heart emojis, or sequences of emojis containing a heart, are always at normal size rather than being jumbo sized, even if there is no other text in the message. Other emojis do go jumbo sized.  ### Steps to reproduce - Send message containing only (non-heart) emojis. Confirm that these are jumbo sized. - Send message containing only emojis, including at least one heart. Confirm that this is regular size. - Send message containing only a heart emoji. Confirm that this is regular size.  **Actual result:** Any emoji sequence containing a heart is regular size. Any emoji sequence not containing a heart is jumbo sized. **Expected result:** Any emoji sequence, including with a heart, should appear as jumbo sized.   ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20170623-094003](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/735413/27460894-25a57f70-57fa-11e7-8034-3405aff6a1f5.png) ![screenshot_20170623-094010](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/735413/27460891-259f06ae-57fa-11e7-9937-907b5d8ef6e8.png) ![screenshot_20170623-094031](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/735413/27460892-259fa5aa-57fa-11e7-9f0b-4c716e50332a.png) ![screenshot_20170623-094053](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/735413/27460893-25a06a3a-57fa-11e7-91c6-ce5fdbd1ba2a.png)   ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log Note: Most of the screenshots are from earlier, but I replicated the issue again with a single heart right before I grabbed the debug logs. https://gist.github.com/7769fff88e3e39b07033881f87aadaad

This includes pictures. **Now before you tell me to go to Signal-Desktop instead, Lilia Kai said this might be a Signal-Android issue.** https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1038#issuecomment-283771734  ### Steps to reproduce 1. Send a message with Signal-Android, it doesn't matter if Signal-Desktop is online or offline. At first it only consistently happened when Signal-Desktop was offline, but now it happens every message regardless of what I do. 2. The message will appear twice on Signal-Desktop.  **Actual result:** Messages appear twice in a row **Expected result:** Every message should only appear once  ### Screenshots https://nup.pw/FARUE2.png  ### Device info Device  : motorola Moto G (4) (athene) Android : 6.0.1 (64, MPJ24.139-63) Memory  : 52M (13.54% free, 384M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : ilclbld87 App     : Signal 3.30.4  ### Signal-Android debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4f0973a66b7fb88ecf575e8e178bc40d  ### Signal-Desktop debug log https://gist.github.com/833edff1008c4197cf41e9bfb9f0a5bf

column3: Contact list: Contact entries swap names and avatar pictures
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description For a rather long time now (at least months), I've noticed a strange phenomenom in Signal's contact list.  ~~When launching Signal from scratch (not from RAM)~~, the **names** and the **avatar pictures** (**not** the phone number) of two of my contacts (always the same ones) either a) swap places within the contact list, or b) one of them is displayed for both contacts. Refreshing Signal's contact list manually always corrects the situation. This happens pretty often, i. e. > 25 % of the time ~~when Signal is not in the RAM anymore~~.  Again, the phone numbers aren't swapped. They stay at their "correct" places all the time. Which with the swapped names/avatars of course means that e. g. under the letter "M", you have an entry with name and avatar of "Jxxxxx", while the corresponding phone number is "Mxxxxx"'s.  PS: Don't know if this is important here, but "Mxxxxx" used to have dual SIM.  Edit: As pointed out by @AndHell , the affected contacts are always **the 6th and the 8th contact of the list**. Edit: As an alternative to refreshing the contact list, leaving and re-opening it seems to work as well.  ### Steps to reproduce 1. Launch Signal when it's not pre-loaded into memory 2. Open contact list & dismiss keyboard 3. Notice issue 4. Refresh or leave and re-open contact list 5. Notice everything's correct now  ### Screenshots  **Screenshot at step 3:** ![screenshot_20170403-034953 markup small](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12624674/24654170/de25fbc0-1938-11e7-97b6-3d60281f9f9a.png)  **Screenshot at step 5:** ![screenshot_20170403-035024 markup small](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12624674/24654180/e81ff702-1938-11e7-85ed-8527de1ea7bb.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.2.2  ### Link to debug log  Taken at step 5, i. e. after refreshing the contact list. https://gist.github.com/anonymous/cb0f2786a618aae220e2fdbc613a59df

column3: Allow auto fallback from Signal message to SMS/MMS
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Family uses Signal to communicate but Teenager has limited cellular data (e.g. used up monthly quota on YouTube). Other family members cannot send messages to Teenager in a timely fashion without knowing in advance whether Teenager currently has cellular data available.  ### Steps to reproduce - Attempt to send Signal message to Teenager - Message is sent fine (one tick) - Hours later, notice that Teenager has not replied, and message still has only one tick - Manually send message via long-press SMS   **Actual result:**  Teenager doesn't actually receive the message until it has been manually been sent via SMS  **Expected result:**  An app setting should allow automatic fallback to SMS/MMS if the message has not been delivered to the recipient after N minutes. (Signal would ideally need a way to identify when two copies are received, one via SMS/MMS and one via Signal when cellular or Wifi permits the original message to arrive)  For many people, the encrypted nature of Signal messages is less important than a single, reliable messaging app, and these people are nonetheless important for growing the Signal user base.  (BTW, I found some old bugs about fallback if the senders internet is intermittent, but not the receivers)

column3: Automatic resend of failed media messages
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Everytime a media message fails to send (especcially in an area with bad celular), I get notifications for each message that it failed to send. Afterwards I have to go to each message, tap on the red '!', and then hit resend. In an area with bad celular coverage, I typically have to do this 5-10+ times for each! of the images I want to send.  This is one of the major reasons for some of my friends to not use Signal as their main messenger. They even discourage other people from using Signal because of this.  There is #3068, but the ticket has been closed without adressing the main issue.  ### Steps to reproduce - go to area with bad celular coverage (e.g. a festival) - try to send picture(s) to Signal contacts  **Actual result:** - fail in trying to send picture(s) to Signal contacts and get annoyed by having to manually resend each and every message  **Expected result:** - follow the usability of Telegram and WhatsApp and automatically try resending the images up to a certain threshold time (say one day) - retry time should not increase linearly  ### Device info **Device:** Moto G3 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.8.1

column3: Don't show "share your profile with group" banner for empty profile
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Even though I never filled my profile, in every group I am in, there is a permanent banner to share my profile with the group. I tried hard and searched but found no way to get rid of this banner.  Profiles have been fairly recently added, and they're great! I am sure many people love them. However, I'd prefer to not use them, and I expect Signal to respect that choice. Right now, I have to say I feel coerced by Signal to use profiles. On first startup, when it asked to enter profile data, there was not even an option to say "No thanks, I don't want a profile" -- there only was "fill profile data later". That's the kind of UI I expect from software disrespecting their users, software that primarily wants to extract user's data. I am aware Signal does that, but then I have to wonder why the UI clearly tells me that the software does not want me to choose to not have a profile.  In every group chat, there now is a banner that lets me share my (empty) profile with the group. Clicking it, I again have the choice between sharing now (which I don't want to do) and cancelling, which leaves the banner enabled. There is no option, it seems (or it is well hidden), to just make the banner go away without enabling profile sharing.  ### Steps to reproduce - Never enter any data into the profile - Join a group chat. There's a banner there taking ~15-20% of the screen space. - Try to get rid of the banner that tells me that I can share my profile with the group. I tried swiping, tapping, and I went through the entire settings dialogue.  **Actual result:** The banner persists, in all group chats. **Expected result:** There should be a way to make the banner go away without enabling profile sharing. Actually, given that my profile is empty, it should not even show the banner.   ### Device info  **Device:** Moto E2 2015 LTE **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.9

column3: Signal connects to the OWS server even when unregistered
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Even after unregistering (disabling "Signal messages and calls" from the advanced preferences) Signal (websocket) keeps an open connection to the OWS server. The client uses the credentials that were valid before unregistering, and the server accepts them: they are still valid. This means two things:  - There is a bug in the (websocket) client, which keeps connecting even when it shouldn't. This is quite bad, as no contact to the server is expected when the push functionality is disabled. - The server doesn't really delete the account when the push functionality is disabled. This is even worse, as the users expects any trace of their account to disappear after unregistering. Even commercial, non privacy-centric services promise this.  ### Steps to reproduce - Register to Signal - Unregister - Monitor the app's connections. - If running an instance of Signal-Server: check the server log.  ### Device info  **Signal version:** 4.5.3-website

column3: Enabling Video changes bottom mic to top mic. Disabling does not change it back
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Enabling Video Call seems to use the mic on top of the phone instead of the bottom (might be intended). However if Video Call is disabled it should go back.   ### Steps to reproduce 1. Start Signal Call 2. Tap against the top and bottom mic hole on your phone. On the other phone, you should only hear the tapping from the bottom hole.  3. Enable Video 4. Repeat 2. But now top mic is active. Bottom mic is disabled.  5. Disable Video 6. Repeat 2. Top mic is still active. Bottom mic is disabled.   **Actual result:** Mic does not change back.  **Expected result:** If the switching is intended behavior it should switch back to where it came from. Be consistent ;)  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Galaxy S5 **Android version:** see log **Signal version:** see log  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/57fcc910aaf64b9be8cfc7e0676cde9f

column3: Input with physical keyboard (BlackBerry Priv)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Editing a text at cursors location stops working with BlackBerry Privs physical keyboard. This bug occurs from time to time.  ### Steps to reproduce - use BlackBerry Privs physical keyboard - write a text in conversation - move cursor to another location - press backspace to delete text - Repeat above steps to force the bug - unexpected behaviour occurs  **Actual result:** Cursor jumps to the end of the text. **Expected result:** Cursor should stay in position and delete character inbetween the text.  ### Device info **Device:** BlackBerry Priv **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/16c1d8c3807be10cb6db77b03ef7be05  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/af4c932ce00f06939a74248282ce9d31 (old log)

column3: Screen turns off during video playback
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description During video playback the screen turns off. There should be a wakelock preventing that the screen turns off when a video is playing.  ### Steps to reproduce - set turn off timer in Android settings to a short time (e.g. 15s) - go to a conversation with a video attachment, that plays longer than the turn off time of the display - tap this video - wait as long as your display turn off time is (don't interact with the screen)  **Actual result:** Screen turns off and interrupts video playback. **Expected result:** Screen stays on during video playback.  ### Device info 1  **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.0  ### Device info 2 **Device:** Sony Xperia U **Android version:** 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod) **Signal version:** 4.6.0

column3: Exclude disappearing messages from backup
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Disappearing messages should be excluded from backup, because they are by definition not meant to persist.  ### Steps to reproduce - Send or receive a disappearing text message - export a plaintext backup - search for the message body of above message in the exported file  **Actual result:** The message is included in the backup. **Expected result:** The message should not be included in the backup (even if it were encrypted) as the message cannot disappear there later.

column3: Emoji interpretation depends on emoji set pref
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Different emoji settings potentially lead to different communication experiences for sender and receiver, see screenshots below for a random example. I suggest to remove the preference to use system emoji.  The screenshots below show the exact same message on the same phone.  **Actual result:** Emoji interpretaton depends on user pref **Expected result:** Emoji depiction should essentially be identical  ### Screenshots  ![emojiset](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3845150/26033430/a1ca2d70-38ac-11e7-8ebe-61a4d76aa3e7.png) *Built-in emoji set*  ![system](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3845150/26033431/a3db6b2e-38ac-11e7-9028-7b4bbb8d6db6.png) *System emoji set*  ### Device info **Android version:** Android 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.0

column3: Lost Signal Messages after Update
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing. Updated to Signal 4.1.0, had to reauthenticate via SMS.  Once that was complete, it seems that all my Signal history is gone:  Photos, chats, everything.  SMS is still there but I can't find any Signal messages.  ### Steps to reproduce - using hyphens as bullet points - list the steps - that reproduce the bug  - Impossible to reproduce as I can't reinstall the update and the chats appear to be gone.  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour)  - I should have my freakin' Signal chat history!  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S2 I9100 **Android version:** 4.0.3  **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log   https;//GIST.GITHUB.COM/56F0921FC61DBDC6FE0B1F443F538180

column3: messages not sending in ipv6/ipv4 environment
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing.  signal on desktop and android do not work when both ipv4 and ipv6 is enabled. Desktop says its disconnected, android just doesnt send messages.  ### Steps to reproduce - use dhcpv6 to enable ipv6 - make sure you have connectivity via ipv6 - try to use signal  **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) Android shows as message failed **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) Either ipv6 support, send via ipv4, or send mms via cell  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 6p **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/da88de0ddbadef94d85608e482de4bcb

column3: Crash when registering on new device and viewing group chats
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing.  My old phone broke, and I got lent one by a friend, Samsung S3 (model GT-I9300), running CyanogenMod (11.0-InstallerXNPQ32P) with android 4.4.4 which is old but they asked me not to reflash it as it had some tools that were hard to set up and worked which they didn't want breaking.  The google play framework was out of date, so couldn't install via the play store, instead getting the apk from https://signal.org/android/apk/ and installing it. I have swapped sims from old phone, and started up signal, registered and sent test message to my friend which worked, they could send one back and that worked. Later I asked someone from a group chat I was in to send a message to the group, and it came through, but now everytime I open the app it crashes with the stack trace shown below. I get notifications fine, but whenever I go into the app it crashes.  I cleared data and reinstalled the apk and it still does this repeatably.  It also has xposed framework on it, but I couldn't see how to disable that so unsure if it is interfering.  I'm just wondering whether this would be an issue with: - signal - old cyanogen - old gapps - xposed  Attached the logs below, let me know if you need more than that.  ### Steps to reproduce - Have a group chat on one phone - Register a new device running outdated software? - Receive a group chat message  **Actual result:** Crash **Expected result:** Signal works as normal, can view group chat messages, no crash.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung S3 (model GT-I9300) **Android version:** 4.4.4 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log ``` E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): FATAL EXCEPTION: JobConsumer-0 E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 5212 E/AndroidRuntime( 5212): java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot set request property after connection is made E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpURLConnectionImpl.setRequestProperty(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:508) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.setRequestProperty(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:294) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.whispersystems.signalservice.internal.push.PushServiceSocket.downloadAttachment(PushServiceSocket.java:468) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.whispersystems.signalservice.internal.push.PushServiceSocket.retrieveAttachment(PushServiceSocket.java:372) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.SignalServiceMessageReceiver.retrieveAttachment(SignalServiceMessageReceiver.java:119) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.SignalServiceMessageReceiver.retrieveAttachment(SignalServiceMessageReceiver.java:88) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AvatarDownloadJob.onRun(AvatarDownloadJob.java:85) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) E/AndroidRuntime( 5212):        at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46)  ```

column3: Signal 4.6.1: Can't retrieve MMS messages T-Mobile
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing.  MMS messages from non-Signal users display error 'Error downloading MMS message, tap to retry'.  All retries similarly fail.  Restarting device doesn't help.  Wifi on/off doesn't help.  Wifi Calling Compatibility on/off doesn't help.  Neither default T-Mobile APN settings or modified ones fix the issue.  ### Steps to reproduce - Receive MMS message from non-Signal user. - message fails to download - tap 'retry' icon - message attempts to download, mobile network icon appearing/disappearing multiple times over the course of the download - message fails to download after ~10 seconds  Actual Result: MMS message fails to download  Expected Result: MMS successfully downloads on first try.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** LG G4 **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log   https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9383bd457f16d7176f0d265bd0c3578b

column3: Incoming calls over VPN take extremely long to "connect" (85-250s). (the VPN in question works well with other VoIP, i.e. plaintext calls with Groundwire + callcentric)
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing.  If VPN is connected, Signal takes forever to connect an incoming call (up to 250 seconds, that 's long...)  The VPN is shadowsocks-based, tested for general VoIP compatibility via Groundwire client and callcentric's VoIP service, with very good results, under 5s from call initiation to call connection, good quality.  The issue was also replicated on Mullvad VPN with usual android OpenVPN client (exactly same behavior)  So it is not an issue specific to a particular VPN implementation or server/client config.  Also, it's not a push issue groundwire uses push too Also, to further verify it's no a GCM/push issue, PNF Root app was installed and yet another incoming call via Signal was attempted. With other person trying to Signal-call the phone behind VPN, phone showed  no signs of being called for 149 seconds, while, during all this time, the GCM log courtesy of PNF Root app showed numerous push messages from whispersystems/Signal  NB: Signal text messages are not affected and are delivered instantly  ### Steps to reproduce - Install an android VPN (any Shadowsocks or OpenVPN one seems to do) - connect it - test that signal works by exchanging text messages - try to call the phone behind VPN   **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour)  The incoming call takes unreasonably long to connect   **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour)  Somewhat more reasonable time between "other party initiated call" and phone actually ringing. Maybe like, 5 - 15 seconds  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Tested and reproduced on Samsung Galaxy S6 edge, Xiaomi Redmi Pro, Elephone P7000 **Android version:** Different android versions, Android 6 on Samsung Galaxy S6 edge, various Android 5 (vendor ROMs) on Xiaomi Redmi Pro, Elephone P7000 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log

Open the Photo app 2. Choose a video 3. Try to share it to Signal 4. This is as far as you can get: https://nup.pw/BjZPdv.png  **Actual result:** You can't choose a contact to share the video with **Expected result:** Sharing pictures work, and so should videos.  ### Screenshots https://nup.pw/BjZPdv.png   ### Device info Device  : motorola Moto G (4) (athene) Android : 7.0 (16, NPJ25.93-14) Memory  : 55M (9.35% free, 384M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : ilclbld26 App     : Signal 4.2.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/47411aeb23d379e89b6a3680ffbaad64

column3: notifications aren't muted while call is active
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Describe here the issue that you are experiencing.  ### Steps to reproduce - initate call - wait until call is active  **Actual result:** notifications still play sounds / aren't muted **Expected result:** notifications should be muted and not scream in your ear     ### Device info  **Device:** Zuk Z1 **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log  No debug log at the moment, as I do not have the tools and environment to reproduce the bug. If this is declared abnormal behaviour I will gladly supply it at a later point. If this is normal behaviour I would recommend to change it, like with normal calling.

column3: Crash on Startup after upgrading to 4.9.0

column3: Contacts don't sync to Signal Desktop anymore
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Contacts don't seem to sync to Signal Desktop anymore. This functionality used to work, but it no longer appears to. From what I can tell in the logs, it seems like Signal Desktop is doing the right thing but Signal Android never sends the contacts properly.  Related Signal Desktop issues: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1499, https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1575   ### Steps to reproduce - Start with Signal Android set up with various conversations and contacts in your contact list on Android - Link Signal Desktop to Signal Android - Notice that no contacts were imported during the initial linking process, but groups show up fine - Go to Menu > Settings in Signal Desktop and use the "Import now" button to try to sync contacts  **Actual result:** The "Last import" date is updated on Desktop, but contacts are never imported. Groups show up just fine. On the Android side, nothing happens but there is an error in the logs. **Expected result:** The "Last import" date is updated on Desktop, contacts are imported, and groups show up fine.  ### Device info **Device:** LG Nexus 5X **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log Android (shows an EOFException): https://gist.github.com/anonymous/abe819938bdb4ca4c70fbfbc5f00d7be Desktop (looks fine): https://gist.github.com/e8f91497c4ad837df05e6207054dd26a

column3: "Enable Signal for SMS" screen does not update after Signal becomes default SMS app
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Clicking "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" works, but after Signal is made default SMS app the screen still displays this button.   ### Steps to reproduce - Signal is not default SMS app (only used for Signal contacts) - Open Signal - Use the pencil button to start sending a new message - Click keyboard button to manually enter a number - Enter a number that is not using Signal - You can see the screen where the chosen number is displayed at the top but there is no message editing field at the bottom. The "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" button is displayed instead - Click "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" - Android asks if you want to change SMS app, click Yes - Signal becomes your default SMS app   **Actual result:**   - The screen stays the same: "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" button is still displayed at the bottom but it does nothing - To actually send the message you have to click back and select the number again  **Expected result:**   - Displayed screen should "find out" that Signal for SMS has been enabled and allow you to send the message immediately  ### Screenshots  Send message to a non-Signal number ![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6075325/23822870/fbc0bf26-0655-11e7-800b-fd73f1720804.png)  You need to enable Signal for SMS ![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6075325/23822869/fbc0851a-0655-11e7-9f33-34bbd4e1148a.png)  Confirm with Android, Signal becomes default SMS app after clicking Yes ![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6075325/23822868/fbbf84c6-0655-11e7-813e-a7a5b2998b77.png)   The screen should show the state below, but instead it shows the same screen as the second screenshot. To get the screen below you have to go back and choose the number again. ![4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6075325/23822871/fbc131b8-0655-11e7-91b2-3fd19563327c.png)   ### Device info  **Device:** Android Nexus 5x **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c066f04a68813761a465d999063a06fa

It will crash after confirming this picture in the camera intent.  ### Steps to reproduce - Go to settings - choose profile entry at the top - tap the picture - choose to use the camera - take a picture - confirm the picture (still in the intent, maybe depends on used camera app)  **Actual result:** Signal crashes **Expected result:** Picture is set as profile picture  ### Device info 1  **Device:** Sony Xperia U **Android version:** 4.4.4 **Signal version:** 4.10.2  ### Device info 2  **Device:** AVD Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.2  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d53c84c37d84a4520991ef8ebe64fd39

column3: Cannot receive images

Have received images from this person before  ### Steps to reproduce - have someone send me an image via Signal (on iOS) [_did this twice_] - click on the download image button ("[download-symbol]  Image")  **Actual result:** The loading wheel begins to spin but then disappears, leaving the rounded rectangle button (the dark green field within the received-text-field) blank **Expected result:** Image should appear.  I've received images from this person before, but I can't correlate this change in behavior to any change with the phone or their phone.    ### Screenshots Signal won't let me take a screenshot  ### Device info  **Device:** HTC HTC6535LVW (HTCOneM9vzw) **Android version:** 7.0 (947620.11, NRD90M release-keys) **Signal version:** 4.13.6  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/c304923ba40cc8c6f5301bbd2564d168

column3: Call audio quality often degrades
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Calling between Android and Android (Signal version 4.6.1) is prone to frequent audio degradation, heard from both sides. Calling between Android and Iphone (using all the below referenced Androids and Iphones) is prone to frequent audio degradation, only heard from Iphone side. Calling between Iphone and Iphone is always ok, both sides (tested on Iphone SE, Iphone 6s, Iphone 7p, all with Signal 2.12.2). See also #6708. This one is almost a duplicate... the fact is that the audio degrading happens always, its only more prominent when there is audio level above thresold on both sides.   ### Steps to reproduce - call an Android phone with Signal 4.6.1 from an Android phone with Signal 4.6.1 - call an Android phone with Signal 4.6.1 from an Iphone SE, 6s, 7p, all with Signal 2.12.2, or vice versa  **Actual result:** frequent audio degradation in both Android sides in Android  Android call, frequent audio degradation heard only in Iphone sides in Android  Iphone call **Expected result:** call audio quality should not degrade    ### Device info  **Device 1:** BlackBerry KEYone **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.6.1   **Device 2:** Sony Xperia X Compact **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.6.1    ### Link to debug log Here are the logs of a call from Sony X Compact to BlackBerry KEYone, with frequent audio degradation, both sides.  Sony X Compact: [https://gist.github.com/fe9f35e303d50902d44df910a665b487](https://gist.github.com/fe9f35e303d50902d44df910a665b487)  BlackBerry KEYone: [https://gist.github.com/44861948bc656b51e5ee1fa6e0cbde8a](https://gist.github.com/44861948bc656b51e5ee1fa6e0cbde8a)

From the lock screen or the app, does not matter.  4.4.0 or 4.5.0, Flyme 6 or 5, result is the same. Different notification settings, lock screen password or not - result is the same. column3: Trying to place calls between phones with Signal 3.31.0 -> no ringing
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Both devices have Signal 3.31.0. Both devices re-registered, synced contacts, rebooted, after 3.31.0 update. If I try to place a call from the Blackberry, all seems ok, I have the "DIALING" screen and sound, but the other end (device Alcatel) doesnt ring. After 20/30 seconds I abort the call on the Blackberry with the red "hangup" button; the other end (Alcatel) gives instantly a missed call notification. Exactly the same happens when calling the Blackberry from the Alcatel.  ### Steps to reproduce - Call Alcatel from Blackberry, and viceversa.  **Actual result:** Call the other device, the other device doesnt ring. **Expected result:** Call the other device, the other device rings.   ### Device 1 info  **Device:** Blackberry Classic **Android version:** 4.3 **Signal version:** 3.31.0  ### Device 2 info  **Device:** Alcatel Pixi4 5010D **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 3.31.0  ### Link to debug log   Blackberry calling Alcatel: http://gist.github.com/05c8bf579c2e551b9cc9619e948f23cf  Alcatel calling Blackberry doesnt give useful info, IMO, in the debug log: http://gist.github.com/992da1527c45c58d5d0cd25ef4b3f62c

column3: Bluetooth audio connection is not terminated after calling
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Bluetooth audio connection is not terminated after calling. I have tested this with a headset and a hands-free kit in the car. In the car, I see in the display that the connection has not yet been disconnected.  ### Steps to reproduce 1. Connect the bluetooth headset 2.  Call another singal user 3.  End the call.  **Actual result:** Audio connection to the headset is still open.  **Expected result:** The audio connection to the headset should be terminated.  ### Device info **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 5.1 **Signal version:** 4.5.3  ### Link to debug log The caller has terminated the call. The receiver pressed the hangup button on the headset a little later: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b2ed8e8eb42bce611424f87e653bb489

column3: Back button inoperative when keyboard deployed.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Back button from chat is blocked when keyboard open  ### Steps to reproduce - Open Chat - Tap bottom to open keyboard - Try to go back  **Actual result:** nothing happens, keyboard sliding down **Expected result:** Return to chat list.  - This didn't seem to exist in the current non beta 4.10.1.  - Before discovering it's relation to the keyboard as a user this felt like the app was being unresponsive.  - With a large phone having to close the keyboard before using the back button is frustrating - Other actions such as the right context menu can still be accessed with the keyboard deployed.  ### Device info **Device:** Onepluss 3 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.2

column3: Audio stops transmitting mid call
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Audio stops transmitting at random. I am not touching mic mute button.  ### Steps to reproduce - Establish a call and wait - at some point other party cannot hear anything     - within few seconds to few minutes; in most cases within a minute - Packet is still being transmitted/received; verified on the router - Once this happens subsequent calls have no audio at all. Force stopping then calling works until audio cuts off again mid call. - Inbound audio is also affected, but with slightly less frequency - It appears only happen on Wifi     - Also happens on in-network call (both devices on same wifi and making direct connection)     - Tried different wifi & ISP with different AP/Router and still cuts off - Same device on CM13.0 (Android 6.0.1) appears unaffected - Oneplus One (Bacon) on same O/S (Lineage 14.1/7.1.1)  appears unaffected     - when both sides have no audio, force stopping G3 fixes it however force stopping bacon does not; hence G3 is the culprit - Subsequent calls between device B (OPO/801) and device C (Xperia Z2/801) isn't affected. Call to G3 with either is affected until G3 force stops app - Disabling battery optimization does not solve it  ### Device info **Device:** LG G3 D852 (identical hardware to G3 D850 AT&T) **Android version:** 7.1.1 (Lineage OS Official) **Signal version:** 4.0.1  ### Link to debug log Debug log doesn't contain anything useful beyond model & O/S

column3: Don't convert audio files automatically to mp3
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Audio attachments on Android are automatically converted to mp3 and thus not playable on the iOS app.   ### Steps to reproduce - send a m4a audio file via "send audio"  **Actual result:**  The file is playable on the Android, but not in the iOS app.  **Expected result:**  It should also play on iOS.   ### More info If I use the same audio file and send it as a general file (not audio file) both Android and iOS clients can play the file inline. When saving the file in a folder in both ways, I found out that in the first case ("send as audio") it turns out the file was converted to mp3, while in the latter case the file remained untouched.   ### Device info  **Device:** Blackberry Priv **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.12.3

column3: Can't send messages to people who stopped using Signal
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Attempting to send a message to someone who deleted the app causes the message to never get received.  Signal seems to be trying to send the message to the other Signal app, which has been deleted, so they never get it.  The app should have an option to switch to SMS/MMS, or should send it as SMS/MMS if the user has been offline for a long period of time, or if the message was not received after a long period of time  ### Steps to reproduce - Download Signal on two phones - Begin an encrypted messaging session, and send some messages - Delete the app on one phone - Attempt to send a message using the Signal app to that phone  **Actual result:** The message is never received, and there is no option to switch to SMS/MMS **Expected result:** There should be an option to switch to SMS/MMS, or it should resend as SMS/MMS if the user was offline for a long period of time, or if messages aren't received for a long period of time.  ### Device info  **Device:** Xiaomi Mi A1 **Android version:** Nougat **Signal version:** Unknown (not near my phone right now)

column3: Phone doesn't ring on incoming call in locked state
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description As someone else noted in https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/videocalling-withios-not-possible/876/6 my device sometimes doesn't ring when it is locked. If it is unlocked it allways works. Note that this is a redphone call, as described here: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS/issues/1858  ### Steps to reproduce - lock the phone - get a call  **Actual result:** Phone doesn't ring **Expected result:** Phone should ring  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 3.31.4  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/dcab3736182311698178202cd0d61cea  I let it ring for about 15 seconds before unlocking the phone

column3: Clear conversation, deleting only the content
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description As is found in other popular instant messaging software, offer clearing a conversation by deleting the messages (in bulk) inside, but keep the conversation available even though it is empty. Now it is deleted, but when it remains, it can be used quickly for writing new messages without having to search for a contact first.  ### Steps to reproduce - have a conversation - delete all the messages - the conversation disappears by deletin the last message in it  **Actual result:** The conversation disappears **Expected result:** The conversation remains, although empty. This clearing action should be available with longpress on a conversation or from the menu within a conversation. In the app and in the web gui. For groups, probably some small variation is needed, but the same functionality is requested for that too.  PS I have searched the open and closed issues for something similar but could any on exactly this.  ### Device info  **Device:** n/a **Android version:** n/a **Signal version:** n/a

column3: Regression: Location sharing doesn't work anymore
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description As I don't use that feature that often, I don't know for how long, but location sharing doesn't work anymore. After tapping the location button, I see the map for a couple of frames, but then it disappears.  Note: This is *not* the same as https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6351, as I'm using stock Android (i. e. with gapps).  ### Steps to reproduce - Open conversation - Tap on attachment button - Tap on location button  **Actual result:** Maps visible for a fraction of a second, then disappears **Expected result:** Map should stay visible and I should be able to send a message containing that map  ### Screenshots N/A   ### Device info  **Device:** LG Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** Current 4.4.0 branch (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/commit/6d5a43ccb82a6430a32947b008ca85cce707ebbf is the latest commit)  ### Link to debug log  None yet. column3: v4.9.2 crashes on startup
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description As a follow up to issue https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6838, v4.9.2 still crashes on startup (I'm not even getting the "app failed to start" dialog, the UI flashes and then disappears). The stack trace of the SQL crash is similar to the original one posted in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6838#issuecomment-319319167:  ``` 08-02 08:41:40.027 30835 30856 W DatabaseHelper: 08-02 08:41:40.027 30835 30856 W DatabaseHelper: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConstraintException: UNIQUE constraint failed: recipient_preferences.recipient_ids (code 2067) 08-02 08:41:40.027 30835 30856 W DatabaseHelper: 	at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.nativeExecuteForChangedRowCount(Native Method) 08-02 08:41:40.027 30835 30856 W DatabaseHelper: 	at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.executeForChangedRowCount(SQLiteConnection.java:734) 08-02 08:41:40.027 30835 30856 W DatabaseHelper: 	at column3: Android app no longer able to send, link devices, or even deregister; only receives messages after reboot
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Android app is unable to send messages, open the "link devices" option in settings, or even deregister. Messages are received upon a reboot. Chrome app on desktop continues to work fine.  ### Steps I took  - Earlier today, everything was fine, and I was chatting away happily via my Android device.   - I then chatted a bit via the app on my desktop. Walked away from my computer and opened up the Android app again and tried to send a message, but it failed. Attempted to retry, and it failed again.  - Went back to my computer, and sent a message via the desktop. It was received fine. Got a reply as well. Everything seemed fine from the desktop perspective, but none of the messages were received on my phone.  - Attempted to open the "linked devices" list and I get a "Network connection failed" error dialog.  - Attempted to deregister the device, as per https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/216948747-What-do-I-do-if-I-see-Network-connection-failed-,  and I get "Error connecting to server!" popping up in the middle-bottom of the screen briefly.  - Rebooted phone, opened Signal, and the intervening messages all were delivered. Repeated above steps and no messages arrived on my phone and none could be sent.  **Actual result:** The Android app only receives messages after a reboot, and cannot send messages, manage linked devices, or deregister. **Expected result:** The Android app should be able to send and receive messages normally, open and manage the list of linked devices, and deregister if desired.  **Note:** I'm "still" using the Chrome app on this desktop, having never migrated because the standalone app's GTK usage doesn't play well with my KDE theme or DPI settings. I do have the standalone app installed on another desktop PC (which is how I became aware of the GTK-related problems), and the Chrome app configured on a ChromeOS laptop (which obviously couldn't run the standalone app even if I wanted to there), but I haven't had a chance yet to see if they are also still working.  ### Device info  **Device:** Google Pixel XL (marlin) **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.13.6 (from Play Store)  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/fc26f282c52288f71392732eb86410f4

column3: New iOS smileys are not shown on Android
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description An update of iOS brought new smileys. If a Signal-iOS users uses these in a Signal conversation with an Android user, the Android app shows only crossed rectangles.  ### Steps to reproduce - Send a message with the new smileys from Signal-iOS to Signal-Android - Open the message on Android  **Actual result:** The Android screen shows crossed rectangles where there are smileys that are not known to the Android app. **Expected result:** The app should display the correct smileys.  ### Screenshots  iOS screenshot:  ![signal-ios-2017-04-06-143545](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427572/24757944/0a93ec2c-1ae1-11e7-9edd-7f6184fc0b4d.jpg)  Android screenshot:  ![signal-android_20170406-150149](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427572/24757956/194498e8-1ae1-11e7-8545-5b0d85f54cc5.jpg)  ### Device info  **Device 1:** Sony Xperia Z1 Compact **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.2.4  **Device 2:** Apple iPhone 5s **Android version:** unknown (some 10.x version, can ask if required) **Signal version:** unknown (can check out later if required)  ### Link to debug log No debug log.

When Alice terminates the calling, then Bob gets a "missed call" notification.  ### Steps to reproduce - Alice starts to call Bob, she sees "Calling" screen - Bob can't see any notification - When Alice stops calling, then  Bob gets only "missed call" notification  ### Device info  **Alice Device:** Xiaomi Redmi Note 4 ***Bob Device: LG G3 **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log Alice log: https://gist.github.com/czaviar/31f4f6d89c868f6f3040be097bf16f6f Bob log: https://gist.github.com/czaviar/c9bbf249d84f87b9dc67b44a6598485d

column3: Contact name update in Signal on BBOS10
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Again this might just be a Android Runtime thing on Blackberry, and no serious issue for me personally. But just to make sure it is no issue on Android, I'd like to report it. So, if this works fine on Android, it is fine with me. Better safe than sorry.  When I update a contact name in my contacts, the name is not updated in Signal. It looks like it only reads the name in the initial install or when a contact starts using Signal and not afterwards.   ### Steps to reproduce 1. Edit contacts in the native device "contacts app" 2. Check contacts in Signal where nothing is changed 3. Tap on the pen to open contacts in Signal 4. Swipe down to refresh/update contacts 5. Nothing changed 6. Delete conversation, repeat step 3 and 4 and get result of step 5  **Actual result:** Nothing happens in relation to the contact name **Expected result:** Name of contact updated to the contact in the address book/contacts.  ### Device info  **Device:** Blackberry Q10 SR10.3.3.1463 **Android version:** Android Runtime with [Android Jelly Bean support](https://developer.blackberry.com/android/apisupport/unsupported_api_jellybean_appfeatures.html)  **Signal version:** 3.3.0 to 4.6.1 (all versions I ran so far)  ### Link to debug log  Not Applicable I guess, but if it is useful I'd like to read the preferred actions. When looking at the debug log the only relevant thing I see after step 4 is:  ``` W/PushServiceSocket(593825851): Push service URL: https://textsecure-service.whispersystems.org W/PushServiceSocket(593825851): Opening URL: https://textsecure-service.whispersystems.org/v1/directory/tokens W/Directory(593825851): Adding active token: +*********--, --------------, video: true ``` The dashes are the replacement of the last two digits and the secure string. So it does refresh but does not look at the my address book. There are no errors are shown either, so that made me think if it was just the absence of the functionality.

column3: 4.9.9 repeatedly crashing, cannot open signal
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After updating to Signal 4.9.9 I can not open signal anymore without crash. About 5 minutes before I updated to 4.9.9 I received a message from DHL (shipping company) without any issue opening signal and/or reading the message. After the update I could no longer open it. I have tried to manually delete these messages from the database but didn't find a tool to do so. The line number that keep showing up in cat-log, crash-log & stack trace is Line number 3140.  ### Steps to reproduce - Every time I open Signal.  **Actual result:** "Unfortunately, Signal has stopped" The solutions provide through email support didn't work either. (Airplane mode, clear cache etc.)  ### Screenshots   ### Device info  **Device:**Samsung Galaxy S5 Neo (SM-G903F) **Android version:** s5neollte: 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.9 (updated to 4.10.11 by now)  Phone is rooted  ### Link to debug log   [alogcat.2017-09-19-11-10-05+0200.txt](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/files/1321384/alogcat.2017-09-19-11-10-05.0200.txt)

column3: After update Signal does not display contacts names
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After updating from Signal 4.11.5 to 4.14.10, when opened, Signal did not displayed contact names in the messages view(nor in single message view). Instead it displays numbers and all in gray. Signal groups(and colors set in Signal) are kept with name.  ### Steps to reproduce - Update Signal - Open Signal - Wait for DB to be updated - Even after reboot or app restart messages are displayed with number instead of name  **Actual result:** Numbers are displayed instead of names **Expected result:** Names as in contact list shall be visible.  ### Workaround After clicking "new message"(round blue icon with pen) and waiting few minutes(it seems way too long for loading ~100 contacts), the contacts list gets populated(the view seems to get updated only when scrolling). I might have also "pulled down" the list, which seems to refresh it from contacts. Going back to messages view shows contacts properly.   ### Device info **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 14.4.10

They now have the default group avatar. This does not happen to all groups though. Although this is not a major issue to me I did create the attached logfile just after the upgrade. Hope this can help to get the upgrade as smooth as possible.   ### Steps to reproduce - unable to do so.   **Actual result:** After the upgrade two groups lost their avatar. **Expected result:** All groups should keep their avatar after the upgrade.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.0  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/2127738b954266ae83a67eb60fcb2dc8

column3: Constant pestering to make your profile name and photo visible to group
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After the recent update signal asks if I would like to "make my profile name and photo visible to this group" in group chat windows but there is no way to dismiss the message without actually sharing my details.  Tapping on the message brings up a prompt with two options: - CANCEL - MAKE VISIBLE  Tapping cancel does not make the prompt at the top of the chat go away and I do not wish to share my details in the chat.  ### Steps to reproduce - Update to the latest version of Signal - Open group chat, you should see a blue prompt at the top of the chat - Tap on the prompt - Tap on "CANCEL"  **Actual result:** The popup disappears but leaves the prompt at the top of the screen. **Expected result:** The prompt should be dismissed after tapping cancel.  ### Device info **Device:** Nexus 6 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.11

column3: Video thumbnail not shown after sending
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After sending a video, the thumbnail placeholder is shown with play overlay above. The actual thumbnail is shown not until going to the conversation list and also on reentering the conversation.  I already played with this. This issue is solved, as soon as I delete [this if-block](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/5ffee53faa17eaceefe51efaa6d4c87ab29bd357/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/components/ThumbnailView.java#L123). But that's not what was originally intended. This block exists for a reason, I assume. So it seems the thumbnail generation finishes at a time that the video message is still displayed in preflight mode and slides are not reloaded in preflight mode. However we could make it reload, if the slide changed.  ### Steps to reproduce - attach a video somehow (sharing from outside, forwarding inside etc.) - hit send - wait for end of upload  **Actual result:** thumbnail placeholder is shown with play overlay (suspicious, overlay should only appear with the thumbnail, not the placeholder). But: when you quit the conversation, the conversation list entry shows the correct thumbnail. On reentering the conversation the correct video thumbnail is shown. **Expected result:** thumbnail is shown  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20170909-005250](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16167751/30234005-d6a31e22-94f9-11e7-8fe7-9d01c2623e1d.png)  ### Device info 1 **Device:** Fairphone 2 **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.5  ### Device info 2 **Device:** AVD Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.6  ### Link to logcat output https://gist.github.com/FeuRenard/66a724963366f88249f5fec6ca1fbc28

column3: Animated gif freezes every 2nd time opening a conversation
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After sending a gif I noticed that on re-opening that conversation the gif freezes. After closing the conversation and opening again the gif animated properly. This seems to be repeatable, so every 2nd time I open the conversation the gif doesn't animate. As a test I've send a second gif, now that conversation has 2 gifs, gif A and gif B. Now the behavior seems even more strange. On opening the conversation gif A animates, gif B doesn't. After closing and re-opening the conversation now gif A doesn't animate and gif B does animate. After every close and open sequence the correct animation switches between A and B. This behavior seems to happen in both version 4.13 and 4.14. Unable to verify older versions.  edit: The behavior with 2 gifs only seem to happen for some time after sending the second gif. After not using the phone for a while I opened the conversation with the 2 gifs and now it behaves similar as the one gif description. So either both animate correctly or none does.   ### Steps to reproduce - Open a conversation with a gif (either a send gif or a received one) - close the conversation and re-open and check animation of gif - repeat close/open conversation and check animation of gif  **Actual result:** Animated gif doesn't actually animate every 2nd time on opening a conversation. **Expected result:** Gif should animate every time a conversation is opened.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung SM-G900F **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.14.2  ### Link to debug log  This debug log contains opening and closing a conversation with 2 gifs multiple times. https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d836c32fbdb2453395f2532fe4a12c2e

column3: Crash on linking desktop app
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After scanning the QR code of the desktop app, while the desktop app showed "syncing contacts", the android app crashed. it instantly crashes on every subsequent start. i fixed it by removing messages.db and importing an older plaintext backup.    ### Screenshots    ### Device info  Device  : samsung Galaxy Nexus (yakju) Android : 6.0.1 (cb9d8bbe53, lineage_maguro-userdebug 6.0.1 MOB31T cb9d8bbe53) Memory  : 32M (29.01% free, 256M max) Memclass: 96 OS Host : iktinos.acc.umu.se App : Signal 4.8.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/6fce071b4c870e6ed78d6b6bfcd95860 (the upper crashes are #6825, search for the first occurrence of `Non-successful response`, that's where this issue here starts

column3: Add an option to hide "A new version of Signal..."
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After recent problem with new version of Signal (#7171), I had to downgrade. Since then I had a permanent notification of pending update, which was quite inconvenient, as on locked screen it looks exactly the same as a new message. It would be great if there will be a way to disable update notification.  Regarding the self-updates notification I wonder about what has changed since #127, where @moxie0  commented that distributing apk only through Play:  > does not encourage the average user to tick "allow 3rd party APKs" in Android settings.  and now Signal updates requires exactly that?  ### Steps to reproduce - Install older version of Signal - View the update notification - Lock screen(with option to hide notification contents)

column3: "Say hello to secure video calls" notification after every update
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After every update there is a Android notification which says "Say hello to secure video calls" (exact text might differ, I translated the German text to English). I understand that this is a new feature which you want to promote, but this way it gets annoying. Seeing it once should be enough.  ### Steps to reproduce - install a version with that new feature and notification - swipe that notification away - wait for a new version and install it  **Actual result:** notification reappears  **Expected result:** no new notification  ### Device info **Device:** Nexus 5x **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** latest available on Play Store

column3: Fatal exception attaching / sending image.

column3: Can't switch to send unencrypted message
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description A contact that used to have Signal and no longer does will no longer let me switch from encrypted to unencrypted message  ### Steps to reproduce - Have a message open with a contact that used to have signal but no longer does - Hold down the send button to switch from encrypted message to unencrypted message  **Actual result:** It quickly selects the grey send button and switches back to the blue (encrypted) send button. **Expected result:** In the past it always just selected the grey send button and let me send the message unencrypted  ### Screenshots   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy Note 4 **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.3  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/a6e6e652217b3e306d9b26e3749b8e53  ### Additional Note This would ultimately be solved if there was a way to unlink a contact who had signal and was sync'd but no longer uses it. Currently when a user stops using signal, I can't tell unless I send a message and notice there is only 1 checkmark instead of 2. This has been a bug since I started using Signal years ago though.

column3: Can't send Signal messages in UAE. Receives them (very) late
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description A contact of mine who registered with Signal while in the US, cannot send Signal messages while in the UAE. Presumable domain fronting seems to work based on the registered number...  Dupe of #6037 and #5986 but they were closed without discussion. To the user, this looks like a bug.  **Expected Result**  1. Automatically detect if Signal is being censored and use domain fronting if option is available. 2. Throw an error, warning the user about censorship; if domain fronting is not possible/configured.

column3: Column 'verified' does not exist
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description A contact of mine unregistered recently.  I decided to check and see if Signal would now default to sending that contact SMS.  Upon opening the contact's conversation view, the application crashed.  While reproducing the issue to produce a log, it seems it has worsened, and now Signal crashes on launch, rendering it completely unusable.  I think this is caused by having an existing encrypted conversation with the contact.  Looking at the logs, it appears that the identity information is deleted after the user unregisters, but it still tries to access the identity information to decrypt the existing messages.  I haven't looked at the relevant code yet, so this is just a guess.  ### Steps to reproduce - contact unregisters from Signal - go to their conversation view - app crashes  **Actual result:** Signal crashes. **Expected result:** Signal should not crash.  ### Device info  **Device:** Huwai Nexus 6P **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** latest master  ### Link to debug log I can't open Signal to capture a log without it crashing, but here's a snippet from logcat: https://paste.ee/p/1iAC5

column3: Crash on startup after contact got a new key
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description A contact got a new phone. on the next message she sent me, i got that confirmation dialog where it says "or maybe they just reinstalled signal", where i confirmed. directly afterwards, signal crashed ("unfortunately, signal has stopped.") whenever i open signal, it instantly crashes again, although i can at least see the contact list behind the crash notification. a few seconds later after confirming the first crash, i get another, second "unfortunately, signal has stopped.".  apart from a fix, any help on what i can do to use signal again would be appreciated as well :)   ### Device info  **Device:** Galaxy Nexus **Android version:** 6.0.1 (Cyanogenmod 13) **Signal version:** i got the message and the first crashes with 4.6.1, then while troubleshooting, upgraded to 4.8.1 with the same result. the sender of the message installed signal from the app store three days ago, so should have 4.8.1  ### Link to debug log this is the logcat when i first got the message plus a few attempts to open the app [logcat_first.txt](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/files/1179218/logcat_first.txt)  possibly cleaner logcat of a single attempt to open the app [logcat_short.txt](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/files/1179210/logcat_short.txt)

column3: Auto-updating APK works only sporadically
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description * I have 4 phones where I notice that the update works only sporadically. * It seems that the update is enforced via wifi? * A similar already closed ticket: [Can't update Signal standalone APK #6740](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6740)   ### Steps to reproduce - Check [latest.json](https://updates.signal.org/android/latest.json) to be sure, that is a newer version available. - Wait for maximal 24 hours to be prompted for the update.  **Actual result:** On some phones the update is offered and sometimes not. **Expected result:**  * The update is always offered. * The ability to trigger the update (also via mobile data) manually.  ### Device info  **Device:** Fairphone 2 (FP2) **Android version:** 7.1.2 (LineageOS without any extensions) **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log * Acording to 9b8719e2d56a098502475bb5b2295c7a376d4caa, the auto-update is triggered every 6 hours. * How can I enforce the trigger, that I can provide a logcat?

column3: Feature request: Popup warning messages before unverified communication
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description "In July 2016, the Internet Society published a user study that assessed the ability of Signal users to detect and deter man-in-the-middle attacks. The study concluded that 21 out of 28 participants failed to correctly compare public key fingerprints in order to verify the identity of other Signal users, and that the majority of these users still believed they had succeeded while in reality they failed." - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signal_(software)#Usability  ### Steps to reproduce - Send a message - Make or receive a phone call  **Actual result:** No warning messages pop-up **Expected result:** I expect at least an option to make a warning popups before unverified communication is taking place. Another option is to place a extra icon grouped with the phone/lock icon.  ### Device info **Signal version: 4.7.4**
