Tapping on the icon usually has no visible effect, however it sometimes cause the dowload icon to disappear.  When it does appear to retry, the failure occurs again.    **Actual result:** "Error downloading MMS message, tap to retry" **Expected result:** MMS message is successfully downloaded.  ### Device info **Device:** Motorola Droid Mini **Android version:** 4.4.4 **Signal version:** 4.6.0

column3: Ability to choose preferred SIM for SMS on a per-contact basis (dual SIM)
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  When using a dual SIM Android phone, un-encrypted text messages (SMS) are sent from the primary SIM card even when all received text messages from this contact were received by the secondary SIM.  ### Steps to reproduce  SIM1 is the primary SIM with the data connection.  SIM2 is the secondary SIM without data connection. _In my case, Signal was registered using the number of SIM2. However, sending/receiving encrypted messages via SIM1 only works flawlessly, thanks!_  - open existing conversation of a contact which does not use Signal (yet)   - this contact does only know my SIM2 number and thus, the whole conversation so far was written to and sent by my SIM2 - send an un-encrypted text message without manually switching the send-button to SIM2; SIM1 is always selected and used by default  **Actual result:**   - the contact gets my message from my SIM1 phone number which she did not recognize - my text message gets misinterpreted as spam which results in a failed conversation  **Expected result:**   - my text message gets sent via SIM2 (as before) and my contact recognizes my number  IMHO, this can be accomplished in two ways:  1. Signal asks me once (per un-encrypted conversation) which SIM I want to use for this contact     - This can be modified in the conversation settings 2. Signal analyses the conversation so far and if (a) every or (b) the most recent ones or (c) the previous message was sent from SIM2, use SIM2 as long as I manually don't switch the SIM for this conversation.  I'd go with 2. (c) because it seems to be the most intuitive solution without additional UI elements for switching default SIM in the conversation settings.  ### Device info  **Device:** OnePlus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.9.9

column3: Ogg Vorbis files not selectable in "Attach audio"
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  When selecting audio files to send to a conversation partner, one cannot select ogg vorbis files. MP3s on the other hand work fine. It is possible to attach ogg vorbis files, via the regular file attach so it is not a huge issue. I expect, however, that usually there are also embedded media controls?  In any case, it might just be some hardcoded regex that just doesn't include `.ogg`? Because system-wide ogg is fully recognized as a valid audio format...   ### Steps to reproduce - press the attach button - select audio - look for a `.ogg` file, see it grayed out  **Actual result:** the file is grayed out **Expected result:** the file should not be grayed out and selectable  ### Screenshots  Not relevant I think.  ### Device info  **Device:** OnePlus One **Android version:** 6.0.1 (CM13.0) **Signal version:** 4.5.3  ### Link to debug log  Not relevant I think.

column3: Re-registering with a different number confuses other devices
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  When a device unregisters from Signal (without uninstalling) and then re-register with a different telephone number, contacts with previously active conversations see the new messages come from the old number. The messages do arrive, but the number is not recognized as a Signal user (the "Invite to Signal" banner appears).  ### Steps to reproduce - Register a device and start a conversation with a contact; - Unregister the device from the "advanced preferences" page (do not uninstall Signal); - Register again with a different phone number - Send a message in the conversation initiated with the previous number.  **Actual result:** The other user sees these messages coming from the old number. The "Invite to Signal" banner appears, and it is not possible to reply. **Expected result:** The messages are shown as coming from the new number, that correctly appears as a Signal user.  ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 6 **Android version:** 7.1.1 (stock) **Signal version:** 4.5.3 on both sides ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/fb0cdbc65da69369131d9c001119c61c

column3: Wrong message order after sync from Signal Deskto to Signal Android
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  The messages order is wrong after the synchronization finish in Signal Android from messages written in Signal Desktop. Similar to these issues:  - https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1043 - https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS/issues/1398  ### Steps to reproduce  - Disconnect Android (Signal Android) from Internet - Chat on Signal Desktop (it's needed send and receive messages) - Connect Android (Signal Android) to Internet - Let Signal Android synchronize the messages.  **Actual result:** After the messages synchronization, you'll see first all your messages and then all the other person messages. **Expected result:** The messages must be in the order they went sent and received.  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.9.9 **Signal Desktop:** 0.43.3 (`3a733ea`)

column3: "SomeUser updated the group" message still confusing
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  Sometimes in group conversations I get the message "SomeUser updated the group". This is quite confusing: what was actually done? My guess is that nothing is actually done, otherwise I'd see a more specific message, like: "group name changed", "new user added". The group settings has just been refreshed. I see two possibilities for improving this:  - Change the wording to something like: "SomeUser refreshed the group properties" - If nothing actually changed on the side of the user receiving the "group update", just suppress the message, otherwise specify what has been updated. Of course this would be the best option.   ### Device info  **Signal version:** 4.0.0

column3: App permanently stops sending & receiving messages or calls

No incoming messages are displayed.  ### Steps to reproduce - Install Noise app and register with a phone number - Link with the Desktop application - Use OpenVPN (perhaps irrelevant?) - Use Signal app as expected for days to weeks  **Actual result:** Outgoing text messages hang in non-sending state with three animated bouncy dots `...` indefinitely. Restarting phone, switching networks, nothing seems to help. The only thing I can do to fix the issue is to reinstall the app completely.  **Expected result:** App should function as normally.  ### Device info  **Device:** HTC Nexus 9 **Android version:** ASOP 7.1.1 **Signal version:** Noise 4.9.8-0  ### Link to debug log  https://gist.github.com/anonymous/51cd2d91e6864be3dcbea605c080f6fb  IIUC, the log seems to show the app is downloading new messages.

column3: Signal messages aren't received by SMS after switching phones but keeping number, and not in installing signal
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  Messages sent from signal don't come through to SMS on new phone without signal. The new phone shares the number of an old phone that had signal. My guess is that the number is still registered in the server since signal was never uninstalled from the old phone, so the server tries to route to the app for that number, even though the new phone doesn't have it. Installing signal on the new phone makes new messages come through without trouble.  ### Steps to reproduce - buy new phone with new sim card  - transfer number to new phone - don't uninstall signal from old phone - don't install signal on new phone  **Actual result:** new phone doesn't get messages sent from signal **Expected result:** new phone should get messages from signal in default SMS app  ### Device info  **Device:** iPhone 6s (new phone), Galaxy S6 (old phone)

column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  If I set notifications to hide message contents, then I can't even see message content in notifications when the screen is unlocked.   If I set to show message contents, I see the message contents also when the screen is locked.  **Feature request**: I'd like the possibility to have message contents in notifications if and only if the screen is unlocked.   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung S4 Active / GT-I9295 **Android version:** 5.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.12.3

column3: Signup Failure - prompt to update while Play Services are actually disabled
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  I was eager to try out the new non gcm functionality, got an android phone and promptly disabled the Google Play Apps (precise lising below). Trying to sign up for Signal resulted in a failure, as the App requires me for some reason to update the Play Services before continuing. This locks me out.  [I dont think this is wanted behavior. Looking into src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/RegistrationActivity.java, it looks like ConnectionResult.SERVICE_DISABLED is supposed to be treated as MISSING but that doesn't seem to work.]   ### Steps to reproduce - Disable all 3 Google Play "Core Apps" (listed below) - Open a freshly installed Signal - Type in Country and Phone Number and press Register  **Actual result:** A pop up appears: Update Google Play Services Signal won't run unless you update Google Play Services. This is impossible as they are intentionally disabled and unwanted as we want to use Websocket push.  **Expected result:**  The registration happens and Signal sets up so that gcmdisabled true is set. Signal can be used. (Treat this as if the Google Play service components were just MISSING)  ### Device info  **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.31.4 Stock Rom. Newly of the shelf bought phone. disabled apps: com.google.android.gms com.android.vending com.google.android.gsf  ### Debug log not available as signup is impossible.  A fix would be greatly appreaciated, as it would allow to quickly setup an android burner phone for Signal without much technical sophistication.

column3: Message received notification is a lie. No way for recipient to reset connection.
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  I sent an encrypted message. I see two ticks indicating that it has been delivered.  ![signal1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837136/26759167/7bc61dc6-48ee-11e7-81e0-297983511208.png)  The recipient received the error "Message encrypted for non-existing session" ![signal2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837136/26759169/7bca97a2-48ee-11e7-8084-95770d0b9b78.jpg)  The recipient couldn't send me a message saying there was an error, so tried resetting the secure connection.  That didn't work.  It turns out that the *Sender* has to reset the connection - but there's no indication in the UI that is what is needed.  ![signal3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837136/26759168/7bc7bee2-48ee-11e7-9220-cba97d21e542.jpg)   ### Steps to reproduce - Send message - Get notification of delivery - which is a lie - Spouse gets annoyed - Try to work out how Signal has broken itself - Go through menu options, get frustrated - Read online help, get more frustrated - Switch to Telegram which seems to work just fine  **Actual result:** Messages aren't delivered. Notification lies. No information for sender that there is a problem. **Expected result:** "Hey, looks like the message didn't go through. Click here to reset your connection!"  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 6 **Android version:** 7 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log

column3: Notifications aren't being marked read after viewing SMS
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  Ever since installing Signal and making it my default SMS application, when I receive a text message and open it in signal, the system notification does not see that the message is read. This results in the "new text" notification light remaining on. I've found a work around to clear the notification using the Lightflow widget (pictured below).  ### Steps to reproduce - Have Lightflow installed. - Receive text message. - Read the text message via Signal.  **Actual result:** Notification light comes on and vibration occurs signalling new text message has arrived. After reading, light continues blinking. **Expected result:** System UI should see that the text has been read, and notification light should stop blinking.  ### Screenshots ![2017-04-24 20 32 33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1421758/25357406/a9a5f034-290b-11e7-9b32-e4d4b6beb345.png) (this widget is from Lightflow, and shows that sms notification is still on - despite having no unread messages)  ### Device info **Device:** LG Nexus 4 **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.3.2  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4dafc89cd719d1a776dd172098043a94

column3: [Group contacts] When adding new contacts, only a part of the secured signal-enabled contacts is shown and selectable
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  **Actual result:** After having created a new group with three contacts, when adding further new contacts, only a fraction of signal-enabled contacts are shown and selectable  ### Steps to reproduce - Provisionally, I stopped and restarted Signal ; and - generated new index of contacts (Android Contact app) - the bug is still present  **Expected result:**  I expected the whole contact list of my Signal contacts.  I compared the list (while adding contacts to an existing group) with the list when using to send a Signal message. My observation is:  List (when adding contacts to a group):  * A * B * ... * Z  List (when sending to someone)  * A AnameWithA * B BnameWithB * ... (more entries) * Z (until here, same as above) * \# * (space) +telephonenumber * (space) +telephonenumber * 1 1and1 * A * B * .. * Z  The second part appears to be the correct full list of contacts.  ## Bug The selection - when selecting contacts to be added to a group - appears to show only the first part ("A"...."Z") of the list.  ## Screenshots  n/a  ### Device info  **Device:** Huawei P8 Lite **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log   n/a

column3: Feature: Auto-Expiring Groups
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ## Summary  In similar vein to the "disappearing message" setting in Signal for set deletion of messages after a given time, I request a "disappearing group" setting. Such a setting would cause all members to leave a group a set period of time after the group's creation or after the most recent message and remove the group. This has at least one potential advantage / use case:  _Automated reduction of attack-surface for recovery of communications metadata_. Even if the auto-expiring messages feature is enabled, the discussion group's existence potentially remains on devices of involved parties. Compromise of any device involved in the conversation could reveal at least the contact information for people involved in the group, even if no actual communication information is risked.  ## Relevant Issues / Feature Requests Previously Opened  I did search the issues to try and ensure similar requests were not already considered. I did find a couple items, that are related but not the same:  * #1764 "Enable sender to delete own messages from all parties in the conversation". I agree that this was rightfully declined for the reasons mentioned in the thread. My feature request is not to create a single-user ability to remove a group from many devices, but to enable an feature analogous to "disappearing messages" that the entire group would see and be able to re-negotiate.  * #2412 'Is there a way to create an "incognito thread"?' This discusses automated log-cleaning of individual conversations. It was declined according to discussion #1764 regarding deletion of messages from remote parties. I would argue my feature request is more akin to the "disappearing messages" feature, but extended to groups to further protect group membership from after-the-fact discovery by 3rd parties.

column3: [Feature] Introduce "important messages" for better innovative async communication
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  # Motivation When people communicate face-to-face they use many concepts without noting it. Due to technologic development in the last decades it got possible to communicate *wherever* the communication partners are and do it *whenever* they want to communicate asynchronously (in some forms this concepts were already present in the past by e.g. writing a letter). But in the digital age this whereever, whenever communication is heavily used and thus is optimized by integrating components that are natural in a face-to-face communication (which is due to evoluation development of humans the natural way ).   **One such very important integration were smilies/emoticons** which integrate the communication of mood/sentiment/feeling on the level of text based communication. Look how heavily these are used today! How many emoticons/smilies *did you* use the last 3 days, hmm? That was innovation for text based messaging and they got *indispensable for today text communication*. **Now are you ready for the next innovation??** (I hope you can't wait for it *drum roll please*):   *Important messages.* I know, I know at the first view this look really boring, but just think about it. When we talk face-to-face we can communicate emotions. By async text messaging we integrated that by introducing emotions/smilies. When we talk face-to-face we can just switch and talk in the present moment about, what is most important to us. By **async messaging we can not do that .... yet**. The "problem" with async messaging is, that we always have a form of mailbox where many messages await us. But what if we don't have time to see all messages? We just want to read the most important messages, but what is important, we can only determine after reading. The contact partner himself has no way to show, that one message is really important (in the face-to-face communication he could just simply speak about the important thing, **but in async communication this competes with his earlier communication**).  So, just one **question for you**: Did you ever have the problem, that someone had open messages from you and you couldn't communicate important messages (and calling would be inappropriate)?   One of many examples would be, that you want to remind someone of a credit transfer which should be done on the next day (or a meeting, or [...]). You don't want to interrupt your communication partner by calling him (busy person) and just want that when he looks the next time on the phone (in some short free period) he sees and looks at the important message (wihout needing to read and answer to an discussion about another topic you had earlier).  I belief that this feature would have quite an impact, especially for persons who don't always read all messages right away. A question about a cinema visit today eventing would be read in time. Important messages:  Like emoticons **at first inconspicuous but later indispensable**.  What do you think? :)  # Realisation example On the sender: Equip the context menu of the "send button" with a third element (additionally to unsecure sms and signal), called e.g. "Signal - urgent" or something. After writing and sending such a message, signal would switch automatically back in the normal mode.  On the reciever: He gets the special message with a special notification (e.g. the notification get's a slightly red color and the important messages get a red icon) .  What do you think? :)

column3: Messages w/attachment sent on desktop disappear from mobile
column4: I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  - Issue copied over from [Closed Desktop issue 1424](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1424) as requested by @scottnonnenberg  ### Bug description  Under the following conditions, messages disappear in an untimely fashion from Signal Android:  1. The message is sent from Signal Desktop (Electron); and 2. The message has an attachment or is a voice message; and 3. The message is sent in a conversation that has the "Disappearing Messages" feature turned on  ### Steps to reproduce - Have Signal Android and Signal Desktop (Electron) linked - Enter a conversation on Signal Desktop - Turn on "Disappearing Messages" if not already on (set the time to 1 day) - Send a message with an attachment - or - send a voice message - Wait for the message to be sent successfully, reach the recipient successfully (two "tick marks") - Watch the same conversation on Signal Android  **Actual result:**  - The messages are synchronised to Signal Android - After around 1-2 minutes, the messages with the attachments disappear from Signal Android  - Unreproducible: Sometimes the message doesn't show up at all on Signal Android. This happened to me yesterday pretty consistently with voice messages but I can't reproduce that today. I suspect that they might show up and disappear too fast for me to see. Today they behave like other messages with attachments.  (the messages do not disappear from Signal Desktop nor do they disappear from the recipient's device)  **Expected result:**  - The messages are synchronised to Signal Android and stay there for the duration specified in the "Disappearing messages" menu - The messages disappear simultaneously from both Signal Desktop and Signal Android when the period specified for "Disappearing messages" has elapsed.  ### Screenshots  Desktop: ![signal-desktop-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1229613/29997387-eaba116e-9011-11e7-9059-c7906d3baf0a.png) ![signal-desktop-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1229613/29997388-eef386d4-9011-11e7-8ea2-bf2e8a802c28.png)   Mobile: ![signal-android-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1229613/29997368-8ab10520-9011-11e7-9a46-58f2e039c86d.png) ![signal-android-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1229613/29997370-8fd6efe2-9011-11e7-944f-ca593560d310.png)  ### Platform info  **Operating System**: Ubuntu GNU/Linux 16.04.3 LTS (xaniel) x86_64 **Browser**: N/A (Electron) **Signal version:** signal-desktop 1.0.22       amd64  **Operating System**: Android 7.1.2, LineageOS version 14.1-20170824-NIGHTLY-oneplus2 **Device**: Oneplus 2 **Signal version:** Signal 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log  [Signal Desktop](https://gist.github.com/80b6257811b7775b8e04c00ebe9fce1b) [Signal Android](https://gist.github.com/e5caede11b46aebe281adfa98e2316d8)

column3: Support drag-dismiss gesture in media preview
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ### Feature Request Add support for a drag-dismiss gesture in `MediaPreviewActivity`, which will close the activity. This would allow swiping up or down instead of using a back button (in navigation or action bar) for closing the activity. You can see this feature in action with the official Twitter app when you view an image in fullscreen. (EDIT 2017-10-04: WhatsApp's media preview also supports this in the most recent stable Android release)  I see the following advantages in this feature:  - If we decide to hide action bar and navigation bar in the future (#5934), this feature will allow the user to go back without bringing the bars onscreen before. - When using a touch screen, the middle of the screen should be the easiest accessible region for touch actions. With this feature we don't have to move our finger to the corner of the display to leave the activity.  This feature was first proposed in a [community forum thread](https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/support-android-drag-dismiss-activity/896).  This [extended FrameLayout](https://github.com/nickbutcher/plaid/blob/master/app/src/main/java/io/plaidapp/ui/widget/ElasticDragDismissFrameLayout.java) could be useful for implementing this feature.

column3: Bad encrypted message from myself??
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ### Bug description 30 minutes ago I got a message from my own phone number with "Fehlerhaft verschl√ºsselte Nachricht" - German for "Bad encrypted message". Before you now tell me that there are plenty of closed bugs for that: #509, #622, #2600, [#4844](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/4844),etc. But they do not address that problem: I did *not* send a message to myself. I didn't do anything. My phone rang twice within a minute, and there were two messages via Signal, sent from my own phone number. Sent on "2.Nov.2017.18:49:52 MEZ", received on "2.Nov.2017.18:49:57 MEZ"  ### Steps to reproduce not possible to reproduce.  **Actual result:** Got a badly encrypted message from myself **Expected result:** I don't expect getting messages from myself if I don't send them.  ### Screenshots Not possible in Android 6.0.1/Signal.  ### Device info  **Device:** Using a Fairphone 2,  without Google Apps. **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.5  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/5768f7be094d09d423c362c2e86bf54b  (I then sent a message to myself and deleted them afterwords, before creating this bug report.)

column3: Attached image from camera leaves plaintext copy
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ### Bug description  When attaching an image directly from the camera, a plaintext copy of the image is saved to the folder `/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/org.thoughcrime.securesms/files`  ### Steps to reproduce  - Go into any Signal conversation - Leave the message empty - Press the blue paperclip button (this does not happen when you press the quick camera button) - Press the green "Camera" button - Take a picture - Press the tick or similar button in the camera app to accept the picture - No need to continue editing, captioning or sending the image, the file has already been created and is never removed. Even deleting the draft doesn't delete the file.  **Actual result:**  - A file with a `jpg` extension is created in the folder `/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/org.thoughcrime.securesms/files` - the file name is made of the digits of what appears to be `ctime` of the time the file was created. - The file persists throughout the life of the app and never deleted, even when the image in the conversation is deleted or the entire conversation is deleted. - Clearing Signal's storage from the app info applet does delete all files in that folder.  **Expected result:**  - Ideally, No plaintext image file would be created anywhere within the phone's file system - Alternatively, the file will be deleted as soon as practicable after it has been encrypted and stored in Signal's database  ### Device info **Device:** Tested on OnePlus 2 and Samsung Galaxy S7 **Android version:** Tested under OxygenOS Stock 3.6.0 for Oneplus 2 and Cyanogen 14.1 NIGHTLY for S7 **Signal version:** 4.9.9 and, based on the pictures left on my device, multiple previous versions

column3: New message notification won't go away
column4: I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports   I received a message today, and after reading it the "new message" notification stays there, even if I close and re-open Signal. It remains there even when I FC Signal and reopen it. It could be a duplicate of https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6270 but I'm unsure since I did nothing with the SMS database.  ![signal-unread_message](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8427572/24367653/b9af5c30-131d-11e7-9974-2aac6695f8fd.jpg)  Looking at the picture I see that the date is also off by one day in the future. The system date is correct.  ### Device info  **Device:** Sony Z3 Compact **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log   https://gist.github.com/anonymous/0e1901bf5af253c3d7d4909844fa062d

column3: send and receive contacts (vCard) properly
column4: I have: - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates  ----------------------------------------  Hi :smile:   This is a fresh feature request for #535 and #1407.  |Signal|Android Message|Android Message detailed| |-----|--------|--------| |![screenshot_20170411-143016](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4070933/24909498/69b92262-1ec4-11e7-8b42-9f66ac8ea3bd.png)|![screenshot_20170411-142238](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4070933/24909503/73a02884-1ec4-11e7-9a21-a67a8a5363bb.png)|![screenshot_20170411-142251](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4070933/24909799/c4c50eb8-1ec5-11e7-88b9-31c361565416.png)|  Sharing contacts with Signal will extract only phone number and not any other information such as emails, dates, or contact picture. Worse, it won't do anything if a contact does not contain any phone numbers.  **Can you add the ability to share contacts in vCard format with an easy way to import/export them from Signal app?**  A good example of how it could work is Android Message (see screenshots).  Things worth mentioning:  - Looking at privacy, it would be really nice to be able to share sensitive contacts this way with all metadata included. - vCard format is not something easy: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6350 - Some implementations exist: https://github.com/mangstadt/ez-vcard - Most SMS/MMS applications support this: Signal is late. - Opening a text editor and copying or making your own `vcf` file is not a solution. - This has been requested many times: #535, #1407, #922, #2504, #3808, #4205, #5075, #5612, #499, #2306...

column3: Constant prompt to "Invite to Signal" on each new message from a contact
column4: I have: - [X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  A new text message sent from Amazon creates a prompt "Invite to Signal".  I click the X to close the notification.  The next new text message from Amazon again prompts me to "Invite to Signal". Again I close the prompt.  This happens with every new message I get from Amazon.  ### Steps to reproduce - Get a new text message from Amazon (though I don't know what would be special about them, just the only instance I've seen) - You get a prompt "Invite to Signal"  - Close that prompt  **Actual result:**   - Next message from that contact (here, Amazon) generates yet another "Invite to Signal" prompt.  **Expected result:**    Should never see that "Invite" prompt for a contact after I've declined it.  ### Screenshots None.  ### Device info  **Device:** LG Stylo LG-H631 **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.11

column3: Voice calls do not ring
column4: I have: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Place a voice call from another device. Rings for a long time, but no notification appears until after the ringing stops. Then you get a missed call notification. This may be the same root cause as a similar bug on the iOS side: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS/issues/1628   ### Steps to reproduce the issue - send a voice call from another device.  **Actual result:** Nothing happens until the ringing stops. Then you get a missed call notification. **Expected result:** notification of in-comming call and ringing.  ### Screenshots  **Device:** Manufacturer Model XVI Samsung SN-M950U **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.3  ### Link to debug log   I suspect this may be at least partially a server side problem because the same thing happens on Android. column3: Opening conversation with new messages does not scroll to new messages.
column4: I have: - [X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Before the latest update (4.11.2), when new messages were available in a conversation, and the user opened the conversation, it would auto-scroll to the new messages.  - upgrade to version between 4.9.1 and 4.9.4 and start Signal  ### Device info  **Device:** OnePlus 2 **Android version:** 7.1.2 (LineageOS) **Signal version:** 4.9.4  ### Link to debug log

column3: Loads of issues with new update - not sending messages, not clearing unread notification, and more
column4: I have: - [X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description After updating signal on android, my messages will not mark as read... i can type a whole new message and hit send, yet it does not show up in the chat.   ### Steps to reproduce -updated to recent version -receive new text -type entire response out to a person -open message to read it, yet it does not mark it as read   **Actual result:** it does not mark message as read, type and sent message does not deliver, nor does it show up in the chat conversation, any new message received cannot mark as read, notifications that new message still showing  **Expected result: mark messages as read, send messages when i send them and show up in the conversation, notification clear that have unread message when openening the message   ### Screenshots    ### Device info Device  : samsung SM-G935T (hero2qltetmo) (S7 Edge T-mobile) Android : 7.0 (G935TUVU4BQH7, NRD90M.G935TUVU4BQH7) Memory  : 59M (21.74% free, 512M max) Memclass: 256 OS Host : SWDG2905 App     : Signal 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/90580ab46b1edf632654c1c321c7bf9c

column3: Startup crash under 4.9.0 beta with email-to-SMS gateway message
column4: I have: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  The newest beta is crashing immediately on startup. Based on the stack trace, it appears that it's due to some messages I have from NASA's [Spot the Station][] service, which creates messages with the sender set to an email address. column3: Incoming call drops playing media to speaker
column4: I have: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When i listen to Musik via Bluetooth headset when a call comes in via Signal the Audio stream is offloaded to the speakers. Not that awesome when you sit in public transport and suddenly your music drops to the phone speakers at max volume.  ### Steps to reproduce - Play music on bluetooth headset - Receive a call  **Actual result:** Music is offloaded to speakers **Expected result:** Music should pause as it does on phone or hangout calls (for those two i know that it works correctly)  ### Device info **Device:** OnePlus 3T **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.2.5 **Headphones** Parrot Zik **Music player** Poweramp  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/88ba0c6e3490d603f6638846c7e4272f

column3: Signal user marked as non-signal user in conversation for 10-15 seconds
column4: I have: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Once in awhile, I am in a conversation with a signal user and for about 10-15 seconds, the blue circle with airplane changes to gray and the text changes to "send unsecure sms message".  I don't really have particular steps to repro this with, but it _seems_ to happen if I'm chatting with a signal user and during that, another contact I've invited to use signal installs it and messages me.  ### Steps to reproduce see above  **Actual result:** Signal contacts appearing as non-signal contacts sometimes in-conversation with them **Expected result:** Signal contacts always show as signal contacts in-conversation unless they've uninstalled the app, etc.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S8 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log

column3: New message notifications are not triggering when signal is in the background
column4: I have: - [X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description On the latest build 4.8.1 notification of new messages arent triggering until i open the app by clicking on it manually (or otherwise bring it to the foreground).  This seems to be an intermittent problem. This is a regression from 4.7.4 where it was working fine.   ### Steps to reproduce 1) Open the app 2) Put it into to background, let the phone go to sleep or bring another app into the foreground  **Actual result:** New Message notification are often not triggered till I bring Signal to the foreground. **Expected result:** New message notification should occur even when in the background.  ### Device info  Device  : OnePlus ONEPLUS A3000 (OnePlus3) Android : 6.0.1 (118, ONEPLUS A3000_28_161213) Signal Version: 4.8.1  ### Link to debug log Debug log captures this. I bring Signal to the foreground at 11:53, hence all the activity.   ``` Device  : OnePlus ONEPLUS A3000 (OnePlus3) Android : 6.0.1 (118, ONEPLUS A3000_28_161213) Memory  : 55M (6.54% free, 512M max) delivery_receipt_count, mismatched_identities, network_failures, subscription_id, expires_in, expire_started, notified, transport_type, attachment_id, unique_id, mid, data_size, file_name, _data, thumbnail, ct, cl, digest, fast_preflight_id, voice_note, cd, name, pending_push FROM (SELECT DISTINCT date_sent AS date_sent, date AS date_received, _id, 'SMS::' || _id || '::' || date_sent AS unique_row_id, NULL AS attachment_id, body, read, thread_id, type, address, address_device_id, subject, NULL AS m_type, NULL AS msg_box, status, NULL AS part_count, NULL AS ct_l, NULL AS tr_id, NULL AS m_size, NULL AS exp, NULL AS st, delivery_receipt_count, mismatched_identities, subscription_id, expires_in, expire_started, notified, NULL AS network_failures, 'sms' AS transport_type, NULL AS unique_id, NULL AS mid, NULL AS data_size, NULL AS file_name, NULL AS _data, NULL AS thumbnail, NULL AS ct, NULL AS cl, NULL AS digest, NULL AS fast_preflight_id, NULL AS voice_note, NULL AS cd, NULL AS name, NULL AS pending_push FROM sms WHERE (thread_id = 50) UNION ALL SELECT DISTINCT date AS date_sent, date_received AS date_received, mms._id AS _id, 'MMS::' || mms._id || '::' || date AS unique_row_id, part._id AS attachment_id, body, read, thread_id, NULL AS type, address, address_device_id, NULL AS subject, m_type, msg_box, NULL AS status, part_count, ct_l, tr_id, m_size, exp, st, ct, cl, digest, fast_preflight_id, voice_note, cd, name, pending_push FROM mms LEFT OUTER JOIN part ON part._id =  (SELECT part._id FROM part WHERE part.mid = mms._id LIMIT 1) WHERE (thread_id = 50) column3: Signal sounds and codecs
column4: I have: - [X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Actually this is not a bug, just proposal for UX improvement.  Current sounds (sonar sound and ping when call is established/terminated) are by my opinion too aggressive. They contain too much high tones.  My proposal is, to use more soft sounds.  My proposal is also to replace sonar sound with something more similar to ringing... for instance instead of sonar there should be "slow" ringing and when ringing starts, there should be regular ringing (as it is now).  Another proposal is also to measure bandwidth and quality of call. When quality of call starts to get to low, user should get a very soft beep-beep-beep sound, so he/she is alerted there are problems with bandwidth. This should also be visible on the screen.  If connection drops (because of bad connection), it should be re-establisher automatically - user should be alerted of this re-establishing by sound and by screen text.  Anyway, I am also noticing some problems with bandwidth consumption. Are there any plans that when bad network conditions occur, codec automatically "switches" to lower quality? I am not talking about VBR codecs, just that maybe there should be two codecs used - one for normal bandwidth and another when bandwidth is lower.

column3: Setting disappearing messages in a group also removes entire group after messages expire
column4: I have: - [ x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description - [Caveat] Please note, I'm not entirely sure this _is_ a bug, as I could see the utility of this behavior, depending on the use-case.  - When I'm in a group conversation with (in this case) two other users, and I've set the disappearing messages timer to 1 day, if that amount of time passes and no one has sent any messages to the group, not only will the messages disappear (as expected), but the entire group will disappear, no longer showing in the contacts list.  ### Steps to reproduce - Create a messaging group with two other Signal users  - Set disappearing messages timer to _1 day_  - Exchange messages as expected  - Note that your group appears in your contacts list  - Allow all messages to expire, with no messages being sent or received by the group for the duration of the disappearing messages timer  - Note that the created group has disappeared  **Actual result:** Note that the created group has disappeared  **Expected result:** Noting my caveat above, the _expected_ result would normally be that the created group does not disappear without the user manually deleting it.  ### Work-arounds  The following work-arounds were found to negate this behavior (assuming you don't want to disable the _disappearing messages_ functionality):  - When first creating the group, prior to setting the _disappearing messages_ timer, send one message to the group, serving to anchor the group in your contacts list.  Once that message has been sent, set the _disappearing messages_ timer, which will automatically delete subsequent messages (excluding the _anchor_).  It is unknown if this will serve to anchor the group with recipients, especially if they manually delete the _anchor_.  - Assuming you're using the desktop client, where the group will not disappear once the timer has expired (but messages will), send a message to the group.  This will serve to recreate the group on the mobile app.  The group will disappear on the mobile app should the timer expire again.  ### App State - Signal messages and calls registered  - SMS/MMS Enabled  - Notifications on  - Passphrase on, Screen security on  - Theme Dark, Language Default  - Message trimming off  - 3rd party app info unknown, other than being Signal registered  ### Device info  **Device:** Huawei Nexus 6P **Android version:** 7.1.2, build N2G47H **Signal version:** 4.4.0 _beta_  ### Link to debug log Bug(?) was not noticed in a timely fashion, so no debug log was generated.

column3: No sound after some time and not possible to establish calls
column4: I have: - [ X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ X] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ### Bug description In some cases I can hear the other party, but he cannot hear me (the other party can hear just some gibberish). This happens when I am on 4G network and driving with a car. I have full 4G signal, at the beginning Signal calls are just fine, but after some time communication is not possible. I live in Europe, Slovenia.  Anyway, right now, I have serious problems establishing Signal calls at all. Calls do not establish at all, but eve if they do, I or other party can hear just gibberish (but the person who does not hear gibberish, can hear the other person just fine).  I am also using Biocoded app, which is using Signal protocol, and it is working without any problems. So I assume it is not mobile network problem...  Anyway, I remember there were some problems with Signal servers a few months ago, and after Moxie resolved them, Signal calls started working. Maybe there is similar problem?  ### Steps to reproduce - start Signal call - after some time connection is not possible anymore or right now: - start Signal call - just pulse sound is heard  **Actual result:** The other party cannot hear me or the call is not established at all. **Expected result:** Call should work.  ### Device info **Device:** LG Nexus 5 **Android version:** CM13 **Signal version:** 4.3.2  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/f793698a73ccc839818fffd1b42bc97b

Unsure if that has started just suddenly or after a recent update from Play store.  ### Steps to reproduce - starting Signal app via icon **Actual result:** popup appears stating that app has been closed ("Signal wird wiederholt beendet" on second try) **Expected result:** App starts correctly to e.g. show contact list.  ### Screenshots ![screencap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/951607/30249440-0393e12a-963d-11e7-8adf-5c62da132bd3.png)  ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S6 (SM-G920F) **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  Device is not rooted; I'd be very interested in a way to fix the problem without data loss, but any hint on how to get it running at all again is highly appreciated as well!  ### Link to debug log [adb_logcat_signal_4.9.9_crash.txt](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/files/1290553/adb_logcat_signal_4.9.9_crash.txt)

column3: Friend doesn't receive messages after deleting Signal
column4: I have: - [ X ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ X ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When a friend who has Signal uninstalls the app, but does not delete their account, and I continue to send them messages through Signal, they will not receive the messages. This has now happened with multiple friends of mine. The fix is to have them reinstall the app, delete their account, then uninstall again. But it causes great confusion and it is particularly challenging for people who aren't tech-savvy. It seems there should be a way for Signal to send to a user's default messaging app in the case that they don't have Signal installed on their phone.

column3: Verification over SMS or Call
column4: I have: - [ ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description When I try to register a new second smartphone device for the signal messenger, the first device will be deleted.  ### Steps to reproduce - install on a smartphone device with number verification - Install on another second smartphone  **Actual result:** the first device will be kicked off without any information for the user **Expected result:** the user of the first device should get an acknowledge that a second device is logged in. Actually it is not a bug, but for me it is not enough, Signal Protocol is probably the best end to end encryption, but who cares about it, if someone could log in as a second device or else. There should be a better logging situation. I would suggest a small thing, that would change a lot. The security code, which is send over SMS or Call should be just shown in the App. If Alice adds her second smartphone, the verification number should be send inside the signal app. That could give the user a better feeling of authentication and prevents also eavesdropper (like ss7 hacks etc.). But if we wanna go further, signal developer should implement two-step verification. Thank you!  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** ZTE Blade v8 and Wiko Robby **Android version:** 7.0 and 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log

column3: Plaintexts backup and group chats
column4: I have seen various groups chat bugs here, but this one I couldn't find so far:  After exporting all messages and then importing them on a new device, messages from group charts appear under the account who sent them instead of in the group.  Without the context of the conversation many such messages however are completely useless and, worse, even mess up the chats with the individual contracts.  Is there some way to preserve group chats when moving device? If not this seems to be a serious bug that drastically limits the usefulness of group chats.

column3: Upgrade path from custom build to offical Signal apk
column4: I have been using custom builds of Signal apk on my Google-less Android (so I could not use Google Play). I want to switch to [official build](https://signal.org/android/apk/) but it simply upgrading does not work:  ``` $ adb install -r Signal-website-release-4.1.0.apk  [100%] /data/local/tmp/Signal-website-release-4.1.0.apk 	pkg: /data/local/tmp/Signal-website-release-4.1.0.apk Failure [INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_INCONSISTENT_CERTIFICATES] ```  It would be great if there would be an easy way to upgrade, or at least a documented way to do it.

column3: [Feature Request] Signed Encrypted Backup Signal Apk
column4: I have an idea to overcome the lack of the encrypted backup functionality.  Problem: The problem with encrypted backups is that you can only do them if you compile your own instance of signal (which can not be installed over an existing installation and can not be easily updated). An encrypted backup of an existing official signal installation is not possible. (but necessary) The titanium backup way requires rooted phones, which is not feasable every time. Since this issue has been open for years now, without a (usable) sollution, i propose a simple workaround that does not cost many ressources.  Suggested Feature: The signal developers that hold the key used to sign the official apks could provide a version where encryted backups are enabled. This version could be installed over the existing signal installation on non rooted phones and would finally enable users to migrate signal to a new phone. (without root obviously)  Expected outcome: No more whining about missing functionality. Development of a "clean" sollution can go on without stress.  Footnote: Maybe hide the apk download a bit and mark ist as unstable so people wont complain if it does not work in their case.

column3: 2 sim cards...
column4: I have 2 SIM cards, which means I have 2 phone numbers. I live between Australia and the US... and my contacts each use my respective national phone number.  So, what do I do? I feel like I should have 2 signal accounts; one for each number, and I should be able to 'sign in' with both of my numbers at the same time. If a contract recognises both of my signal accounts, long-press on the send button should allow me to choose which one to send messages with, the same as selecting which sim to send normal sms when there are 2 SIM cards.  Right now, signal is still only using my Australian number, even though I live in the us, and my us contacts can't easily use signal with me.

column3: "Don't submit WIP PRs" is a bad contributor experience
column4: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submit-only-complete-prs-and-test-them states that folks shouldn't submit work-in-progress PRs. That seems like a very bad idea to me. WIP PRs are very useful for answering questions like:  * Am I heading down the right direction with respect to this code's design? * I implemented part of this change, if I finish the rest would it be accepted? * I'm stuck with such-and-such an error, how can I solve it? * I've made a change on this line but I'm not 100% sure it's correct, can someone confirm?  All of these questions have to go _somewhere_. It might as well be somewhere where it's easiest to answer - in a Pull Request where you have the full diff available to contextualize all discussion.  Does this requirement exist because people would submit incomplete PRs that made tests fail, etc.? In that case, I propose the text be amended to say something like "if submitting a Pull Request that's not ready for merging, prefix its title with `[WIP]`."

column3: Feature Request: Storage location
column4: Hi,  Looking at the guidelines, I wasn't able to find how to request features and there are other ones here, so...  # Problem  Devices with small storage and external SD cards have no possibility of using the external SD unless the phone is rooted (sometimes not even then).  # Solution  Add option for user to select where the messages, etc. will be stored. Especially with the possibility to send media, this will come in handy to offload the main storage.  As an added bonus, this is a feature WhatsApp doesn't have and seems to be reluctant to implement so that would be something they don't have.

column3: Aesthetic and UX improvements on first run (pre-filled phone number; registering aborts on bad connection)
column4: Hey,  I assume that this part of the app (first run) receives the least testing, as the user is only exposed to it for a short time.  After getting several friends to try Signal, I have went through the registering process several times, and I noticed two UX annoyances:  - On first run, the phone number is pre-filled with a weird, invalid phone number (something like +49 176 0000 0000). It doesn't look good and confuses the user. If this is supposed to help the user understand what should be put into the field, please use `android:hint` instead.  - If during registration internet connection is lost, even if only for a few seconds, registration is aborted (understandably), but the app prompts you to start again by editing your phone number. There is no need to adjust the phone number, as at this step the phone number has already been confirmed, the confirmation code was received, the only thing that's missing now is to register online. A simple "retry" button would be nice, as there is no reason to re-confirm the phone number by re-receiving the confirmation code.  Thank you for your time.

column3: Verizon is using an illegal MCC for tests in the APN list
column4: For some reason, someone (Verizon?) has decided to use the MCC for [Lithuania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_country_code#Lithuania_-_LT) for its test APN list as found in both lists under `apnlists`, such as in [cyanogenmod.xml](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/apntool/apnlists/cyanogenmod.xml#L376-L383). The available [MCC's for the US](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_country_code#United_States_of_America_-_US) are: between `310-316`.  In addition the MNC's  `81` and `081` are non-existent, and must have been invented.   Please remove these lines.

column3: CreateProfileActivity uses DynamicTheme
column4: Fixes #6981  // FREEBIE   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Motorola Moto G, Android 4.4.4  * Motorola Droid Turbo, Android 6.0.1  * Virtual device Nexus 5, API 25  * Virtual device Nexus 4, API 19 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  The CreateProfileActivity now uses a DynamicTheme to respect the user's light / dark theme choice. I modeled the behavior on the ApplicationPreferencesActivity behavior, but did not add a SharedPreferencesListener implementation as it was not obvious whether or where the CreateProfileActivity should subscribe to SharedPreferences changes.  Verified that after changing the theme setting, the profile info screen reflects the theme selected: 1. Tap hamburger button 2. Tap Settings 3. Tap Appearance 4. Tap Theme 5. Select Dark 6. Tap Back 7. Tap my profile name 8. Verify that the profile info screen is using the dark theme 9. Tap Back 10. Tap Appearance 11. Tap Theme 12. Tap Light 13. Tap Back 14. Tap my profile name 15. Verify that the profile info screen is using the light theme

column3: Keep screen on when viewing a video
column4: Fixes #6642  // FREEBIE   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Virtual device: Nexus 6, Android 6.0 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description   This change ensures that the screen remains on when a video is playing on devices running SDK >= 16. The screen will also turn off after after the normal sleep time if the video has been paused.   **Testing**  Test setup: Sent myself a 40 second long video, and set the screen timeout to 15 seconds.  1. Start video from message list, and entire video plays without the screen shutting off. 15 seconds after the video completes, the screen shuts off. 2. Pause video and screen shuts off after 15 seconds.  3. Pause video and seek, then screen shuts off after 15 seconds.   I'd also like some feedback on a couple things: 1. The cast [on this line](https://github.com/raffthesweetling13/Signal-Android/commit/7294b5ec528e767bba22c4a3c332cb0bedb9cd6e#diff-3b227dc2e0ee4d3f8a6a8a4702a1c3d3R118) 2. Having a class that implements an interface, but leaves most of the methods blank

column3: Play services issue
column4: First of all, I've never come across another app that won't allow the user to bypass the "update play services" popup by clicking outside the popup, and then work as normal, if indeed the app doesn't REQUIRE play services (but still attempts to use it for something). Signal registration fails completely if play services isn't the latest possible version, even if the user has it disabled. You should allow the user to click outside that popup and proceed without updating/using play services if in fact Signal works without it. That's what most apps do if they don't require play services.  Second, your comment about Signal being designed to work if play services isn't installed on the device at all is completely facetious. ALL android devices have this installed. The only way to get it completely deleted is to root the device, which thanks to google, can only be done by using third-party apps like Kingroot which is made by unknown people in China and introduces a huge security risk. Therefore, it's only feasible to DISABLE play services, google services framework, the play store, and google account manager.  Third, you ask what is the benefit of making play services disabled "if it is some kind of malware." Well, (1) play services constantly phones home to a google domain at 1e100.net. It has complete permissions to your device and, knowing how google is, most likely uploads the user's contacts and files, and may even record audio and video without the user knowing. The mere fact that it has permission to do all of that is a security risk in itself (and opens a backdoor for the government to collude with google to develop spy tools for Android phones). (2) Play services is constantly updating, which I have found can cause major incompatibility issues and brick phones, since google doesn't test the update on every phone in use in the marketplace. Google forces the updates on users, which is unethical and unnecessary if the old version is working.  So, hopefully you can see why play services is a major problem. Basically, google treats peoples' phones as if it belonged to google, controlling what can run on the device, forcing updates, accessing god knows what, and constantly phoning home, as any user with a firewall app can see. They act as if they are only "licensing" the phone to the user, rather than the user actually owning the phone and controlling it. Honestly, I would think any developer working on a privacy/security product like Signal would have grasped this already.  With regards to publishing annoucements, see:  https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=13691050 https://www.reddit.com/r/Android/comments/5v9evr/signal_can_now_be_used_without_google_play/ http://forums.crackberry.com/blackberry-10-apps-f274/official-signal-app-without-play-services-available-1100790/ https://www.wilderssecurity.com/threads/signal-can-now-be-used-without-google-play-services.392235/ https://opensignal.com/android_app/non-market-download.php

column3: Chrome Desktop app window will not open consistently for windows 10
column4: Debug logs:  https://gist.github.com/a2c764a64dcd5c6b0b7cb297554d4c46  **Chrome Version** 56.0.2924.87 (64-bit) I use multiple user profiles simultaneously to keep work and personal content separate.  : installed extensions:  Cisco WebEx Extension 1.0.8 Google Docs 0.9 Google Docs Offline 1.4 Google Sheets 1.1 Google Slides 0.9 LastPass: Free Password Manager 4.1.41 Signal Private Messenger 0.32.1 Tampermonkey 4.2.7  **OS version**: Windows 10 Enterprise Version 1607,  OS build 14393.693  **Behavior**:  After upgrading from a windows 7 machine to windows 10, Signal has become unreliable. I see the message popup indicating I've gotten a new message, and about 80% of the time when I click the popup, my chrome instance is highlighted, but the signal instance does not appear.    I've enabled, disabled, removed, re-added, re re re,moved , re re added etc a number of times with no change in behavior.   Once I have the window open and working, it will continue to work as long as I do not close the window. once I close the window, it's anyone's guess whether it will come back again.   Sometimes I have the signal icon showing in the control panel open programs list, where I have attempted to bookmark the signal icon so it is easily accessible: If I hover over the icon and I can see the program preview, signal will work as expected. If the icon will not show up, or hovering does not show the program  preview, there is literally nothing I can do to convince the window for signal to show itself. It is obviously running, because I still get the message alerts- but the actual message window can not be accessed.   I attempted to go to the extension, and use the "create shortcut" option from the extension window. This will very occasionally work, but it's rare. the shortcut mainly gives me a "working" icon, and then does nothing.     I can also go to the "view in store" and select "launch app" from the chrome store. Again, occasionally this will work, but almost never. mostly it just does nothing.   I have been paying attention, but I can not find any  consistency for when it will work vs when it will not work. It does not seem more likely to work after a reboot or before, And I believe it has randomly started to work in the middle of a browser session (though I'm not 100% sure).  The only thing that Has changed about my configuration is the OS version, so I'm sure there is something environmental causing this- but I have not been able to narrow down what triggers the behavior.   One more interesting thing I just discovered: It's more likely to work if I use one chorme profile than another.  when it fails to work, it always highlights the  shortcut to the chrome profile that works less often.  The extension shows as installed on both.     Perhaps this is a strange side effect of windows 10 + profiles in chrome?

column3: Entering message from notification ocassionally causes message text input failure

I have a keyboard, which I can type into, but no text is recorded and pressing send does not result in any sent text.  ### Steps to reproduce - Open message from notification dropdown (or lockscreen)  - Type into the message input field  **Actual result:**  Occasionally typing doesn't fill the input field. To 'fix' I usually back out into the contact list and go back into the message, in which case typing into the input field works again. **Expected result:** Typing into input field results in message text inputed.  ### Screenshots Will try to update with screenshot if I can catch it.   ### Device info  **Device:** Nexus 6P **Android version:**  8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.13.6  ### Link to debug log Will update with device log after catching the bug next

column3: Automatically check verification status after qrcode scan
column4: Backgrund: PR https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/pull/6731.  This could be automated like this:  1. The QR code contains the safety number and a random password, valid only while the QR code page is open; 1. Device A scans Device B's QR code, checks the number, marks it as "verified" and sends an acknowledgement message to device B, authenticated by the temporary password; 1. If the password matches, device B sets the number as verified too, as the acknowledgement message can only come from a device that physically scanned the QR code.  https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/1016 deserves some love too.  Thanks @moxie0 for the great features 4.7.0 brought.  Edit: thinking about it, the "temporary password" probably doesn't need to be temporary at all, just random and per-contact.

column3: Use TURNS instead of TURN to negotiate/relay calls
column4: At the moments calls are negotiated (and eventually relayed) using plain TURN, while I think it would be better to use TURNS (TURN over SSL). I know the call is end-to-end encrypted anyway, but I think that an additional cryptography layer that also hides some more metadata is preferable.  (Until a few months ago there was a bug in `coturn` that prevented `turns` to work with the Google webrtc library. While I was trying to deploy a full-stack Signal infrastructure I stumbled on it, reported it and had it fixed: https://github.com/coturn/coturn/issues/113. It should work fine now.)

column3: Feature Request: Use Share Intent Subject When Sharing to Signal
column4: At the moment, sending a share Intent to Signal will include the `EXTRA_TEXT` portion of the Intent but not the `EXTRA_SUBJECT`  For example, using this code from another app ``` java Intent sendIntent = new Intent(); sendIntent.setAction(Intent.ACTION_SEND); sendIntent.putExtra(Intent.EXTRA_SUBJECT, "This is the intent title"); sendIntent.putExtra(Intent.EXTRA_TEXT, "This is the intent body"); sendIntent.setType("text/plain"); startActivity(Intent.createChooser(sendIntent, getResources().getText(R.string.send_to))); ```  Signal will only use the body: `"This is the intent body"` but not use the subject: `"This is the intent title"`   This would make it easier to get page titles and other subjects shared from browsers and other apps that set the share Intent's EXTRA_SUBJECT

column3: Profiles: no way to hide the "share profile with group" message
column4: As the title says: if I don't want to share my profile with a group, there is no way to just hide the message that suggest doing so. There should be a way to change idea later and share the profile, but that bar is annoying.  An indicator to know if the profile is shared or not is also missing.  Not sure if this also happens in conversations with people not in the contacts list.

column3: [UX] Passphrase-protect and hide only "sensitive" contacts.
column4: As part of an intermediate threat level(?) model, I'd like to have - like in GO SMS Pro, for example - the passphrase-protection apply only to a subset of my contacts/conversations, which should not affect normal usage of the app for the rest of the conversations in any way. The "sensitive" conversations should only show up and be available to interact with when the passphrase is entered.  For this to happen, of course, there needs to be an entirely different handling of the passphrase-protection (or just a new dedicated contacts-hiding passphrase mechanism?) where it doesn't auto-lock the whole app but only some conversations. In this case I should have something like an Unlock option in the Settings menu rather than as the first thing shown on app launch.  The scenario I'm thinking of is probably a quite common one, where you expect to forget your phone on a table somewhere and to have people looking through it while you're gone. In that case it's not much of a problem if they can get past the lockscreen but it becomes more important that a few apps or app sections holding sensitive information be really locked down with something more complicated than what's typically available as a screen locker. (If I complicate the screen locker by making it a long PIN or passphrase I severely reduce the usability of my phone, and in my opinion it's the same with my SMS handling app, which should be able to deal with "inocuous" conversations quickly and easily even if I have other conversations that I want to keep under a tighter lock.)  As for new message notifications from the hidden contacts, they should have some generic new-message text that doesn't disclose either the contact's name or the contents of what they've sent you.

column3: Feature request: Link Signal as app for arbitrary filetyps for sharing via "share menue".
column4: As it is now possible to send arbitrary files within Signal -> Attachments -> file (Still open issue  #993), it would be even better, if it would be possible to share this files via the "share menue" within other apps.  As far as I know, Signal has to be linked as possible receiverapps for any filetype.  Sorry if this should be monitored within  #993, but as this is closed, I did not see a chance to connect this request with this issue.  Regards

column3: "Safety numbers approval" switch does nothing (and has a confusing description)
column4: As I didn't understand what the "Safety numbers approval" switch really does, and the blog post does not mention it, I tried to look it up in the source code. It seems to me that ` isSendingIdentityApprovalRequired()` is not called anywhere.  I guess that the idea is: when the switch is turned on, then approval is always required *when sending*, without taking into account if the sender had the opportunity to see the safety number change warning. The receiving behavior doesn't change. This is not clear from the interface, a better description of the switch could be something like:  "Require approval of safety numbers changes for unverified contacts"  ### Device info   **Signal version:** 4.7.0
