column3: Feature / Privacy: disable contacts sync
column4: After getting an "X joined Signal!" notification, I was immediately curious how this user-joined syncing works. After a fair bit of hunting, I managed to find that phone numbers are being synced periodically, [after SHA1-ing their e164 value](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/libsignal-service-java/blob/a722aef284e2ce08bfc63f4e15be3fbaa44e4651/java/src/main/java/org/whispersystems/signalservice/api/SignalServiceAccountManager.java#L296) (well, 10 digits of it).  Given that [SHA1 hashing tends to be measured in _millions per second_](http://thepasswordproject.com/oclhashcat_benchmarking), and phone numbers are a rather small search space, this is effectively giving all your phone numbers to the server.  Reversing these hashes is, while not giving guaranteed results (given only 10 chars), trivial and still gives very high confidence in the results.  Not that I believe you're doing so, but for future-proofing this appears to be a pretty big leak if someone gains control of the Signal servers.  I was legitimately shocked that I couldn't find a way to disable this sync, either in the app or code.  Since it seems this could be done lazily (only check for the single contact you're trying to message, on first attempt) and the tradeoff is that you would only lose known-users (until checked) when browsing all your contacts, it seems like it'd be a good idea to allow people to disable this for a bit better protection.  And right inline with a privacy-oriented messenger.  Any thoughts?

column3: Copy messages with readable formatting.
column4: Added newline between messages in copy buffer with sender name and timestamp.  Fixes #7166   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Samsung Galaxy S2, Android 7.1.2, LineageOS 14.1  * Redmi 3S, Android 6.0.1  - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/)  ----------  ### Description While copying messages the message body was attached to buffer without any readable formatting and details. Hence added following formatting style with timestamps which insert new line between messages and separates senders with empty line. ``` John: [20 Nov 2017] 13:14 Hello! 13:15 Could you copy that?  Alex: [20 Nov 2017] 13:16 Hi! 13:16 Yep, I will try  John: [20 Nov 2017] 13:16 Thank you. 13:17 Please paste here. ``` Where time and date format used from Android's regional settings. It uses profile name and not names that are personally chosen for recipients. It uses senders phone number as identity when there is no profile name available.

column3: Periodically "prod" the message pipe, when GCM is disabled
column4: Added an `AlarmManager` alarm, to periodically "prod" the `SignalServiceMessagePipe`, waking any threads that may be stuck in blocking wait, while the device sleeping.  Fixes #6644 // FREEBIE   ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Xiaomi Mi 4, Android 7.1.2 (LineageOS 14.1, w/o GCM support)  * Motorola Moto G3, Android 7.1.2 (LineageOS 14.1, w/o GCM support)  * Motorola Moto G (3rd gen), Android 6.0.1 (with GCM support) - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  This pull request implements a fix to the problems described in #6644, using the facilities implemented in WhisperSystems/libsignal-service-java#45.  Please see the referenced pull request for a detailed description of the problem and most of the proposed solution.  As far as this pull request is concerned, a periodic alarm is set up, to "prod" and awaken the pipe, which, in the absence of GCM, will generally be trapped in blocking wait.  The period is set to 60s, because that's the smallest period allowed by `AlarmManager`.  As a result the keep-alive period on the socket's side had to be increased to match.  Note that in the proposed solution:  *) Allowance is made for the co-existence of more than one pipes, or, at least more than one `MessageRetrievalThread`s, which, as far as I could determine, can be the case.  *) Prods are only enabled in the absence of GCM.  If it is deemed, that they would be beneficial on GCM-enabled devices as well (see the relevant discussion in WhisperSystems/libsignal-service-java#45), this can trivially be accommodated, by unconditionally creating and registering the alarm receiver.

column3: Group avatars: pinch-to-zoom / taking pictures / easy identification
column4: A missing feature: taking a picture to set the group avatar, and the ability to pinch-to-zoom when selecting which part of an existing image use as an avatar.  I also think it should be easier to identify groups in the conversations list, for example by superimposing the "two human figures" icon to the group avatar.

column3: [Feature request] Image URL Displays
column4: A minor feature request would be if a link ends with .jpg, .png, .gif, .bmp instead of showing just the link the image will load in Signal itself making it visible. This way when you are in a browser and you want to share a image you can do so easily and have it displayed in the app for others to see.

column3: [Feature request] Know when someone is typing/last seen online
column4: A minor cool feature would be to see when someone is typing in the conversation weather it is a group chat or a one-on-one chat.  And to know when someone was viewing the conversation last. This way you know weather they are taking awhile to reply since they are typing a long reply or they are away.

column3: [Feature Request] Removing notification sound in-chat.
column4: A lot of chat apps replace the new message notification sound with a really basic Pop when in the chat. For users that have longer notification tones it could get annoying to hear the sound every time they receive a message, whilst having the chat open.  Request: Replace the standard notification tone with a short basic Pop whilst the chat window is open.  Why: It gets annoying to hear the notification jingle every time a message is received whilst the chat window is open.

column3: [Feature request] Send Recieve Read Group Chat Options
column4: A handy feature to have is to be able to choose in your settings when it comes to group chat Send Recieve Read Receipts weather you get a checkmark when one person in the group has Recieved/Read it or if you get a checkmark when all the people on the group have Recieved/Read it.

column3: Encrypted SMS/MMS without Data Connection
column4: [file this under Feature Request] This would seem like a no-brainer but I guess it needs to be spelled out.  Once two people or a group has a shared key and all further communications are encrypted, if the person needs to turn off data for whatever reasons, they should be able to continue to send and receive *encrypted* texts and MMS.    The application should be able to understand that a TCP connection is not available and thus either wrap the encrypted message in a MMS envelope or encrypt it into small

column3: Can't register without play services / play service error notifications / unreliable delivery
column4: 1. Can't register without google play services.  2. If play services is disabled after registration, the app gives warning notifications "Permanent Signal com...." "Signal was unable to register with google play services" (although the app still works).   3. Text delivery is sporadic and unreliable.  Do you people even test the app before putting it on the market? Don't publish an app with a big press release saying that it will work without google play services if you haven't even tested it and it, in fact, doesn't work. Pathetic. How is it that Telegram has so many more features, and works so successfully, yet your app doesn't? Incompetent developers.

column3: Refactor storage management to have a centralized, clearer way to get the Signal output directories
column4: // FREEBIE  ### First time contributor checklist - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Sony Xperia Z5 Compact, Android 7.0 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description This is just some refactoring base on the observation that the storing policy is not completely clear in the code. Every time something needs to be saved on the sdcard, we see some `Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()` calls and checks for errors. I believe this belongs to utils, both for clarity and for centralizing the access to the file storage. Moreover, this refactoring is supposed to help for issues #2791 and #5364.  I believe that more refactoring should be done on the `SaveAttachmentTask` in order to make it testable: I would move the decryption logic out of it and make it get directly an `InputStream`, so that instrumented tests could try to write attachments on the sdcard without taking care of the encryption.

column3: Redesign import/export activity
column4: // FREEBIE  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * OnePlus 3T, Android 7.1.1  * AVD, Android 4.4.2 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  Switches the import/export activity from a card-based layout to a list-based one.  Material design spec on cards:  >When to use >Use a card layout when displaying content that: > >* As a collection, comprises multiple data types, such as images, movies, and text >* Does not require direct comparison (a user is not directly comparing images or text) >* Supports content of highly variable length, such as comments >* Contains interactive content, such as +1 buttons or comments >* Would otherwise be in a grid list but needs to display more content to supplement the image  The import/export activity doesn't fit these criteria; using cards when they aren't necessary just adds extra clutter to the layout.  | Before | Light | Dark | |--|--|--| |![io-before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17954071/25307170/eacdb3c2-2761-11e7-83de-be352015c200.png)|![io-light](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17954071/25314242/f0eb540e-2805-11e7-88ca-455fc63c6266.png)|![io-dark](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17954071/25314243/f49a858e-2805-11e7-80ae-c8cbb813df22.png)|

column3: Add travis-ci configuration
column4: // FREEBIE  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * DOES NOT APPLY - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  * __Scope:__ I am just adding a `.travis.yml` file and editing one line in `build.gradle`. The "WhisperSystems" account should be linked to a Travis-CI (https://travis-ci.org/) account for it to work. The integration with GitHub is quite good (I tested on my fork). * __Risk:__ Almost inexistant. I had to change one minor line in the `build.gradle`, but that has no consequences on the code itself. * __Notes:__ The travis configuration required a few tricks (the build was crashing because of memory issues, for instance, so the javaMaxHeapSize had to be decreased and the simulator had to be started after the build, ...). It is working right now on my fork, but I guess that will have to be checked with the other branches.

column3: New group: x to remove contacts is not visible on dark theme
column4: ---  I have: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----  ### Bug description When you create a new group and want to remove a member you just added you have to tab on the :x:. But on dark theme it is not really visible  ### Steps to reproduce - use dark theme - tab on "New group" - add a contact  **Actual result:** there is a :x: for each contact but it is dark gray on black background **Expected result:** The :x: should be light gray / white / red or any lighter color on black background  ### Screenshots ![screenshot_20170813-145027](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5571650/29249821-36255bbc-8037-11e7-82bd-8ef2baad344c.png)  ### Device info **Device:** LG Nexus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.9.6  This issue is separated from #6871.

column3: New group: no way to see if contact has Signal account
column4: ---  I have: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----  ### Bug description In the "New group" view there is no way to see if a contact uses Signal or not. You have to try and if not you see the message  > You have selected a contact that doesn't support Signal groups, so this group will be MMS.  ~~and there is no way to undo this (remove the bad contact) and you have to close the view and try again (and enter the group name again and select the group icon again).~~  ### Steps to reproduce - tab on "New group" - try to create a Signal only group - add a contact without Signal account  **Actual result:** There is no difference between contacts with and without Signal account **Expected result:** Users with Signal account should be marked as Signal users (maybe by adding a label). Btw. if you decide to replace/fix this view you should also display the contact avatars in the suggestion list.  ### Screenshots  ![screenshot_20170813-145021](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5571650/29249820-3622c38e-8037-11e7-9381-385d9662c571.png) ![screenshot_20170813-145027](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5571650/29249821-36255bbc-8037-11e7-82bd-8ef2baad344c.png)  ### Device info  **Device:** LG Nexus 5 **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.9.6

column3: Signal-Android-x86 (VM): Doesn't work with Lan connection
column4: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  I installed the Signal apk, from the WhisperSystems website (Signal 4.7.4), on Android-X86 in a virtual machine and linked it with the Chromium app, so far so good. Even so the linking process worked pretty fine, it turned out that all the other functionality in Signal-on-Android-x86 isn't working at all (like sending text messages or esp. **calling other signal users**). That is probably because Android-x86 (in a Virtualbox) uses the LAN interface (NIC) (to connect to the internet) and it seems like the Signal-Android-app expects a WiFi connection instead of a LAN connection.   Could you please try to find a solution, so that people could use the Signal-Android-App on Android-x86 to call their contacts (of course a solution for the Signal-Chromium-Desktop-App would be preferable ;) )?  ### Bug description Signal is not able to just use an Android LAN connection for sending/receiving messages or making calls   ### Steps to reproduce - Install Signal apk on Android-x86 just with LAN connection - Open Siganl app - send message/call person  ### Expected result: - sending the message  ### Device info **Device:** innotek GmbH VirtualBox (android_x86) **Android version:** 6.0.1  **Signal version:** Signal 4.7.4  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/1469b2d016896142d3875f7b8f6b6418  ![3sfd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30239372/28281432-97e7b9de-6b16-11e7-8aa9-4ba0d1fe6d66.PNG)

column3: Please tell user the directory/location of downloaded images/videos
column4: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Signal does not tell where it saves images and videos. The directories /Pictures and /Movies are no bad choices but as e.g. the camera app only uses /DCIM for both, it's a bit annoying that one has to search.  ### Steps to reproduce save video or image  **Actual result:** Message just says *"file successfully saved"* but not where.  **Expected result:** Message says *"Image successfully saved in /Pictures"* (or similar)  ### Screenshots  ### Device info **Device:** Google Nexus 4 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4  ### Link to debug log

column3: Cannot forward to group if group does not appear under recent conversations
column4: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description In forwarding a message, groups appear only under recent conversation. This makes it hard to share a message with a group, especially if it has an attachment.  ### Steps to reproduce - Make sure some conversations and groups exist - Select a message and try to forward it to a group.  **Actual result:** Groups only appear in the following lists under "recent conversations". This means, if the group does has no recent messages, it cannot be selected here. Also, the search functionality does not find groups in this activity.  **Expected result:** I'd expect groups to appear in the contacts list as well and that they can be found by the search feature. Alternatively, an extra category "groups" could be introduced alongside "recent conversations" and "contacts".

column3: Text entered into quick reply toast is lost when another message comes in
column4: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ### Bug description When a message comes in and a toast pops up with the ability to mark read or quickly reply, if I've entered some text and another message comes in, the next message's toast obliterates the one I was typing. No draft is saved.  ### Steps to reproduce - Be using an app that's not Signal - Receive a message - Start typing a reply in the toast box - Receive another message (in my case from the same sender, I'm not positive a different sender will cause this)  **Actual result:** The 2nd message's toast pops up over the first one, and the message being entered into the first toast disappears. **Expected result:** Preferably the 2nd message would be queued (or perhaps extend the toast vertically, if that's an option?), or at least a draft would be saved. Either of these options are not the greatest UX though.  ### Device info  **Device:** I don't like sharing this info publically **Android version:** 7.1.2 (LineageOS 14.1) **Signal version:** 4.6.1  ### Link to debug log I don't currently have one - time crunch this morning - and not sure it will be useful, but if so, I will set up with a friend to induce this bug later today or tomorrow.

column3: Easy mixup of personal and group conversations: Change the styling of a group conversation
column4: - [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates  ----------------------------------------  ### Underlying usability issue  There is a common **usability bug** of Signal. Lets say you are getting a Signal message on your mobile. You select the notification message, switching to your Signal app, opening the conversation. You now see the last part of the conversation dialogue between you and this single person. You now answer the message of that person, writing things that are meant to be read only by that single person. Just after sending the message (or never?) you realize that you just sent this message to a group chat of many people whose conversation happens to be filled with messages of you and the other person  as long as your screen view/history is showing.   Therefore, you **accidentally sent a personal message to a group conversation**.  You _assumed_, that you wrote your message in a private conversation because you have seen only one person's answers. Other people did not write for a longer period of time to that group conversation. You could have read the header information where you could have seen that this is not a person-to-person conversation. However, you concentrate on the bottom of the screen, where the received message could be seen and answer right below it. Therefore, it is easy to overlook the group chat header when answering a message in Signal. There is no other distinction between group and personal conversations.  The ability to change/overwrite the background color of group chats to an alarming red one for example could give the user a hint that this is not a personal conversation but a group chat. However, there is still the issue that Signal might give away "red" for an arbitrary personal conversation but this only leads to you looking more closely to the header, realizing that it is save to write personal stuff in this conversation.  _There might be other solutions to this usability issue_ (all group chats look different that any other given person-to-person conversation somehow) but my proposed feature here is a quickfix that might work for many users.  ### Proposed Quickfix  I would like to be able to **set (or overwrite) the background color of a group conversation** just like it is possible for person-to-person conversations.  ### Steps to reproduce - switch to a person-to-person conversation - hamburger menu > "Conversation settings" - "Color" may be changed/overwritten - switch to a group conversation - hamburger menu > "Conversation settings" - no "Color" option is shown  **Expected result:** I want to have the "Color" option for group conversations as well.  ### Device info  **Device**: OnePlus 5 **iOS version**: Android 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.11.5

column3: Texts not delivered to users who get new phones and don't reinstall Signal
column4: - [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Scenario: Someone is using Signal, then switches to a new phone but doesn‚Äôt reinstall/re-set up Signal.  Issue: I send them a text message through Signal. The lock symbol appears (so the message is being routed through Signal), the first checkmark (the message was sent) appears, but I never get the second checkmark (the message was delivered).  I've run into this issue with at least 3 people in the last week. In addition to the problem itself, it is additionally problematic that there is no notification the message was never delivered. I only discover it when I go to text that person again days, or weeks later - and even then it often takes me a few more instances before I notice what's going on.   ### Steps to reproduce - Set up Signal on a phone. - Drop phone in toilet. - Get a new phone, don't set up Signal. - Have someone else send you a text message.   **Actual result:**  - The recipient does not receive any message. - The sender does not receive a notification their message failed to deliver.  **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour) - The text message would be routed to the recipient's normal text message app, OR... - The sender would be notified the text message could not be delivered.  ### Platform info  **Operating System**: LG G6, Android 7.0. **Signal version:** 4.9.9

column3: Feature: add support for custom url sceme signal:// so we can have share buttons
column4: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I maintain a website, and I would love to put signal share buttons on my articles. To do so, there needs to be a way to point to the signal app from webpages. The manner to do this without many compatibility issues is a custom url sceme: signal://  I know, custom url scemes could be considered bad practice since they pollude the namespace. I agree, but for now signal can't compete with other social media from a buisness standpoint because of missing features like these. This may keep a lot of people from using signal as their favorite messenger app. (world domination is not the goal, but we don't want to shoot ourselfs in the foot either, private messaging will only happen if your contacts are also willing to accept signal on their phone.)  Lets consider having share buttons on websites. A custom url sceme would be a good start to make that possible.  `Send message to Signal Private Messenger`  Read more about this [here](https://www.themarketingtechnologist.co/open-a-whatsapp-conversation-directly-from-your-ad/)

column3: Import brought normal MMS groups into desktop app
column4: - [x ] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description I have a bunch of "Unknown Group"s at the bottom of my list in the desktop app.  This happened after the upgrade to Android Signal 4.10.3, so not sure yet if this is bad interpretation by desktop or just a matter of garbage in, garbage out because of what the new Android client sent.  Filed here per comments by @scottnonnenberg in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop/issues/1449   ### Steps to reproduce - Have MMS conversations (non-signal.  Mine included some members who were signal users, but not all, so it was normal MMS) - Upgrade Android client from 4.9.9 -> 4.10.3  **Actual result:** End up with a bunch of "Uknown Group"s and when you look at the phone #'s, you'll see numbers that are NOT signal users **Expected result:** Only Signal-only groups get imported into the desktop client  ### Screenshots ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4967949/30171757-0e0fdcba-93b0-11e7-9962-be82df01b9f9.png)  ### Platform info **Operating System**: Win 7 **Browser**: Chrome 61.0.3163.79 **Signal version:** Android 4.10.3 / Desktop 0.43.2  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/080ad052cc62329207191644106ff718

column3: Send-button switches back to 'Signal' when 'Insecure SMS' is selected for signal contacts
column4: ** DUPLICATE - information here was copied to #6929 **   I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description  My contact uses signal, but does not have mobile internet. Thus, sometimes I like to send her an insecure SMS. After switching to the beta builds (4.10.3), selecting 'insecure SMS' does not work as the button switches back to 'signal message'    ### Steps to reproduce - Open a conversation to a signal contact - Tap & hold the 'send button' to reveal the sending options - Select 'insecure SMS'  **Actual result:** The 'send' button still is blue and says 'signal message', signal messages are send when the message is sent **Expected result:** The 'send' button should be gray and say 'insecure SMS'  ### Screenshots   ![out](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1466478/30250633-2b4ee0a6-9652-11e7-820c-eeba8aaca83d.gif)  (Video is cropped to hide phone number)  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S5; LineageOS; Rooted **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.10.3  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/84d93117b44d7da0857d396229833cf8

column3: [Feature Request] Search within conversation/thread
column4: #I have: - [x ] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x ] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  Would love the ability to search for strings/text within a conversation/thread. Currently, can only search for contact names on the main Signal screen when you first open the app/after login which shows the list of conversations. Would love either a global in-thread search so I can search for all instances of a string or word (and perhaps other search operators that can search for the existence of "attachments" or even date-ranges?) across all the saved conversations on the phone, or at minimum a search function within a single thread.

column3: Search should remove diacritics from search string
column4: ### Steps to reproduce - open Signal and tap on pencil icon - type your (Polish/Spanish/Hungarian) friend name using only English alphabet    **Actual result:** As your Polish/Spanish/Hungarian name contains language-specific signs, Signal won't show contacts as diacritics are not ignored while searching. **Expected result:** Signal should suggest contacts and don't strictly compare diacritics (should ignore diacritics. May map them to letters from English alphabet). Eg. if you type "agnes" Signal should suggest you "AGN√àS" if it exists in your contact list.   https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/javadocs/api-release/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html#stripAccents-java.lang.String-  ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S4 I9506 **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 2.4.2

column3: Unsubscribed users are not removed from groups
column4: ### Steps to reproduce - Have a member of a group unsubscribe from Signal - Check how the now unsubscribed number is still part of the group - Now the stale number is impossible to remove from the group. Sometimes re-registering is not an option, as access to the number might have been lost. Most of the time the user just doesn't care.  **Expected result:** The unsubscribed user is automatically removed from all the groups. I know the server is not aware of groups, but I think there are still ways to handle this. For example:  - When sending a message to a group (i.e., to all the group members), if a user is not a Signal user anymore, remove it; - Before adding a user to a group because of a message coming from another group member, check if the number is actually a Signal number.  **Signal version:** 4.8.0

column3: Fall back to Camera1Enumerator on exceptions (Fix for #6537)
column4: ### First time contributor checklist - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Samsung Galaxy S2 (i9100), Android 7.1.2  * Samsung Galaxy S3 (i9300), Android 7.1.2 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description If Camera2Enumerator.isSupported() throws, consider Camera2Enumerator to not be supported, log the Throwable, and use Camera1Enumerator instead.  Before this patch, an exception thrown by Camera2Enumerator.isSupported would crash any Signal call (even if video was not enabled).  Fixes #6537 // FREEBIE  I experienced the same errors as described in #6537 on the two devices mentioned above. This patch makes video calls work for these devices.

column3: set default characterset to utf-8. Fixes #6374
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/) --As best I can.  The cla page just hangs on submit, every time, in every browser  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Pixel XL, Android 8.0 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description This corrects pull request 6892, and resolves the long running issue with Google Project Fi users not being able to view emojis in MMS messages because the character set isn't defined.  Default character set will default to UTF-8.  I tested SMS and MMS messages with emojis on a Google Pixel XL device, on Project Fi.  I also tested existing secure messages were not impacted.  Credit to @FeuRenard for finding the mistake in the original commit

column3: Fixes #7293. Custom ringtones are now resolved for calls from system contacts
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Virtual device Nexus 4, Android 7.1 (API 25)  * Virtual device Nexus, Android 7.0 (API 24)  * Motorola Moto G, Android 5.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/)  ----------  ### Description  This patch ensures that custom ringtones are used for incoming calls, if a custom ringtone is set for the corresponding system contact.  ![device_ringtone_selection](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5368734/34546728-1d3e4192-f0f6-11e7-8401-0c9a95b5125f.png)  If the ringtone for the contact is set to: - none => no ringtone is played.  - default ringtone => default ringtone is played. - custom ringtone => custom ringtone is played.

### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Samsung SM-G900M, Android 6.0.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description   It fixes the issue #6551. A network error message appear when a wrong verification code was inserted. I solved this inserting a catch block with an AuthorizationFailedException and returning a VERIFICATION_ERROR constant.

column3: Allow refusing profile sharing
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [X] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [X] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [X] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [X] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Oneplus 5, Android 7.1.1 - [X] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [X] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [X] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description Fixes  #6927 by adding a "never ask again" button to the dialog that comes up when you tap the banner.  I've tested this on my device. I see the new option in the dialog that appears when you tap on the banner, and I can select the never ask again button and make the banner disappear. Going back to the chat, the banner is still gone. So I'm fairly certain this solves the issue.  I only have the string for English, because I only speak English.  (I had trouble testing it, because my build isn't signed with the key used for the Play Store and I couldn't install it over the existing Signal to use its database. I couldn't get the bar on any group chats I made, and eventually I had to resort to asking all my Facebook friends to Signal group chat me. I've also clobbered my Signal keys about 3 times today. I wish there was some kind of testing guide.)

column3: Display the absolute time as an alternative to the relative time
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * OnePlus 3T, Android 8.0.0  * Virtual device, Nexus One API 26  * Virtual device, Nexus One API 27 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [ ] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/)  ----------  ### Description  This patch introduces the option to switch from relative time to absolute time in Conversation{Item,ListItem,UpdateItem} and MediaPreviewActivity.  The configuration option is available in Settings / Chat and media / Chats. Default setting is false (the relative time). By changing to true, the relative time will be switched to the absolute time.  This Pull Request is extending parts of the code where relative time is being called by get{Brief,Extended}RelativeTimeSpanString.  First, the check against the preferences is executed. TextSecurePreferences.isAbsoluteTimeEnabled(getContext())  If absolute time is enabled, getAbsoluteTimeSpanString (instead of get{Brief,Extended}RelativeTimeSpanString) is called.  getAbsoluteTimeSpanString is defined in DateUtils and formats date to "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss".

column3: Fix copying links when scrolling in #6343
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Nexus 6P Android 7.1.2 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description @FeuRenard reported an issue where links gets copied when the user starts scrolling starting from them. The reason behind that issue was that the GestureDetector wasn't receiving the `ACTION_CANCELLED` MotionEvent so it still called the `onLongPress` even though it shouldn't. This fix merely passes the `ACTION_CANCELLED` MotionEvent to the GestureDetector so that it cancels its onLongPress handler.

column3: Add action indicator when resending a message.
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [X] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [X] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [X] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [X] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Nexus 5x, Android 7.1.1 - [X] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [X] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [X] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  When sending of message fails, user can go into details of that message and click RESEND button to retry. As issue #6307 mentions, after clicking that button nothing really indicates on the screen that message is being resent in the background.  This pull request hides the RESEND button when resending asynchronous task is started, as well as hides the "error_description" TextView and replaces it with the "action_description" TextView which says "Resending...". That should provide a nice indicator that clicking the RESEND button actually had an effect.

column3: Change background connection notification icon
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [x] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/)  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Google Pixel, Android 8.1 _without Google Play Services_  * Virtual Google Pixel, Android 8.1 with Google Play Services (not relevant but tested to make sure it worked anyway)  * Virtual 'Google Pixel', Android 7.0 _without Google Play Services_ - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/)  ----------  ### Description This pull request changes the icon for the 'background connection enabled' notification to `ic_settings_input_antenna_black_24dp` so that it can be differentiated from message notifications in the status bar. Fixes #7255 (though _improves the situation_ is perhaps more accurate).  This is what the expanded notification drawer _used_ to look like (sensitive data removed): ![screenshot_20171207-232236](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3037552/33751300-045ed41a-dba8-11e7-8eb1-4998c09aee97.png)  Note how this results in _two_ Signal-icon notifications in the status bar when a message notification is also present: ![33751284-dc1cc318-dba7-11e7-9193-91216ddc5194](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3037552/33974893-101b76e0-e059-11e7-9802-3ca05f35f668.png)  This pull request changes the background connection icon to `ic_settings_input_antenna_black_24dp` (part of the Material icon set), making the message notification icon different from that of the background connection notification, so that the two can be easily differentiated: ![screenshot_1513222627](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3037552/33974926-3c4b86f6-e059-11e7-9c3e-57a36fbb4de7.png)  This change affects only a small number of users (i.e. users whose phones run Android without Google Play Services), and is only particularly relevant to users of Android >= 8.1 (the background connection notification does not appear in the status bar in lower versions).  This contribution comes out of a desire to fix something that has been nagging at me ever since I updated to Android 8.1, and I imagine that I'm not the only user who is bothered by the confusing background connection icon. (It looks like I _always_ have a notification.)  This is my first contribution to the Signal codebase. I'm happy to change the icon if the chosen one seems inappropriate. (I spent awhile combing through the Material icon set and this one seemed ideal, though beauty is in the eye of the beholder!)  The license of the Material icon (Apache 2.0) is compatible with GPLv3, so licensing should not be an issue.  This contribution is a freebie.

column3: Use better backup location
column4: ### First time contributor checklist  - [x] I have read [how to contribute](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to this project - [ ] I have signed the [Contributor License Agreement](https://whispersystems.org/cla/) I tried to sign the CLA in Firefox and Chromium, but it never completes. Looks like a configuration error on the CLA server: ``` Failed to load https://open-whisper-cla.appspot.com/cla-server/form: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: The 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header has a value 'https://whispersystems.org' that is not equal to the supplied origin. Origin 'https://signal.org' is therefore not allowed access. ```  ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Moto G4, Android 6.0.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description   Provide a better error when we can't find a plaintext backup to import - tested by manually running import with no backups present and looking at the toast. Place backups and saved files into `Signal` subdirectories - tested by manually importing and exporting, with 0, 1, and multiple exports, as well as saving file attachments. Also added a basic round trip test for export/import functionality, and verified the existing `SaveAttachmentTestCase` continues working.  I'd like to make backups in Signal better, so I thought I would start with some open easy issues.

column3: No animations on UI elements changing state in settings
column4: ### Description When an UI element changes state (e.g. a switch is checked/unchecked, any settings section is tapped), there aren't any animations showing up (a switch slider is instantly moved to the left/right, a section is instantly opened, etc).   ### Steps to reproduce - Open settings. - Tap any section. - No animations are shown on tapping. Same goes for switches, they instantly change state without proper animations.  **Actual result:** UI elements react without any animations and delays **Expected result:** an animation is played (e.g. a switch slides with a small animation delay, a settings list activity is slided to the new one, etc)  ### Device info **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.9.9

column3: Fallback to SMS app for invitations
column4: ### Contributor checklist - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Sony Xperia U, Android 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod)  * AVD Nexus 5X, Android 5.1  * AVD Nexus 5X, Android 7.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description If Signal is not the default SMS app, the default SMS app will be used for in-conversation invitations. column3: Allow hiding action bar in media preview
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Sony Xperia U, Android 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod)  * AVD Nexus 5X, Android 7.1.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description This PR allows to show/hide the action bar in media preview by single-tapping the media. For videos the visibility of the action bar is coupled to the visibility of the playback controls. So the single-tap that usually shows/hides the playback controls now also shows/hides the action bar, too. Additionally I colored the action bar semi-transparent.  I tested this contribution for both image views and for both video views. Sadly I wasn't able to test `SubsamplingImageView` and `VideoView` under realistic conditions, but only by forcing them to be used on the platforms mentioned above.  ### Screenshots ![bildschirmfoto von 2017-05-30 21-37-31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16167751/26602337/768894d8-4583-11e7-81ba-6dcec7dc7d1e.png) ![bildschirmfoto von 2017-05-30 21-35-48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16167751/26602344/78bde348-4583-11e7-9201-68a63a79594b.png)  ### Outlook I plan to implement #5934 on top of this. This would add showing/hiding the status bar on Jelly Bean+ and additionally showing/hiding navigation bar on KitKat+ (immersive mode). In a separate PR or on request I could add auto-hiding with `Handler.postDelayed(...)`. It's easy but I left it out of this PR for now. That would mean that on entering `MediaPreviewActivity` action bar is shown at first but hides after some seconds.

column3: Resolve media message race condition
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Sony Xperia U, Android 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod)  * AVD Nexus 5X, Android 7.1.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description Rationale is describe in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6677#issuecomment-304039291.  This PR makes sure that `insertListener.onComplete()` is called before `notifyConversationListeners(...)`. I see two possibilities to achieve this:  - Move `insertListener.onComplete()` to [`insertMediaMessage(...)`](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/database/MmsDatabase.java#L961). That's what I did. The only disadvantage I see, is changing the method signature of `insertMediaMessage(...)`, which is used in two other places. - Move or copy `notifyConversationListeners(...)` to [`insertMessageOutbox(...)`](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/database/MmsDatabase.java#L866). This method is used when sending a media message, sending a self message and receiving messages. So by moving this method call, we maybe miss to notify in some cases. Copying the method call will cause redundant notify calls. My intuition says, that this alternative is slightly more risky or error-prone.  I tested:  - sending messages in groups: no duplicates as described in #6677. - sending self messages: behaviour seems unchanged - receiving messages while the according conversation is showing: behaviour seems unchanged  Fixes #6677

column3: Allow swipe gestures in media preview
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Sony Xperia U, Android 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod)  * AVD Nexus 5X, Android 7.1.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description Please read the commit messages to see, which changes I applied.  The following problems remain:  - Raise offscreen page limit of the viewPager to enable a smoother paging experience? By default the viewed page plus one page to the right and one to the left is instantiated (offscreen page limit = 1). If you use a slow phone and swipe swiftly, you will reach a page whose media are not yet instantiated. You will see a black page which will display media with some latency. We can try to solve this issue by raising the offscreen page limit to 2. In worst case you are still using a slow phone and 5 GIFs are now instantiated (animated). I observed that the animations get slow in this situation. This could be solved by stopping GIF animations when GIFs are offscreen. If you want this behaviour, I will implement it. - Do we want to be able to switch pages when an image is zoomed in? I implemented this feature in #5801, but decided to keep it out of this PR to keep the diff low. - On Android versions prior to Marshmallow no video thumbnails are created. In media preview when swiping to a video the placeholder will be shown. It has to be tapped to start video playback. To make this clear, we should show the play overlay above the placeholder. This should go in a separate PR, too. -> #6635 - The video thumbnails maybe should have the same size as the video and don't fill the whole screen.  Sadly I'm not able to test this contribution with the platforms that use the old video player, which are Android versions 4.0.1 downwards (see #6603). I would be happy, if someone tested this PR using such a device :)  Fixes #2355  Supersedes #5801

column3: Fix occasional crash on Android 7 direct reply
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Nexus 4, Android 7.1  * Galaxy S5, LineageOS Android 7.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  The use of the RecipientFactory in the RemoteReplyReceiver was done in the main thread. This is a problem when the recipient's data isn't cached because then the ContactPhotoFactory would perform Glide actions on the main thread, which calls the exception of the issue.  I just moved the use of the RecipientFactory inside the AsyncTask we use later; this is also the place where we need the recipients the first time.  Direct reply still works as intended after this change.  Related Issue: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/issues/6185

column3: Inform user that message is too long to be displayed.
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [X] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [X] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * LG Nexus 5x, Android 7.1.2 - [X] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [X] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [X] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description Currently text messages are silently cut when they are longer than 2000 characters (as mentioned in issue #5146). It can be really annoying as users may not even notice that part of message is not shown if the message is not cut half-sentence. I had this problem multiple times when my contact copied a longer text to me using Signal Desktop and I tried to read it on Android.  Resolving the issue properly probably requires a lot of work (like adding a way to display full message body or splitting large messages into smaller parts) and I believe it will take some time, especially considering that the issue mentioned is already over a year old. In the meantime I think it would be fair to inform users that part of message is not displayed so that they can resolve it with their contacts somehow (like using another communication channel or splitting the message manually).

column3: add search for finding newest matching message in a conversation
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * GT-I9300 (Galaxy SIII), LineageOS 14.1 (Android 7.1)  * Nexus 4 Api 25 Emulator (Android 7.1.1) - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  This PR addresses a part of #1232: Searching a text within a conversation. So the use case ‚ÄúYou have sent me your address some time ago and I don‚Äôt want to scroll through the whole chat history.‚Äù is addressed, but the case ‚ÄúSomeone has sent me that address, I don‚Äôt remember in which conversation.‚Äù is not.  Iterating through all messages is not a very fast solution, but still better than manual searching. That‚Äôs why only the loaded part of the conversation (500 messages by default) is searched, to get a fast feedback whether the information you‚Äôre looking for is in the conversation or not; if no match is found the user can decide to load the whole conversation and search again. If you don‚Äôt think that the user experience with this patch is good enough, I‚Äôm fine if you don‚Äôt want to merge this PR, but I considered this patch quite useful during the last month, so I wanted to share it.

column3: Add back a way to access quick contact from within conversation
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices:  * Android 5.1.1 * AVD Android 7.1.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  In Signal 4.10 it was possible to open "quick contact" to directly make a regular phone call to a contact from within a conversation by tapping the avatar next to each message bubble. The avatar has been removed in Signal 4.11, so there is no such option anymore. This PR enables the exact same feature by long tapping the conversation title.  // FREEBIE

column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description Improve wording of joined contact notification, see #6757. `"%s joined Signal!"` rephrased to `"%s is on Signal!"`  // FREEBIE

column3: Fix group title after group creation through group info request
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description Groups that are created through a group info request after a new installation are shown as "Unnamed group" . After the group information is received, the displayed title is still not updated until you restart Signal. This is because the title is already cached in the `RecipientFactory`. This simple one line PR fixes the issue by clearing the cache the same way it is already done for group updates.  ### Steps to reproduce - create a group - reinstall Signal - receive a message in that group - group shows up as "Unnamed group" - answer to group info request is received: "Group name is now 'some name'"  **Actual result:** Group name is still "Unnamed group" until after you restart Signal **Expected result:** Group name should change to "some name" immediately     // FREEBIE

column3: Fix crash when no transport options are available
column4: ### Contributor checklist  - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) - [x] I have made the choice whether I want the [BitHub reward](https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/BitHub-Rewards) or not by omitting or adding the word `FREEBIE` in the commit message of my first commit  ----------  ### Description  There are no transport options available when opening a Signal group while being unregistered, which then triggers an assertion, see #6419. There are still ways to trigger this bug that are not handled by this PR (i.e. when trying to add an attachment). That would be improved by merging PR #5582. Adding an extra transport type to prevent this crash seemed to be a bit too much overhead to me.  // FREEBIE

column3: (Possible security issue) Whilst de-registering foreign number in UAE messages, are sent/received
column4: ### Bug description While registered with Signal on a foreign number, and visiting UAE, Signal does not work so whilst de-registration of foreign number, messages that were not being sent/received are suddenly sent/received in that time window. **_Is there a possible vulnerability just during that time frame?_**  ### Steps to reproduce - Use a SIM card from a foreign country where Signal is not blocked or censored and register and use it in that country. - Go to UAE and use Signal (messages will not be sent) - Send a few messages and instantly go to next step - Try de-registering (it will give an error of "error connecting to server") - Previously sent messages will be delivered whilst the de-registration is happening  - Messages will not be sent anymore afterwards and de-registration won't happen. - Messages sent from outside UAE are also not delivered normally, but are received whilst the UAE user is de-registering.  **Actual result:** So messages are not being sent/received at all.... but then when trying to de-register the messages are sent/received. The main problem here is that during de-registration all messages are sent/received.   **Expected result:** Not sure what I expect, but if Signal is blocked then messages shouldn't go through at all. So maybe it is a security issue, or perhaps there is another way to circumvent censorship?  ### Screenshots Sorry no screenshots as the explanation is self-sufficient (hopefully).   ### Device info  **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.8.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/b53230b3764cb08ad97ff102088700db

column3: Listening to audio recordings on Galaxy S7 only possible with the hands-free speaker
column4: ### Bug description Whenever a voice message is played on a Samsung Galaxy S7 (G930F), it is only possible to hear it with the "strong" speaker that is used for hands-free calling. If the phone is put to the ear to hear it on the regular voice speaker, the phone simply mutes the big one and nothing is heard from the regular one.  ### Steps to reproduce - get or record a voice message - press the button to play the voice message - put your phone to the ear  Actual result: silence Expected result: non-silence  ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 G930F **Android version:** 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  ### Link to debug log I saw this on a friend's phone, sorry about the log. If it is truly necessary here, I'll get one.  Also, can somebody confirm?

column3: Issue with recents screenshot
column4: ### Bug description When using the power button of the device the FLAG_SECURE is ineffective and the screenshot appears with the information. This is actually a bug on Android platform and have been fixed only in versions above 7.x.  My goal with this issue is to understand if there may be implemented a workaround for earlier versions of android like change to a blank fragment during the onPause() or onStop() event.  In the API there is supposedly a function that would allow to generate a custom thumbnail but it's never triggered. I opened a ticket in Google regarding this but so far nobody assigned the ticket (https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=235166)  ### Steps to reproduce - Navigate to a particular screen with information - Press the power button of the device to lock the screen. - Go to the recents list and confirm that the information is shown on the screenshot  ### Screenshots  ![screenshot_20170313-161425](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4196178/23863867/c799ac08-0808-11e7-95a9-fcaab2a9e7de.png)  ### Device info **Device:** Nexus 5x **Android version:** 6.0.1 **Signal version:** 3.30.4

column3: Using Signal standalone with MicroG in it's default state (gcm off) fails to register
column4: ### Bug description When using microg in it's default configuration (having cloud messaging/gcm disabled) Signal still tries to register and send/receive messages via gcm. Freezing the microg framework allows websockets to be used instead, as gsf is no longer detected.  I use the standalone apk release from the website, and would greatly appreciate it if an option to toggle the use of gcm could be exposed somewhere in the standalone apk releases. Alternatively, Signal could test to see if gcm is functional or not before registration and upon startup, and fall back to websockets with the standard notice in the event a system issue is present, or the user is opting to use websockets on purpose.  As an aside, if I unfreeze the microg framework now, will Signal continue using websockets instead? I have no idea.  ### Steps to reproduce - Procure phone running microg with gcm/cloud messaging disabled - Try to register with Signal (fail) - Freeze the microg framework applications - Kill and restart Signal, register - Success (via websockets)

column3: Deleting Message doesn't delete Notification
column4: ### Bug description When receiving a message while the Signal app is open a notification is still generated (which is awesome) but when I switch to that conversation and delete the message that currently has an open notification, the notification remains active after the message has been deleted.  ### Steps to reproduce - Have Signal App open - Receive Message (I only tested with Signal users) - Open the conversation - Delete the message that is currently in the notification  **Actual result:** Notification persists after message is deleted. **Expected result:** Deleting a message also removes any active notification(s) corresponding to the message.   ### Device info **Device:** Google Pixel XL **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.11.5

column3: Video Call - video is green tint on other person phone
column4: ### Bug description When making a video call, my video has a green tint on the other person's phone. On my screen the video looks normal. Recording with same camera in different app has no green tint.  ### Steps to reproduce Any video call, initiated or received. Only tested with calls between an android and iphone.  **Actual result:** My video has green tint on other user's phone. **Expected result:** Video should look similar to how it looks on my phone, no green tint.   ### Device info  **Device:** HTC One X **Android version:** 4.0.3 **Signal version:** 4.1.0

column3: Show "new safety number" warning in group for group messages
column4: ### Bug description When a user changes key, the "safety numbers changed, accept?" message appears in a private conversation with the user, even if the message was sent in a group. I observed that people find this confusing, sometimes not realizing that they're missing group messages and then blaming Signal for losing them.  I know that the fact that a message is a "group message" is itself part of the message, and if the message is not trusted this information shouldn't be trusted too. Still I think that in this case the sweet spot between security and usability lies in showing these messages in the group conversation.  Partially related: #5985.  ### Steps to reproduce - Have a group conversation - One of the users changes key (reinstalls Signal) - Check where the "safety numbers changed, accept?" warning appears.  **Actual result:** The warning appears in a private conversation with the user. **Expected result:** The warning appears in the group conversation.   **Device:** Nexus 6 **Android version:** 7.1.1 (stock) **Signal version:** 4.5.3
