column3: Unable to change profile picture
column4: ### Bug description Unable to change profile picture via a set file (also attempted via camera)  After initially setting up a profile picture successfully, it is not possible to change the profile picture to a different image. It is possible to clear the profile picture completely, however any other image that is selected results in the first still being displayed. I have confirmed with a friend, they also get this experience.   ### Steps to reproduce - Go to settings.  - Click on profile picture (takes you to profile area) - Click again on profile picture ot edit it.  - Click on files  - Select an image - Click done - Image does not change  **Actual result:**  Image does not change **Expected result:**  Image should be replaced by the one selected ### Screenshots  ### Device info Google Pixel **Android version:** 8.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.12.3  ### Link to debug log Https://gist.github.com/1b10e48420773e8d97dbf4df75433c8c

column3: Speex decoder is vulnerable
column4: ### Bug description The speex decoder used by Signal is vulnerable.  A malicious user can initiate a voice call with a victim, then send bad speex frames to crash the victim's Signal app. It may also be possible to achieve remote code execution.  ### Steps to reproduce - Write a minimal program replicating Signal's usage of libspeex. You can use this one: https://gist.github.com/klemensbaum/fb7c41c981ac43a5abbb3d8fb99d3902 - Obtain some sample audio and convert it to raw speex frames. Save each frame as a separate file in a testcases directory. - *(optional)* Prune redundant test cases with `afl-tmin` - Run `afl-fuzz` over it: `afl-fuzz -i testcases -o findings -- ./speex-fuzz @@`  **Actual result:** `afl-fuzz` finds a lot of crashes **Expected result:** `afl-fuzz` doesn't find any crashes  ### Example crashes  Some example crashes found during a short `afl-fuzz` run: https://gist.github.com/klemensbaum/3df0260fe459c10a5adb2fd569b41dda

column3: External app sending SMS created a new thread instead of using existing
column4: ### Bug description Strava have a feature called "beacon", where it sends a sms with a link so someone can follow my ride. When I sent such a beacon to my wife, I got to choose which SMS-app to use (it is not using any general share mechanism, it seems to be trying to send a SMS). I then selected Signal, and got a new secure conversation to my wife where I sent the message. It seems that she received the message, so that part worked. However, the strange part is that I already have a secure conversation thread with my wife, so I would have expected that thread to be used for this message also instead of creating a separate thread.   ### Steps to reproduce - Setup Strava to send a beacon - Start recording a strava session, then click send beacon - Select Signal to send the beacon  **Actual result:** A new conversation thread is created **Expected result:** Signal should open existing conversation thread for the user.   ### Device info **Device:** Nexus 5X **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0

It happens both on Wifi and 3G internet access.  ### Steps to reproduce difficult to say, Maybe see my log report   **Actual result: MMS is not showing picture like in native Android SMS app **Expected result:** MMS should download picture and show it.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info **Device:**Huawei p8 ALE-L21 **Android version:** 6.0 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/bfb420ffe14e81825be4082d4e909331

column3: Messages not being received by one specific user (who recently switched to Signal)
column4: ### Bug description One specific contact is not receiving any messages from me. They recently switched to using Signal and since then they have not received any of my messages.  ### Steps to reproduce - I used Signal to message with with non-Signal user. - This non-Signal user then switched to using Signal. - Since then, I am able to *receive* messages from this user. But they do not receive any messages from me. - In my Signal client, the message is marked as delievered (double check mark).  ### Device info  **Device:** Moto G4 Play **Android version:** 7.1.2 **Signal version:** 4.9.9  **Other user** is using Android but I don't know the specifics. I can find these out if necessary.  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/38b84642930e1ad4f834a875437e3386

column3: Huge battery drain when on cellular data and no Google Play services
column4: ### Bug description On a Google Play Services free phone and on cellular data, Signal contributes to around ~25% of battery usage during the day. This problem doesn't occur on WiFi.  ### Steps to reproduce - remove Google Play Services (or don't have them in the first place) - turn off Wifi - use Signal  **Actual result:** battery usage is huge. **Expected result:** battery usage should be similar to the case with WiFi  ### Platform info **Operating System**: Android 7.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.12  I also use Telegram and Riot regullary and they do not drain as much battery.  Is there any info I can provide to help fix this issue?  ### Log  Not sure if it will be helpful as it's only a recent one.  [Log](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/35ae5d8fa1a8e4e80d7e54fda46e5ba6)  Screenshots:  [Screenshot 1](https://i.imgur.com/QAvgVA5.png)  [Screenshot 1](https://i.imgur.com/0vQA8lq.png)

column3: Message appears multiple times (Group, 3 members, 2 Signal, 1 SMS)
column4: ### Bug description In a group with 2 members they are using Signal and a non Signal user. A Signal user sent a message (non-Signal message type explicitly chosen), the other Signal member got the message multiple times ... the non Singal user just once. Neither, deletion of the group, peer2peer chat / re-installation of Signal on producers device, or the deletion of peer2peer chat on the Signal receiver device solved the problem ... The message still appears from time to time.  ### Steps to reproduce - Create a group with 2 Signal members and a non Signal member - Send a non-Signal message from a Signal device  **Actual result:** Message appears multiple times (over several days) on the second Signal device within the group. **Expected result:** Message get sent to each device only once.   ### Device info "Message producer" **Device:** Samsung S4 **Android version:** 5.0.1 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Device info "Signal receiver" **Device:** Samsung S7 **Android version:** 7 **Signal version:** 4.1.0  ### Link to debug log Sorry, group, peer2peer chat already deleted.

column3: UpdateApkJob burns CPU time while offline
column4: ### Bug description I'm using the official APK (from https://signal.org/android/apk/) without Google Play Services. Most of the time, my phone is offline. In BetterBatteryStats I see under Partial Wakelocks that org.thoughtcrime.securesms.job.UpdateApkJob is burning lots of CPU time (40-50% on a mostly idle phone), waking the CPU from Deep Sleep.  The name suggests that this is about updating the APK. If so, it would be great if this job would only be started when the phone is online.  ### Device info **Android version:** 4.2.2 **Signal version:** 4.2.4

column3: Crash on startup due to "invalid" email
column4: ### Bug description I used my @vtext.com with plaintext as a destination for email notifications.  ### Steps to reproduce Sign up for FedEx text email notifications using your email to phone number functionality from your provider.  **Actual result:** Signal starts fine **Expected result:** Signal crashes instantly  It seems the NumberUtil class changed recently and I am on the beta.   ### Device info Galaxy S6 Edge  Android 7.0  ### ADB Debug Log -01 20:10:57.965 13153 13205 E AndroidRuntime: Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 13153 08-01 20:10:57.965 13153 13205 E AndroidRuntime: java.lang.AssertionError: Not e164: TrackingUpdates@fedex.com 08-01 20:10:57.965 13153 13205 E AndroidRuntime:        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.database.Address.toPhoneString(Address.java:112) 08-01 20:10:57.965 13153 13205 E AndroidRuntime:        at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.recipients.RecipientProvider.getIndividualRecipientDetails(RecipientProvider.java:136)

column3: Signal update 4.1.0 wiped out lost erased entire message history without plain text backup or like
column4: ### Bug description I opened Signal after an automatic update to 4.1.0. It asked me to re-initialize my phone number as if it were a new install. Once it opened, my message history was completely gone. I re-imported from the sms database, and it only imported everything from before I installed Signal, nearly 6 months ago. I attempted to import from a text backup to see if the update had made one, but it was not found. It appears the message history is lost.   ### Steps to reproduce - Allow Signal to auto update via the play store. - Open Signal - It will ask you to re-initialize your phone number. - Upon successful initialization, find all of your messages lost.  **Actual result:** All of my Signal message history was gone. I was able to re-import SMS messages from before installing Signal the first time, over 6 months ago. **Expected result:** I would still have my SMS message history.    ### Device info **Device:** Google Nexus 5 **Android version:** 0.0.0 **Signal version:** 6.0.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/d153a015ef8574c0cf7bf3092d40c964

column3: LED colors are ignored in Signal settings
column4: ### Bug description I have a TP-LINK Neffos X1 smartphone that runs Android 7.0 now (before upgrade, it was 6.0). This phone has a 3-color LED (red, green, and orange). Basically, when someone sends me a message, the LED blinks in green. In the Signal settings I can choose which LED color I want to use. Let's say I pick up the red one. But when a message comes in, the LED color is still the same, which is green. I tried to check all other options but it looks like that the color is ignored altogether. The only option that works is no LED at all and in all other cases it blinks in green.  All the three LEDs are working properly but they aren't shown under /sys/class/leds/ :   ``` X1:/ # ls -al /sys/class/leds/ total 0 drwxr-xr-x  2 root root 0 2017-08-08 14:51 . drwxr-xr-x 70 root root 0 2017-08-08 14:51 .. lrwxrwxrwx  1 root root 0 2017-08-08 14:51 lcd-backlight -> ../../devices/platform/leds-mt65xx/leds/lcd-backlight ```  Is there a way to change the LED color in the case of this phone? column3: Group chat, some messages missing on one user's device
column4: ### Bug description I have a group with 5 more participants. Some of us wrote each other this afternoon. Looking at another user's device, I noticed there are some messages they received in the chat, that I did not.  ### Device info Device  : OnePlus A0001 (bacon) Android : 6.0.1 (2b5f277d1c, MHC19Q) Memory  : 72M (8.34% free, 512M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : cyanogen App     : Signal 4.3.1  ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/765a99cab323c98017b36b9d68772594

column3: Where can I get protobuf file for SignalServiceProtos.java ?
column4: ### Bug description I am trying to alter some values in server side code, for that to work effectively, I have to change values in SignalServiceProtos.java class, I can't find any .proto file related to the same.  Please let me know. Thanks

column3: Message switching sender and weird base64
column4: ### Bug description I (Remi) was on the desktop client (Chrome, MacOS) texting with Vicky (@VickySteeves, on Android). In the middle of the chat, Remi gets a weird base64-looking message that is dated an hour back. Suddenly, Vicky sees the last message Remi sent before that appears to have been sent by her.  ### Screenshots Remi on desktop: ![Remi on desktop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/426784/23717142/a58268be-0400-11e7-88d2-c8707bf7df5a.png)  Vicky on Android: ![Vicky on Android](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/426784/23717524/2aebaeec-0402-11e7-928a-aedbcd33304a.png)  Remi on Android: ![Remi on Android](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/426784/23717530/34971a9e-0402-11e7-97ae-77f12ded3368.png)  Copied message content: ``` AHppBQOIp+geafFCFhvtfWMS+8HN3Bq5jlwkNPuk9m6a9uMUX/XvlQ6wXs/pm3H+HXnv0iVBJ6rg+w1jI2j+4y+ZqinwYK/sjVv6GneBMLGylrU1kjDaYypVAGXZ/Ne2GILGhtJPrzo= ```  ### Device info  #### Remi's Mac **Device:** Macbook 2012 **MacOS version:** 10.12.3 **Chrome version:** 56.0.2924.87 **Signal version:** 0.32.1 **Signal log:** https://gist.github.com/remram44/261a25feb5ec703c91e7151defdcedf3  #### Remi's Android **Device:** Google Pixel **Android version:** 7.1.1 **Chrome version:** 56.0.2924.87 **Signal version:** 3.30.4  #### Vicky's Android **Device:** LG G5

column3: Facility to set user status and photo which all friends can see is missing. I think this is must
column4: ### Bug description Facility to set user status and photo which all friends can see is missing. I think this is must Any chat app should allow user to set their photo and status message which increases any app usage.   ### Steps to reproduce -- Click on any signal friend and what I see is what i stored in my Phonebook and not the status or photo set by user/friend. This feature can take signal to next level.  **Actual result:** Just colors assigned to each friend and name as in my phonebook. **Expected result:** Need something like whatsapp status , facebook status, telegram status and photos in each user profile, This will make signal no.1 app.  ### Screenshots    ### Device info  **Device:** Manufacturer Model XVI **Android version:** 0.0.0 **Signal version:** 0.0.0  ### Link to debug log

column3: Group MMS threading bug - 4.10.2
column4: ### Bug description After updating to Signal 4.10.2, incoming messages sent to an MMS group are not threaded with previous messages from group.  1. The message was received while I was going through the profile onboarding. Don't think this is relevant. 2. The new group created has my number in there (in conversation title and under group members). The old group does not present my number anywhere. I think this is the bug.  ### Steps to reproduce - Receive MMS message  **Actual result:** Messages are in new thread **Expected result:** Old thread should be continued.   ### Device info  **Device:** Moto G4 Play **Android version:** 7.0.0 **Signal version:** 4.10.2  ### Link to debug log Not sure if needed.

column3: First message as re-registration not marked as delivered
column4: ### Bug description After unregistering and re-registering, the first message I send to a contact gets delivered but not marked as such (the second "tick" does not appear).  ### Steps to reproduce - Register to Signal, send some messages to a contact; - Unregister from Signal (do not uninstall the app, just unregister); - Register again; - Send a message to the same contact. - Actual (buggy) result: Only one "tick" appears. - Expected result: two ticks, as the message is actually   From the second message everything works as expected (two ticks appear).  Runnig Signal 3.31.

column3: After leaving group user is still able to read new messages
column4: ### Bug description After leaving group user is still able to read new messages.  Whats funny that, he cannot leave the group anymore and he is not visible in the group members.  ### Steps to reproduce - Add user to group - Let the user leave the group  **Actual result:** User is still able to receive and read new messages. **Expected result:** User is not able to receive and read new messages.  ### Device info **Signal version:** 4.10.12

column3: [Feature request]: Grey out or disable contacts you aren't talking to to avoid sending info to wrong contact
column4: ### Bug description  It is easy to send sensitive information to the **wrong** **contact** on Signal desktop or mobile. This is especially easy to do if you use Signal continuously throughout the day and alternate between conversations. People who use Signal may be sharing very sensitive information. Misfires can be disastrous.   ### Feature request  Provide a user option that greys out or (better) disables every contact except the one being actively used.  Example of the need: A friend accidentally shared sensitive personal information with a reporter today, and he told her he had done the exact same thing earlier in the day. My friend did this when she moved from Signal IoS to Signal desktop, which had a different contact's window open than on IoS. Yes, she is an idiot, but there are a lot of idiots with sensitive information who are using Signal.  For many Signal users, this would be a very important feature. Finding ways to reduce user error makes Signal safer to use.  ### Device info  **Device:** Iphone 5c **IoS version:** 10.2.1 **Signal version:** 2.7.1  Desktop: MacBookAir OSX Sierra 10.12.3  Signal version: "About Signal" is greyed out

column3: Own avatar not shown
column4: ### Bug description  I often write message to myself, for a number of reasons. I noticed that in the conversations I have with myself, my avatar is now shown, while it is correctly shown on my other contacts' phones.  The Electron Signal-Desktop client does show the avatar.  ### Steps to reproduce - Have a soliloquy - Check the conversations list - that reproduce the bug  **Actual result:** No avatar is shown, just the initial letter of the contact that has my own phone number **Expected result:** My own avatar is shown  ### Device info  **Device:** Google Nexus 6 **Android version:** stock 7.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.12.2  ### Link to debug log  I think it's not relevant in this specific case.

column3: Does not import all SMS messages
column4: ### Bug description  I convinced my wife to install signal. When she imported her prior SMS messages into signal, it only imported a random selection. Some contacts' conversations are missing entirely; for many only inbound messages were imported, not the sent messages, so it ends up showing a one sided conversation.   ### Steps to reproduce 1) send messages on Samsung phone using default app 2) install signal 3) use import messages feature within signal  ### Device info **Device:** Galaxy S5 mini **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 4.2.4

column3: Feature request: Option for Data only / SMS only / Both
column4: # What  An option allowing the user to choose how messages should be sent. For encrypted chat all 3 options would be available. For unencrypted chat only SMS would be available.  # Why  A person   - has ran out of data --> SMS  - has ran out of free texts --> data  - doesn't care --> both  - wants more control  - has a good package and can use both at any time   -------------------------------  I haven't read up on the protocol, but I assume the encryption is end to end and since this once was called TextSecure, encrypted texts should still be possible.

column3: Signal calls are un-muted when backing out of the callscreen
column4: # Signal calls are unmuted when backing out of the callscreen  > I have: > - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates > - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports >  > - - - - - - - - - - > > #### Bug description > > When I mute a Signal call (and the call screen is visible at the time), if I go off of that screen (for example, by hitting the home button or locking my screen) then the call is not muted anymore and the other party can hear what's going on. > > #### Steps to reproduce > > - Open Signal > - Make a call to another Signal member > - Mute the call > - Press the home button or lock your screen (call gets unmuted now) > > **Actual result:** Signal call becomes unmuted and the other party can hear what's going on. > > **Expected result:** Nothing should happen. The call should remain muted when I go out of the call screen, or if the phone's screen is locked. > > #### Screenshots > >  None that accurately show what I need to. > > #### Device info > > **Device:** LG H830 (LG-G5) > > **Android version:** stock Android 7.0 "(1711217429c34, NRD90U)" > > **Signal version:** 4.7.4 > > #### App state > > Signal messages and calls registered, SMS enabled, app passphrase disabled, phone passphrase enabled  > > #### Link to debug log > > https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f560afc33d4975908e839c653ba7aa82

column3: failure of immediate notification of receiving the new messages
column4: ![rtt_push_server_depends_on_lte_state](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33244147/32209077-b8f23272-be49-11e7-89c5-89b390f3b117.png)    I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports  ----------------------------------------  ### Bug description Hello, Sirs. I am Jinsik, a manager of SK Telecom, a telecommunication company in South Korea.  Rececntly I found that your "Signal Private Messenger(android)" has a bug action.  When someone send a message to other's Signal App, the receiver's Signal App doesn't show the notification of receiving a new message. At that time, the receiver has to start  "Signal Private Messenger" manually for receiving the new messages.  So I tested my phone with Signal Private Messenger, and found the some points of improvement for pushing the notification from your push server.  < Testing Phone's Packet Analysis > 1. When the LTE device staying in the state of RRC_CONNECT,       the latency of the international network to your push server(2404:6800:4008:c06::bc)       is good between the handset and your phone.  ( RTT : about 100 msec )  2. But, while the LTE device' state changes from RRC_IDLE to RRC_CONNECT,    the latency to your push server(2404:6800:4008:c06::bc, port:5228)      is too big between the handset and your server as the attachment.( RTT : about 400~1000 msec )    And sometimes the TCP latency causes the TCP retransmission of push packets from your    push server to our phones.  < Check point > 1. Please check that the TCP latency including LTE device state's change may cause    the big network latency and TCP retransmission of push packets.    and it may cause the failure of immediate receiving the notification of a new message arrival.  2. For improving the success rate of receiving the new message notification,      Please consider that your app and push-sever extend the internal TCP or SOCKET timer for     tranporting  push packet and waiting ACK packet for the new message notifiction.        Best Regards, Jinsik  ### Steps to reproduce - install Signal Private Messenger into Android phone in South Korea - Send a new message to it. - Sometimes, app doesn't receive the new messages immediately. - At that time, after restarting app, it can receive the new message.   **Actual result:** Describe here what happens after you run the steps above (i.e. the buggy behaviour) **Expected result:** Describe here what should happen after you run the steps above (i.e. what would be the correct behaviour)  ### Screenshots  attachment file can show the international latency for push packets. and screenshot of app is no notificatino of receiving the new messages.  ### Device info **Device:** Samsung Galaxy S7 **Android version:** 7.0.1 **Signal version:** 4. 11. 5  ### Link to debug log   Sometimes, app doesn't receive the new messages immediately.  At that time, after restarting app, it can receive the new message.
